member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ConfirmationRequest.PhonePat
member.summary: Generated by OD. Only allowed to be empty is IsForSms==true. In that case then it is assumed that OD proper will probably be emailing confirmation and does not want a text message sent.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ConfirmationRequest.DateTimeConfirmExpire
member.summary: Generated by OD. Typically the time of the appointment. This is the time at which HQ will consider this unconfirmed and auto terminate.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ConfirmationRequest.SecondsFromEntryToExpire
member.summary: Generated by OD. HQ and OD proper are in different timezones. This is used to tell HQ how far in advance to set the DateTimeExpire when entering the row into HQ db. This is a work-around for timezone offset.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ConfirmationRequest.ShortGUID
member.summary: Generated by HQ. Identifies this ConfirmationRequest in future transactions between HQ and OD. Will be used for sms confirmations only.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ConfirmationRequest.ConfirmCode
member.summary: Generated by HQ. The code that the patient will text back in order to confirm the appointment. If received then it indicates a positive response.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ConfirmationRequest.MsgTextToMobileTemplate
member.summary: Generated by OD. Includes [ConfirmCode] replacement tag and (optionally) [URL] replacement tag. OD proper can construct this to be any length. Will be converted to final MsgText and sent to patient once tags are replaced with real values.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ConfirmationRequest.MsgTextToMobile
member.summary: Generated by HQ. Applied real text to tags from MsgTextTemplate.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ConfirmationRequest.EmailTextTemplate
member.summary: Generated by OD. Includes [ConfirmCode] replacement tag and (optionally) [URL] replacement tag. OD proper can construct this to be any length. Will be converted to final EmailText and emailed to patient once tags are replaced with real values.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ConfirmationRequest.EmailText
member.summary: Generated by HQ. Applied real text to tags from EmailTextTemplate.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ConfirmationRequest.DateTimeEntry
member.summary: Generated by OD. Timestamp when row is created.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ConfirmationRequest.DateTimeConfirmTransmit
member.summary: Generated by OD. Timestamp when EConnector sent this confirm request to HQ. Stored in local customer timezone.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ConfirmationRequest.DateTimeRSVP
member.summary: Generated by OD. Timestamp when HQ updates this request to indicate that it has been terminated. RSVPStatusCode will change to its final state at this time. Stored in local customer timezone.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ConfirmationRequest.RSVPStatus
member.summary: Enum:RSVPStatusCodes Generated by OD in some cases and HQ in others. Indicates current status in the lifecycle of this ConfirmationRequest.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ConfirmationRequest.ResponseDescript
member.summary: Generated by OD in some cases and HQ in others. Any human readable error message generated by either HQ or EConnector. Used for debugging.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ConfirmationRequest.GuidMessageToMobile
member.summary: FK to SmsToMobile.GuidMessage. Generated at HQ when the confirmation is generated.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ConfirmationRequest.GuidMessageFromMobile
member.summary: FK to SmsFromMobile.GuidMessage. Generated at HQ when the confirmation pending is terminated with confirmation text message. Also allows SmsFromMobile to be linked to ConfirmationRequest in OD proper.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ConfirmationRequest.ShortGuidEmail
member.summary: Generated by HQ. Identifies this ConfirmationRequest in future transactions between HQ and OD. Will be used for email confirmations only.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RSVPStatusCodes.AwaitingTransmit
member.summary: Entered manually by something other than EConnector. EConnector will pickup and send to HQ and change to pendingRsvp.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RSVPStatusCodes.PendingRsvp
member.summary: EConnector has sent this to HQ and will remain in this status until it is either terminated or receives a response from the patient.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RSVPStatusCodes.PositiveRsvp
member.summary: Patient responded with an affirmative confirmation.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RSVPStatusCodes.NegativeRsvp
member.summary: Patient responded and declined the confirmation.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RSVPStatusCodes.Callback
member.summary: Patient responded by requesting a callback.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RSVPStatusCodes.Expired
member.summary: Patient took no action by the time DateTimeExpired passed and the confirmation was terminated.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RSVPStatusCodes.Failed
member.summary: HQ or EConnector was unable to create the confirmation so it was terminated prematurely.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.FamAging
member.summary: This table stores intermediate family aged balances just prior to updating the patient table. Once the aging calculations are finished and the patient table is updated, this table is truncated. At the start of the aging calculations this table is checked and if there are existing rows, we will notify the user and force them to decide whether an aging calculation has already begun or an error happened that prevented the calculations from finishing and the rows are left over and can be deleted.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FamAging.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Also the primary key for this table. Always the PatNum for the Guarantor of a family. A guarantor may not exist in this table if the family does not have a balance. i.e. If a PatNum is not in this table, the aged balance columns on the patient table are set to 0, so either the patient is not the guarantor or the family has a zero balance.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FamAging.Bal_0_30
member.summary: Aged balance from 0 to 30 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family. Only stored with guarantor.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FamAging.Bal_31_60
member.summary: Aged balance from 31 to 60 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family. Only stored with guarantor.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FamAging.Bal_61_90
member.summary: Aged balance from 61 to 90 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family. Only stored with guarantor.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FamAging.BalOver90
member.summary: Aged balance over 90 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family. Only stored with guarantor.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FamAging.InsEst
member.summary: Insurance Estimate for entire family. Only stored with guarantor.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FamAging.BalTotal
member.summary: Total balance for entire family before insurance estimate. Not the same as the sum of the 4 aging balances because this can be negative. Only stored with guarantor.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FamAging.PayPlanDue
member.summary: Amount "due now" for all payment plans such that someone in this family is the payment plan guarantor. This is the total of all payment plan charges past due (taking into account the PayPlansBillInAdvanceDays setting) subtract the amount already paid for the payment plans. Only stored with family guarantor.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.FHIRContactPoint
member.summary: Details of a Technology mediated contact point (phone, fax, email, etc.). https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html#contactpoint .

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FHIRContactPoint.FHIRContactPointNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FHIRContactPoint.FHIRSubscriptionNum
member.summary: FK to fhirsubscription.FHIRSubscriptionNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FHIRContactPoint.ContactSystem
member.summary: Enum:ContactPointSystem

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FHIRContactPoint.ContactValue
member.summary: The actual contact point details.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FHIRContactPoint.ContactUse
member.summary: Enum:ContactPointUse

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FHIRContactPoint.ItemOrder
member.summary: Specify preferred order of use (1 = highest)

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FHIRContactPoint.DateStart
member.summary: Time when the contact point started to be in use.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FHIRContactPoint.DateEnd
member.summary: Timewhen the contact point stopped being used.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ContactPointSystem.Phone
member.summary: The value is a telephone number used for voice calls. Use of full international numbers starting with + is recommended to enable automatic dialing support but not required.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ContactPointSystem.Fax
member.summary: The value is a fax machine. Use of full international numbers starting with + is recommended to enable automatic dialing support but not required.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ContactPointSystem.Email
member.summary: The value is an email address.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ContactPointSystem.Pager
member.summary: The value is a pager number. These may be local pager numbers that are only usable on a particular pager system.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ContactPointSystem.Other
member.summary: A contact that is not a phone, fax, or email address. The format of the value SHOULD be a URL. This is intended for various personal contacts including blogs, Twitter, Facebook, etc. Do not use for email addresses. If this is not a URL, then it will require human interpretation.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ContactPointUse.Home
member.summary: A communication contact point at a home; attempted contacts for business purposes might intrude privacy and chances are one will contact family or other household members instead of the person one wishes to call. Typically used with urgent cases, or if no other contacts are available.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ContactPointUse.Work
member.summary: An office contact point. First choice for business related contacts during business hours.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ContactPointUse.Temp
member.summary: A temporary contact point. The period can provide more detailed information.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ContactPointUse.Old
member.summary: This contact point is no longer in use (or was never correct, but retained for records).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ContactPointUse.Mobile
member.summary: A telecommunication device that moves and stays with its owner. May have characteristics of all other use codes, suitable for urgent matters, not the first choice for routine business.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.SubscriptionStatus
member.summary: The status of a Subscription. https://www.hl7.org/fhir/valueset-subscription-status.html

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SubscriptionStatus.Requested
member.summary: The client has requested the subscription, and the server has not yet set it up.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SubscriptionStatus.Active
member.summary: The subscription is active.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SubscriptionStatus.Error
member.summary: The server has an error executing the notification.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SubscriptionStatus.Off
member.summary: Too many errors have occurred or the subscription has expired.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.SubscriptionChannelType
member.summary: Only rest_hook is supported by Open Dental FHIR. https://www.hl7.org/fhir/valueset-subscription-channel-type.html

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SubscriptionChannelType.Rest_Hook
member.summary: The channel is executed by making a post to the URI. If a payload is included, the URL is interpreted as the service base, and an update (PUT) is made.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SubscriptionChannelType.Websocket
member.summary: The channel is executed by sending a packet across a web socket connection maintained by the client. The URL identifies the websocket, and the client binds to this URL.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SubscriptionChannelType.Email
member.summary: The channel is executed by sending an email to the email addressed in the URI (which must be a mailto:).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SubscriptionChannelType.Sms
member.summary: The channel is executed by sending an SMS message to the phone number identified in the URL (tel:).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SubscriptionChannelType.Message
member.summary: The channel is executed by sending a message (e.g. a Bundle with a MessageHeader resource etc.) to the application identified in the URI.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.UpdateHistory
member.summary: Makes an entry every time Open Dental has successfully updated to a newer version. New entries will always be for the newest version being used so that users can see a "history" of how long they used previous versions. This will also help EHR customers when attesting or when they get audited.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.eServiceSignalSeverity
member.summary: Used to determine that status of the entire service. Order of enum is important, from lowest to highest importance.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.eServiceSignalSeverity.None
member.summary: Service is not in use and is not supposed to be in use.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.eServiceSignalSeverity.NotEnabled
member.summary: Service is not in use and is not supposed to be in use.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.eServiceSignalSeverity.Info
member.summary: Used to convey information. Does not change the "working" status of the service. Will always be inserted with IsProcess=true.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.eServiceSignalSeverity.Working
member.summary: Service is operational and working as designed. Typcially used for heartbeat and initialization.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.eServiceSignalSeverity.Warning
member.summary: Recoverable error has has occurred and no user intervention is required. Typically requires user acknowledgement only.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.eServiceSignalSeverity.Error
member.summary: Recoverable error has has occurred and user intervention is probably required in addition to user acknowledgement only.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.eServiceSignalSeverity.Critical
member.summary: Unrecoverable error and the service has shut itself off. Immediate user intervention is required.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsToMobile.MsgChargeUSD

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsToMobile.IsHidden
member.summary: Messages are hidden, not deleted.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.SmsMessageSource
member.summary: This helps us determine how to handle messages.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsMessageSource.Undefined
member.summary: 0. Should not be used.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsMessageSource.DirectSms
member.summary: 1. This should be used for one-off messages that might be sent as direct communication with patient.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsMessageSource.Recall
member.summary: 2. Used when sending single or batch recall SMS.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsMessageSource.Reminder
member.summary: 3. Used when sending single or batch reminder SMS.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsMessageSource.TestNoCharge
member.summary: 4. Used when sending a test message from HQ. Customer will not be charged for this message.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsMessageSource.Confirmation
member.summary: 5. Used when sending confirmations.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsMessageSource.ConfirmationRequest
member.summary: 6. Used when sending confirmation requests. Will be the subject of automated response processing.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.SmsDeliveryStatus
member.summary: None should never be used, the code should be re-written to not use it.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsDeliveryStatus.None
member.summary: 0. Should not be used.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsDeliveryStatus.Pending
member.summary: 1. After a message has been accepted at ODHQ. Before any feedback.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsDeliveryStatus.DeliveryConf
member.summary: 2. Delivered to customer, carrier replied with confirmation.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsDeliveryStatus.DeliveryUnconf
member.summary: 3. Delivered to customer, no confirmation of failure or delivery sent back from carrier.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsDeliveryStatus.FailWithCharge
member.summary: 4. Attempted delivery, failure message return after arriving at handset.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsDeliveryStatus.FailNoCharge
member.summary: 5. Attempted delivery, immediate failure confirmation received from carrier.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsFromMobile.MsgPart
member.summary: Message part sequence number. For single part messages this should always be 1. For messages that exist as multiple parts, due to staggered delivery of the parts, this will be a number between 1 and MsgTotal.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsFromMobile.MsgTotal
member.summary: Total count of message parts for this single message identified by MsgRefID. For single part messages this should always be 1.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsFromMobile.MsgRefID
member.summary: Each part of a multipart message will have the same MsgRefID.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsFromMobile.SmsStatus
member.summary: Enum:SmsFromStatus .

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SmsFromMobile.Flags
member.summary: Words surrounded by spaces, flags should be all lower case. This allows simple querrying. Example: " junk recall " allows you to write "WHERE Flags like "% junk %" without having to worry about commas. Also, adding and removing tags is easier. Example: Flags=Flags.Replace(" junk ","");

Every MedLab and MedLabResult will have 1 to many laboratories attached.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabFacility.Zip

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabFacility.Phone

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabFacility.DirectorFName

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabSpecimen
member.summary: The EHRLabSpecimen table is structured to tightly with the HL7 standard and should have names that more reflect how the user will consume the data and for that reason for actual implementation we are using these medlab tables. Medical lab specimen. Contains data from the SPM segment. Each MedLab object can have 0 to many specimen segments. Each segment will be its own row in this table.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabSpecimen.MedLabSpecimenNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabSpecimen.MedLabNum
member.summary: FK to medlab.MedLabNum. Each MedLab object can have 0 to many specimens pointing to it.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabSpecimen.SpecimenID
member.summary: SPM.2 - Specimen ID. Unique identifier for the specimen as referenced by the Placer application, the Filler application, or both. The value sent in this field should be the identification value sent on the specimen container.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabSpecimen.SpecimenDescript
member.summary: SPM.14 - Specimen Description. Additional information about the specimen.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabSpecimen.DateTimeCollected
member.summary: SPM.17 - Specimen Collection Date/Time. yyyyMMddHHmm format in the message, no seconds. The date and time when the specimen was acquired from the source. This is a DR - Date/Time Range data type, so it may have more than one component if a specimen was collected over a period of time. The first component is the start date/time so we will make sure to only store SPM.17.1 in this field.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult
member.summary: Medical lab result. The EHRLabResult table is structured too tightly with the HL7 standard and should have names that more reflect how the user will consume the data and for that reason for actual implementation we are using these medlab tables. This table is currently only used for LabCorp, but may be utilized by other third party lab services in the future. These fields are required for the LabCorp result report, used to link the result to an order, or for linking a parent and child result. Contains data from the OBX, ZEF, and applicable NTE segments.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult.MedLabResultNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult.MedLabNum
member.summary: FK to medlab.medLabNum. Each MedLab object can have one or more results pointing to it.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult.ObsID
member.summary: OBX.3.1 - Observation Identifier. Reflex results will have the ObsID of the parent in OBR.26 for linking.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult.ObsText
member.summary: OBX.3.2 - Observation Text. LabCorp report field "TESTS". LabCorp test name.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult.ObsLoinc
member.summary: OBX.3.4 - Alternate Identifier (LOINC). This is the LOINC code for the observation. When displaying the results, LabCorp requires OBX.3.2, the text name of the test to be displayed, not the LOINC code. But we will store it so we can link to the LOINC code table for reporting purposes.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult.ObsLoincText
member.summary: OBX.3.5 - Alternate Observation Text (LOINC Description). The LOINC code description for the observation. We will display OBX.3.2 per LabCorp requirements, but we will store this description for reporting purposes.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult.ObsIDSub
member.summary: OBX.4 - Observation Sub ID. Used to aid in the identification of results with the same Observation ID (OBX.3) within a given OBR. This value is used to tie the results to the same organism. The value in OBX.5.3 tells whether this OBX is the organism, observation, or antibiotic and then the value in OBX.4 links them together as to whether this is for organism #1, organism #2, etc.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult.ObsValue
member.summary: OBX.5.1 - Observation Value. LabCorp report field "RESULT". Can be null if coded entries, prelims, canceled, or >21 chars and being returned as an attached NTE. "TNP" will be reported for Test Not Performed. For value >21 chars in length: OBX.2 will be 'TX' for text, OBX.5 will be NULL (empty field), and the value will be in attached NTEs. Examples: Value less than 21 chars: OBX|1|ST|001180^Potassium, Serum^L||K+ is >6.5 mEq/L.||3.5-5.5|A||N|F|19830527||200605040929|01| Value >21 chars: OBX|6|TX|001180^Potassium, Serum^L||||3.5-5.5|||N|C|19830527||200511071406|01| NTE|1|L|Red cells observed in serum. Glucose may be falsely decreased. NTE|2|L|Potassium may be falsely increased.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult.ObsSubType
member.summary: OBX.5.3 - Data Subtype. Used to identify the coding system. Required if Discrete Microbiology testing is ordered to identify Microbiology Result Type. Example of use: If OBX.5.3 is ORM, then the observation sub ID in OBX.4 is used to associate the result with a specific organism. OBX.4 might contain 1, 2, or 3 meaning the result is for organism #1, organism #2, or organism #3.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult.ObsUnits
member.summary: OBX.6.1 - Identifier. LabCorp report field "UNITS". Units of measure, if too large it will be in the NTE segment.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult.ReferenceRange
member.summary: OBX.7 - Reference Ranges. LabCorp report field "REFERENCE INTERVAL". Only if applicable.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult.AbnormalFlag
member.summary: OBX.8 - Abnormal Flags. LabCorp report field "FLAG". Blank or null is normal. When this is displayed on the LabCorp report it must be the human readable display name, so for example _gt (>) is displayed as "Panic High" and _lt (<) is "Panic Low".

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult.ResultStatus
member.summary: OBX.11 - Observation Result Status.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult.DateTimeObs
member.summary: OBX.14 - Date/Time of Observation. yyyyMMddHHmm format in the message, no seconds. Date and time tech entered result into the Lab System.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult.FacilityID
member.summary: OBX.15 - Producer ID (Producers Reference). LabCorp report field "LAB". ID of LabCorp Facility responsible for performing the testing. The Lab Name is supplied in the ZPS segment.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult.DocNum
member.summary: FK to document.DocNum. ZEF.2 - Embedded File. Each result may have one or more ZEF segments for embedded files. The base-64 text version of the PDF is sent in ZEF.2. If the file size exceeds 50k, then multiple segments will be sent with 50k blocks of the text. When processing, we will concatenate all ZEF.2 fields, create the PDF document, store the file in the patient's image folder, and create an entry in the document table. Then update this field with the pointer to the document table entry.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLabResult.Note
member.summary: NTE.3 at the OBX level. The NTE segment is repeatable and the Comment Text component is limited to 78 characters. Multiple NTE segments can be used for longer comments. All NTE segments at the OBX level will be concatenated and stored in this one field.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.AbnormalFlag
member.summary: MedLab Abnormal Flags. Similar to EhrLabResult.HL70078 abnormal flag enum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.AbnormalFlag.None
member.summary: 0 - None. Blank or null value indicates normal result, so no abnormal flag.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.AbnormalFlag._gt
member.summary: 1 - Panic High. Actual value is ">" but symbol cannot be used as an enum value.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.AbnormalFlag._lt
member.summary: 2 - Panic Low. Actual value is "<" but symbol cannot be used as an enum value.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.AbnormalFlag.A
member.summary: 3 - Abnormal. Applies to non-numeric results.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.AbnormalFlag.AA
member.summary: 4 - Critical Abnormal. Applies to non-numeric results.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.AbnormalFlag.H
member.summary: 5 - Above High Normal.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.AbnormalFlag.HH
member.summary: 6 - Alert High.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.AbnormalFlag.I
member.summary: 7 - Intermediate. For Discrete Microbiology susceptibilities only.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.AbnormalFlag.L
member.summary: 8 - Below Low Normal.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.AbnormalFlag.LL
member.summary: 9 - Alert Low.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.AbnormalFlag.NEG
member.summary: 10 - Negative for Drug Interpretation Codes and Discrete Microbiology.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.AbnormalFlag.POS
member.summary: 11 - Positive for Drug Interpretation Codes and Discrete Microbiology.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.AbnormalFlag.R
member.summary: 12 - Resistant. For Discrete Microbiology susceptibilities only.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.AbnormalFlag.S
member.summary: 13 - Susceptible. For Discrete Microbiology susceptibilities only.

member.summary: Used to identify the coding system. Required if Discrete Microbiology testing is ordered to identify Microbiology Result Type. Example of use: If OBX.5.3 is ORM, then the observation sub ID in OBX.4 is used to associate the result with a specific organism. OBX.4 might contain 1, 2, or 3 meaning the result is for organism #1, organism #2, or organism #3.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataSubtype.Unknown
member.summary: This idicates that we are unable to parse the value from the HL7 message into a data subtype.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataSubtype.ANT

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataSubtype.L

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataSubtype.PDF

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab
member.summary: The EHRLab table is structured to tightly with the HL7 standard and should have names that more reflect how the user will consume the data and for that reason for actual implementation we are using these medlab tables. Medical lab observation order. This table is currently only used for LabCorp, but may be utilized by other third party lab services in the future. These are the fields required for the LabCorp result report, used to link the order to the result(s), specimen(s), place(s) of service, or for linking parent and child results. This table contains data from the PID, ORC, OBR, and applicable NTE segments

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.MedLabNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.ProvNum
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Can be 0. Attempt to match ordering prov external IDs to internal provnum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.SendingApp
member.summary: MSH-2 - Sending Application. Used to identify the LabCorp Lab System sending the results. Possible values for LabCorp (as of their v10.7 specs): '1100' - LabCorp Lab System, 'DIANON' - DIANON Systems, 'ADL' - Acupath Diagnostic Laboratories, 'EGL' - Esoterix Genetic Laboratories. For backward compatibility only: 'CMBP', 'LITHOLINK', 'USLABS'

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.SendingFacility
member.summary: MSH-3 - Sending Facility. Identifies the LabCorp laboratory responsible for the client. It could be a LabCorp assigned 'Responsible Lab Code' representing the responsible laboratory or it could be a CLIA number.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. PID.2 - External Patient ID. LabCorp report field "Client Alt. Pat ID".

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.PatIDLab
member.summary: PID.3 - Lab Assigned Patient Id. LabCorp report field "Specimen Number". LabCorp assigned, alpha numeric specimen number.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.PatIDAlt
member.summary: PID.4 - Alternate Patient ID. LabCorp report field "Patient ID". Alternate patient ID.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.PatAge
member.summary: PID.7.2/7.3/7.4 - Patient Age Years/Months/Days. LabCorp report field "Age (Y/M/D)". YYY/MM/DD format. Three chars for years, 2 each for months and days. Some tests require age for calculation of result. This will be the age at the time of the test, so we will use the values in the message instead of re-calculating..

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.PatAccountNum
member.summary: PID.18.1 - Account Number. LabCorp report field "Account Number". LabCorp Client ID, 8 digit account number.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.PatFasting
member.summary: PID.18.7 - Fasting. LabCorp report field "Fasting". Y, N, or blank. A blank component will be stored as 0 - Unknown, the result report fasting field will be blank.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.SpecimenID
member.summary: ORC.2.1 and OBR.2.1 - Unique Foreign Accession or Specimen ID. LabCorp report field "Client Accession (ACC)". ID sent on the specimen container.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.SpecimenIDFiller
member.summary: ORC.3.1 and OBR.3.1 - Internal (to LabCorp for example)/Filler Accession or Specimen ID. LabCorp assigned specimen number, reused on a yearly basis.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.ObsTestID
member.summary: OBR.4.1 - Observation Battery Identifier. Reflex result will have this value in OBR.29 to link the reflex to the parent.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.ObsTestDescript
member.summary: OBR.4.2 - Observation Battery Text. LabCorp report field "Tests Ordered".

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.ObsTestLoinc
member.summary: OBR.4.4 - Alternate Battery Identifier (LOINC). This is the LOINC code for the test performed. When displaying the results, LabCorp requires OBR.4.2, the text name of the test to be displayed, not the LOINC code. But we will store it so we can link to the LOINC code table for reporting purposes.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.ObsTestLoincText
member.summary: OBR.4.5 - Alternate Observation Battery Text (LOINC Description). The LOINC code description for the test performed. We will display OBR.4.2 per LabCorp requirements, but we will store this description for reporting purposes.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.DateTimeCollected
member.summary: OBR.7 - Observation/Specimen Collection Date/Time. LabCorp report field "Date & Time Collected". yyyyMMddHHmm format in the message, no seconds. May be blank.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.TotalVolume
member.summary: OBR.9 - Collection/Urine Volume (Quantity/Field Value). LabCorp report field "Total Volume". The LabCorp document says this field is "Numeric Characters", but the HL7 documentation data type as CQ, which is a number with units in the form of Quantity^Units. The Units component has subcomponents: ID&Text&Name of Coding System&Alt ID&Alt Text& Name of Alt Coding System&Coding System Version ID&Alt Coding System Version ID&Original Text. We will make this a string column and store the Quantity with the Units ID subcomponent if present. The default unit of measurement is ML, so if the field is a number only we will add ML.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.ActionCode
member.summary: OBR.11 - Action Code. Blank for normal result, "G" for reflex result.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.ClinicalInfo
member.summary: OBR.13.1 - Relevant Clinical Information. LabCorp report field "Additional Information". The report field will be filled with this value from the first OBR record in the message. The message limits this field to 64 characters, the rest is truncated.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.DateTimeEntered
member.summary: OBR.14 - Date/Time of Specimen Receipt in Lab. LabCorp report field "Date Entered". yyyyMMddHHmm format in the message, no seconds. Date and time the order was entered in the Lab System.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.OrderingProvNPI
member.summary: ORC.12.1 and OBR.16.1 - Ordering Provider ID Number. LabCorp report field "NPI". ORC.12.* and OBR.16.* are repeatable, the eighth component identifies the source of the ID in the first component. Component 8 possible values: "U"-UPIN, "P"-Provider Number (Medicaid or Commercial Ins Provider ID), "N"-NPI (Required for third party billing), "L"-Local (Physician ID).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.OrderingProvLocalID
member.summary: ORC.12.1 and OBR.16.1 - Ordering Provider ID Number. LabCorp report field "Physician ID". ORC.12.* and OBR.16.* are repeatable, the eighth component identifies the source of the ID in the first component. Component 8 possible values: "U"-UPIN, "P"-Provider Number (Medicaid or Commercial Ins Provider ID), "N"-NPI (Required for third party billing), "L"-Local (Physician ID).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.OrderingProvLName
member.summary: ORC.12.2 and OBR.16.2 - Ordering Provider Last Name. LabCorp report field "Physician Name". Last, First.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.OrderingProvFName
member.summary: ORC.12.3 and OBR.16.3 - Ordering Provider First Initial. LabCorp report field "Physician Name". Last, First.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.SpecimenIDAlt
member.summary: OBR.18 - Alternate Unique Foreign Accession / Specimen ID. LabCorp report field "Control Number".

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.DateTimeReported
member.summary: OBR.22 - Date/Time Observations Reported. LabCorp report field "Date & Time Reported". yyyyMMddHHmm format in the message, no secs. Date and time the results were released from the Lab System.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.ResultStatus
member.summary: OBR.25 - Order Result Status. LabCorp possible values: "F" - Final, "P" - Preliminary, "X" - Cancelled, "C" - Corrected.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.ParentObsID
member.summary: OBR.26.1 - Link to Parent Result or Organism Link to Susceptibility. A reflex test will have the parent's OBX.3.1 value here for linking.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.ParentObsTestID
member.summary: OBR.29 - Link to Parent Order. A reflex test will have the value from OBR.4.1 of the original order in this field for linking.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.NotePat
member.summary: NTE.3 - Comment Text, PID Level. The NTE segment is repeatable and the Comment Text component is limited to 78 characters. Multiple NTE segments can be used for longer comments. All NTE segments at the PID level will be concatenated and stored in this one field.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.NoteLab
member.summary: NTE.3 - Comment Text, OBR level. The NTE segment is repeatable and the Comment Text component is limited to 78 characters. Multiple NTE segments can be used for longer comments. All NTE segments at the OBR level will be concatenated and stored in this one field.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.FileName
member.summary: Not unique. More than one MedLab object can point to the same FileName, so deleting the MedLab object does not necessarily mean the file can also be deleted. This is the filename of the original archived message that was processed to create this medlab object as well as associated medlabresult, medlabspecimen, and medlabfacility obects. The files will be stored in the OpenDentImages folder in a sub-folder called MedLabHL7. If a message is processed correctly it will be moved into the sub-folder MedLabHL7/Processed. Any message that remains in the MedLabHL7 folder and aren't moved into the Processed folder failed at some point during processing. If the option to store images directly in the database is chosen, this will be an empty field and there will not be the option to display the original HL7 message. This is a relative file path from the ImageStore.GetPreferredAtoZpath(), Example: "MedLabHL7/FileName.txt" OR "MedLabHL7/Processed/FileName.txt" Use: string pathToFile=ODFileUtils.CombinePaths(ImageStore.GetPreferredAtoZpath(),FileName)

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedLab.OriginalPIDSegment
member.summary: The PID Segment from the HL7 message used to generate this MedLab object.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.EhrPatient
member.summary: Patient information needed for EHR. 1:1 relation to patient table. They are stored here because we want to try to keep the size of the patient table a bit smaller.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrPatient.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Also the primary key for this table. Always one to one relationship with patient table. A new patient might not have an entry here until needed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrPatient.MotherMaidenFname
member.summary: Mother's maiden first name. Exported in HL7 PID-6 for immunization messages.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrPatient.MotherMaidenLname
member.summary: Mother's maiden last name. Exported in HL7 PID-6 for immunization messages.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrPatient.VacShareOk
member.summary: Enum:YN Indicates whether or not the patient wants to share their vaccination information with other EHRs. Used in immunization export.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrPatient.MedicaidState
member.summary: The abbreviation for the state for the patient's MedicaidID. Displayed in patient information window, used to validate the length of the MedicaidID.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.OIDExternal.OIDExternalNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.summary: Internal data type to be associated with.

member.summary: This should be a Primary Key to a Table Type defined by the IDType field. Example: If IDType==Patient, then this field should be a PatNum that is a FK to Patient.Patnum

member.summary: The OID extension, when combined with rootExternal it uniquely identifies an object.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.OIDExternal.rootExternal
member.summary: The OID root, when combined with IDExternal it uniquely identifies an object.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.OIDInternal.OIDInternalNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.summary: Internal data type to be associated with OIDRoot

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.OIDInternal.IDRoot
member.summary: This is the root OID for this data type, when combined with extension, uniquely identifies a single object.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.IdentifierType
member.summary: Stored as string. Sorted and displayed in the order they are present in this enum. Root should always be first.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.IdentifierType.Root
member.summary: Will most likely be the root of all other OIDs. Represents the organization.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.IdentifierType.LabOrder
member.summary: FK to ehrlab.EhrLabNum. root+".1"

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.IdentifierType.Patient
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. root+".2"

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.IdentifierType.Provider
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. root+".3"

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.IdentifierType.CqmItem
member.summary: This will be the root for all CQM reported items, like encounters, procedures, problems, etc. root+".4" The extension will be abbreviated name concatenated with the primary key of the object. Examples: pat5231 or medpat197432 or proc231782 or notperf38291. This is only used for generating QRDA documents and requires that the encounter, procedure, etc. is uniquely identified in the reports. The root+".4" makes it unique to this office, the abbreviated name plus primary key makes it unique within the office.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.IdentifierType.Problem
member.summary: FK to disease.DiseaseNum. root+".5"

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.IdentifierType.Appointment
member.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum. root+".6"

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.IdentifierType.InsPlan
member.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum. root+".7"

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.IdentifierType.Procedure
member.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum. root+".8"

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrLabResult.ObservationIdentifierID
member.summary: "LOINC shall be used as the standard coding system for this field if an appropriate LOINC code exists. Appropriate status is defined in the LOINC Manual Section 11.2 Classification of LOINC Term Status. If a local coding system is in use, a local code should also be sent to help with identification of coding issues. When no valid LOINC exists the local code may be the only code sent. When populating this field with values, this guide does not give preference to the triplet in which the standard (LOINC) code should appear." OBX.3.1

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrLabResult.UnitsID
member.summary: "UCUM (Unified Code for Units of Measure) will be evaluated during the pilot for potential subsequent inclusion. As part of the pilot test, for dimensionless units the UCUM representation could be {string}, e.g., for titer the pilot might use {titer} to test feasibility. When sending units of measure as text, they must be placed in the correct component of OBX-6 (CWE_CRE.9)." OBX.6.1

member.summary: Instructions provided to the patient.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrCarePlan.DatePlanned
member.summary: This field does not help much with care plan instructions, but will be more helpful for other types of care plans if we expand in the future (for example, planned procedures). We also saw examples where this date was included in the human readable part of a CCD, but not in the machine readable part.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Ucum
member.summary: Unified Code for Units of Measure. UCUM is not a stricly defined list of codes but is instead a language definition that allows for all units and derived units to be named. Examples: g (grams), g/L (grams per liter), g/L/s (grams per liter per second), g/L/s/s (grams per liter per second per second), etc... are all allowed units meaning there is an infinite number of units that can be defined using UCUM conventions. The codes stored in this table are merely a common subset that was readily available and premade.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Ucum.UcumNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Ucum.UcumCode
member.summary: Indexed. Also called concept code. Example: mol/mL

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Ucum.Description
member.summary: Also called Concept Name. Human readable form of the UCUM code. Example: Moles Per MilliLiter [Substance Concentration Units]

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Ucum.IsInUse
member.summary: True if this unit of measure is or has ever been in use. Useful for assisting users to select common units.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessageUid
member.summary: Used to track which email messages have been downloaded into the inbox for a particular recipient address. Not linked to the email message itself because no link is needed. If we decide to add a foreign key to a EmailMessage later, we should consider what do to when an email message is deleted (set the foreign key to 0 perhaps).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessageUid.EmailMessageUidNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessageUid.MsgId
member.summary: The unique id for the associated EmailMessage.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessageUid.RecipientAddress
member.summary: Copied from the EmailAddress.EmailUsername field when a message is received into the inbox. Similar to the ToAddress of the EmailMessage, except the ToAddress could contain multiple recipient addresses or group email address instead. The recipient address helps match the EmailMessageUid to a particular EmailAddress.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MatchCardinality.One
member.summary: 0 - If any one of the conditions are met from any of the categories.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MatchCardinality.OneOfEachCategory
member.summary: 1 - Must have one match from each of the categories with set values. Categories are :Medication, Allergy, Problem, Vitals, Age, Gender, and Lab Results.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MatchCardinality.TwoOrMore
member.summary: 2 - Must match any two conditions, may be from same category.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MatchCardinality.All
member.summary: 3 - Must match every code defined in the EhrTrigger.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.EhrAmendment
member.summary: Used in EHR only. Stores an entry indicating whether the office has accepted or denied the amendment. Amendments can be verbal or written requests to add information to the patient's record. The provider can either scan / import the document or create a detailed description that indicates what was verbally requested or where the document can be found.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrAmendment.EhrAmendmentNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrAmendment.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrAmendment.IsAccepted
member.summary: Enum:YN Y=accepted, N=denied, U=requested.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrAmendment.Description
member.summary: Description or user-defined location of the amendment. Max length 2000.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrAmendment.Source
member.summary: Enum:AmendmentSource Patient, Provider, Organization, Other. Required.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrAmendment.SourceName
member.summary: User-defined name of the amendment source. For example, a patient name or organization name. Max length 2000.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrAmendment.FileName
member.summary: The file is stored in the A-Z folder in 'EhrAmendments' folder. This field stores the name of the file. The files are named automatically based on Date/time along with EhrAmendmentNum for uniqueness. This meets the requirement of "appending" to the patient's record.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrAmendment.RawBase64
member.summary: The raw file data encoded as base64. Only used if there is no AtoZ folder. This meets the requirement of "appending" to the patient's record.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrAmendment.DateTRequest
member.summary: Date and time of the amendment request.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrAmendment.DateTAcceptDeny
member.summary: Date and time of the amendment acceptance or denial. If there is a date here, then the IsAccepted will be set.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrAmendment.DateTAppend
member.summary: Date and time of the file being appended to the amendment or a link provided.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.AmendmentSource
member.summary: Source Enumeration

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Encounter
member.summary: Mostly used for EHR. This rigorously records encounters using rich automation, so that reporting can be easy and meaningful. Encounters can also be tracked separately using billable procedures. In contrast, encounters in this table are not billable. There can be multiple encounters at one appointment because there can be different types.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Encounter.EncounterNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Encounter.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Encounter.ProvNum
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Encounter.CodeValue
member.summary: FK to ehrcode.CodeValue. This code may not exist in the ehrcode table, it may have been chosen from a bigger list of available codes. In that case, this will be a FK to a specific code system table identified by the CodeSystem column. The code for this item from one of the code systems supported. Examples: 185349003 or 406547006.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Encounter.CodeSystem
member.summary: FK to codesystem.CodeSystemName. This will determine which specific code system table the CodeValue is a FK to. We only allow the following CodeSystems in this table: CDT, CPT, HCPCS, and SNOMEDCT.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Encounter.Note
member.summary: Max length 2000.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Encounter.DateEncounter
member.summary: Date the encounter occurred

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Encounter.Clone
member.summary: Returns a copy of this Encounter.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.PayorType
member.summary: Used to identify the source of payment for a given patient at a given point in time. As insurance is added and removed, rows should be either automatically inserted into this table, or the user should be prompted to specify what the new payor type is. The DateStart of one payor type is interpreted as the end date of the previous payor type. Example: Patient with no insurance may have payortype.SopCode=81 ("SelfPay"). Patient then adds Medicaid insurance and gets a second new PayorType entry with SopCode=2 (Medicaid).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayorType.PayorTypeNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayorType.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayorType.DateStart
member.summary: Date of the beginning of new payor type. End date is the DateStart of the next payor type entry.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayorType.SopCode
member.summary: FK to sop.SopCode. Examples: 121, 3115, etc.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayorType.Note
member.summary: Max length 2000.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.PayorType.Clone
member.summary: Returns a copy of this PayorType.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.EhrNotPerformed
member.summary: For EHR module, these are all the items 'not performed' on patients. Each row will link to the ehrcode table to retrieve relevant data. To join this table to the ehrcode table you must join on CodeValue and CodeSystem. Some items will have associated reasons attached to specify why it was not performed. Those reasons will also be defined in the ehrcode table, so it may be necessary to join with that table again for the data relevant to the reason.

In that case, this will be a FK to a specific code system table identified by the CodeSystem column. The code for this item from one of the code systems supported. Examples: 90656 or 442333005.

member.summary: FK to codesystem.CodeSystemName. The code system name for this code. Possible values are: CPT, CVX, LOINC, SNOMEDCT.

Examples: 182856006 or 419808006.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.EhrCode
member.summary: For EHR module, these are all the codes from various code sets that will affect reporting clinical quality measures. Users cannot edit. This is not an actual table in the database. The codes are loaded from the EHR.dll, so it is a static object, no inserts/updates. Selecting from this 'table' will always use the cache pattern.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrCode.EhrCodeNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrCode.MeasureIds
member.summary: Clinical quality measure test ID's that utilize this code. Comma delimited list. Example: 69v2,147v2.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrCode.ValueSetName
member.summary: The National Library of Medicine Value Set Authority Center assigned value set name. Example: Influenza Vaccination.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrCode.ValueSetOID
member.summary: The value set object identifier for reporting CQM. Example: 2.16.840.1.113883.3.526.3.402.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrCode.QDMCategory
member.summary: The Quality Data Model category for this code. 2 examples: Condition/Diagnosis/Problem or Encounter.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrCode.CodeValue
member.summary: The code from the specified code system. Example: 653.83. This code can belong to multiple value sets, in which case this table will contain multiple rows for this code.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrCode.Description
member.summary: The description for this code. This will frequently be duplicate data, but keeping it here ensures accurate CQM reporting.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrCode.CodeSystem
member.summary: The code system name for this code. Possible values are: CDCREC, CDT, CPT, CVX, HCPCS, ICD9CM, ICD10CM, LOINC, RXNORM, SNOMEDCT, SOP, and AdministrativeSex.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrCode.CodeSystemOID
member.summary: The code system object identifier for reporting CQM. Example: 2.16.840.1.113883.6.103.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EhrCode.IsInDb
member.summary: This is true if the code is in the corresponding table identified by CodeSystem.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc
member.summary: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) used to identify both lab panels and lab results. Widths specified are from LOINC documentation and may not represent length of fields in the Open Dental Database.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.LoincNum
member.summary: Primary key. Internal use only.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.LoincCode
member.summary: #EULA REQUIRED# Also called LOINC_NUM in the official LOINCDB. Width-10. LOINC244 column 1.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.Component
member.summary: #EULA REQUIRED# First Major axis:component or analyte. Width-255. LOINC244 column 2.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.PropertyObserved
member.summary: #EULA REQUIRED# Second major axis:property observed (e.g., mass vs. substance). Width-30. LOINC244 column 3.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.TimeAspct
member.summary: #EULA REQUIRED# Third major axis:timing of the measurement (e.g., point in time vs 24 hours). Width-15. LOINC244 column 4.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.SystemMeasured
member.summary: #EULA REQUIRED# Fourth major axis:type of specimen or system (e.g., serum vs urine). Width-100 LOINC244. column 5.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.ScaleType
member.summary: #EULA REQUIRED# Fifth major axis:scale of measurement (e.g., qualitative vs. quantitative). Width-30. LOINC244 column 6.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.MethodType
member.summary: #EULA REQUIRED# Sixth major axis:method of measurement. Width-50. LOINC244 column 7.

summary.para: #EULA REQUIRED# Width-10. LOINC244 column 13.
ACTIVE = Concept is active. Use at will.
TRIAL = Concept is experimental in nature. Use with caution as the concept and associated attributes may change.

DISCOURAGED = Concept is not recommended for current use. New mappings to this concept are discouraged; although existing may mappings may continue to be valid in context. Wherever possible, the superseding concept is indicated in the MAP_TO field in the MAP_TO table (see Table 28b) and should be used instead.

DEPRECATED = Concept is deprecated. Concept should not be used, but it is retained in LOINC for historical purposes. Wherever possible, the superseding concept is indicated in the MAP_TO field (see Table 28b) and should be used both for new mappings and updating existing implementations..

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.NameShort
member.summary: #EULA REQUIRED# Introduced in version 2.07, this field is a concatenation of the fully specified LOINC name. The field width may change in a future release. Width 40. LOINC244 column 29.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.ClassType
member.summary: 1=Laboratory class; 2=Clinical class; 3=Claims attachments; 4=Surveys. LOINC244 column 16.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.UnitsRequired
member.summary: Y/N field that indicates that units are required when this LOINC is included as an OBX segment in a HIPAA attachment. LOINC244 column 26.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.OrderObs
member.summary: Defines term as order only, observation only, or both. A fourth category, Subset, is used for terms that are subsets of a panel but do not represent a package that is known to be orderable we have defined them only to make it easier to maintain panels or other sets within the LOINC construct. LOINC244 column 30.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.HL7FieldSubfieldID
member.summary: A value in this field means that the content should be delivered in the named field/subfield of the HL7 message. When NULL, the data for this data element should be sent in an OBX segment with this LOINC code stored in OBX-3 and with the value in the OBX-5. Width 50. LOINC244 column 32.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.ExternalCopyrightNotice
member.summary: External copyright holders copyright notice for this LOINC code. LOINC244 column 33. Colwidth=4000.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.NameLongCommon
member.summary: This field contains the LOINC term in a more readable format than the fully specified name. The long common names have been created via a table driven algorithmic process. Most abbreviations and acronyms that are used in the LOINC database have been fully spelled out in English. Width 255. LOINC244 column 35.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.UnitsUCUM
member.summary: The Unified Code for Units of Measure (UCUM) is a code system intended to include all units of measures being contemporarily used in international science, engineering, and business. (www.unitsofmeasure.org ) This field contains example units of measures for this term expressed as UCUM units. Width 255. LOINC244 column 1.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.RankCommonTests
member.summary: Ranking of approximately 2000 common tests performed by laboratories in USA. LOINC244 column 45.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Loinc.RankCommonOrders
member.summary: Ranking of approximately 300 common orders performed by laboratories in USA. LOINC244 column 46.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.SecurityLogHash
member.summary: Stores hashes of audit logs for detecting alteration. User not allowed to edit.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SecurityLogHash.SecurityLogHashNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SecurityLogHash.SecurityLogNum
member.summary: FK to securityLog.SecurityLogNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SecurityLogHash.LogHash
member.summary: The SHA-256 hash of PermType, UserNum, LogDateTime, LogText, and PatNum, all concatenated together. This hash has length of 32 bytes encoded as base64. Used to detect if the entry has been altered outside of Open Dental.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.PatientRace
member.summary: Each patient may have multiple races. Used to represent a race or an ethnicity for a patient.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatientRace.PatientRaceNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatientRace.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

member.summary: Enum:PatRace

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatientRace.CdcrecCode
member.summary: FK to cdcrec.CdcrecCode. This code is mainly for Ehr reporting, but may also be used for other HL7 messages. Will be blank if they choose a race, like Aboriginal, that is not in the cdcrec code list. We will initially only use 8 of the cdcrec race codes, see enum below.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.PatRace
member.summary: This enum was not able to completely replace the old enum because we keep string representations of the old enums in certain places like sheets and HL7.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatRace.Aboriginal
member.summary: 0 - Hidden for EHR.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatRace.AfricanAmerican
member.summary: 1 - CDCREC:2054-5 Race

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatRace.AmericanIndian
member.summary: 2 - CDCREC:1002-5 Race

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatRace.Asian
member.summary: 3 - CDCREC:2028-9 Race

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatRace.DeclinedToSpecifyRace
member.summary: 4 - Our hard-coded option for EHR reporting.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatRace.HawaiiOrPacIsland
member.summary: 5 - CDCREC:2076-8 Race

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatRace.Hispanic
member.summary: 6 - CDCREC:2135-2 Ethnicicty. If EHR is turned on, our UI will force this to be supplemental to a base 'race'.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatRace.Multiracial
member.summary: 7 - We had to keep this for backward compatibility. Hidden for EHR because it's explicitly not allowed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatRace.Other
member.summary: 8 - CDCREC:2131-1 Race.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatRace.White
member.summary: 9 - CDCREC:2106-3 Race

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatRace.NotHispanic
member.summary: 10 - CDCREC:2186-5 Ethnicity. We originally used the lack of Hispanic to indicate NonHispanic. Now we are going to explicitly store NonHispanic to make queries for ClinicalQualityMeasures easier.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatRace.DeclinedToSpecifyEthnicity
member.summary: 11 - Our hard-coded option for EHR reporting.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationCriterion

member.summary: Description that is displayed for the criterion.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationCriterion.IsCategoryName
member.summary: This row will show in bold and will not have a grade attached to it.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationCriterion.GradingScaleNum
member.summary: FK to gradingscale.GradingScaleNum. The grading scale used for this criterion. Having this here allows the instructor to edit saved grades and also allows the evaluation overall grade to consider whether to include this criterion in the calculation.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationCriterion.GradeShowing
member.summary: Copied from gradingscaleitem.GradeShowing. Required. For example A, B, C, D, F, or 1-10, pass, fail, 89, etc. Except for percentages, must come from pick list.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationCriterion.GradeNumber
member.summary: Copied from gradingscaleitem.GradeNumber. Required. For example A=4, A-=3.8, pass=1, percentages stored as 89, etc. Except for percentages, must come from pick list.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationCriterion.Notes
member.summary: A note about why this student received this particular grade on this criterion.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationCriterion.ItemOrder
member.summary: Copied from item order of def. Defines the order that all the criteria show on the evaluation. User not allowed to change here, only in the def.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationCriterion.MaxPointsPoss
member.summary: For ScaleType=Points, sets the maximum value of points for this criterion.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.GradingScaleItem
member.summary: Only used when GradingScale.ScaleType=PickList, not Percentage or Points. The specific grades allowed on a scale. Contains both the GradeShowing and the equivalent number. There are no FKs to these items. The values are all copied from here into student records as they are used.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.GradingScaleItem.GradingScaleItemNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.GradingScaleItem.GradingScaleNum
member.summary: FK to gradingscale.GradingScaleNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.GradingScaleItem.GradeShowing
member.summary: For example A, B, C, D, F. Optional. If not specified, it shows the number.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.GradingScaleItem.GradeNumber
member.summary: For example A=4, A-=3.8, pass=1, etc. Required. Enforced to be equal to or less than GradingScale.MaxPointsPoss.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.GradingScaleItem.Description
member.summary: Optional additional info about what this particular grade means. Just used as guidance and does not get copied to the individual student record.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationCriterionDef
member.summary: Rows on an evaluation def. The individual items that will be graded. Criterion Defs

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationCriterionDef.EvaluationCriterionDefNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationCriterionDef.EvaluationDefNum
member.summary: FK to evaluationdef.EvaluationDefNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationCriterionDef.CriterionDescript
member.summary: Description that is displayed for the criterion.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationCriterionDef.IsCategoryName
member.summary: This row will show in bold and will not have a grade attached to it.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationCriterionDef.GradingScaleNum
member.summary: FK to gradingscale.GradingScaleNum. The grading scale used for this criterion. As a user builds an evaluationDef, each criterion should default to the GradingScaleNum of the EvaluationDef, and then the user can change if needed. The individual criteria do not have to be the same scale as the evaluation.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationCriterionDef.ItemOrder
member.summary: Defines the order that all the criteria show on the evaluation. Copied to ItemOrder of actual criterion.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationCriterionDef.MaxPointsPoss
member.summary: For ScaleType=Points, sets the maximum value of points for this criterion.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationDef
member.summary: An evaluation def is the entire form that the instructor sets up ahead of time. Actual evaluations for students are copied from these 'templates', so an evaluation def can be altered or deleted without damaging any student record. Evaluation defs are usually not specific to instructors, but if different instructors want different evaluation forms, they can use the description column to differentiate. For example, the description can include the instructor's name or even the year. But most commonly, the same evaluation will be used from year to year. There should be a duplicate function to make a copy an entire evaluation def and then allow user to alter the SchoolCourseNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationDef.EvaluationDefNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationDef.SchoolCourseNum
member.summary: FK to schoolcourse.SchoolCourseNum. For example to PEDO 732.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationDef.EvalTitle
member.summary: Description of this evaluation form.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EvaluationDef.GradingScaleNum
member.summary: FK to gradingscale.GradingScaleNum. The default grading scale for this evaluation. Each criterion will typically use the same scale, but that is not required.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.GradingScale
member.summary: Used in Evaluations. Describes a scale to be used in grading. Freeform scales are not allowed. Percentage scales are handled a little differently than the other scales.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.GradingScale.GradingScaleNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.GradingScale.ScaleType
member.summary: Enum:EnumScaleType Used to determine method of assigning grades. PickList will be the only type that has GradingScaleItems.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.GradingScale.Description
member.summary: For example, A-F or Pass/Fail.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.EnumScaleType
member.summary: Used in GradingScale to determine how grades are assigned.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EnumScaleType.PickList
member.summary: 0- User-Defined list of possible grades. Grade is calculated as an average.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EnumScaleType.Percentage
member.summary: 1- Percentage Scale 0-100. Grade is calculated as an average.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EnumScaleType.Weighted
member.summary: 2- Allows point values for grades. Grade is calculated as a sum of all points out of points possible.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Evaluation
member.summary: An evaluation is for one student and is copied from an EvaluationDef.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Evaluation.EvaluationNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Evaluation.InstructNum
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Evaluation.StudentNum
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Evaluation.SchoolCourseNum
member.summary: FK to schoolcourse.SchoolCourseNum. For example to PEDO 732.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Evaluation.EvalTitle
member.summary: Copied from evaluation def. Not editable.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Evaluation.DateEval
member.summary: Date of the evaluation.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Evaluation.GradingScaleNum
member.summary: FK to gradingscale.GradingScaleNum. The overall grading scale for this evaluation. Copied from EvaluationDef. Criteria will not all necessarily have the same scale.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Evaluation.OverallGradeShowing
member.summary: OverallGradeNumber is calculated as described below. Once the nearest number on the scale is found, the corresponding gradescaleitem.GradeShowing is used here.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Evaluation.OverallGradeNumber
member.summary: Always recalculated as each individual criterion is changed, so no risk of getting out of synch. Only considers criteria on the evaluation that use the same grading scale as the evaluation itself. It's an average of all those criteria. When averaging, the result will almost never exactly equal one of the numbers in the scale, so the nearest one must be found and used here. For example, if the average is 3.6 on a 4 point scale, this will show 4. Percentages will be rounded to the nearest whole number. This is the value that will be returned in reports and also used in calculations of the student's grade for the term.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Evaluation.Notes
member.summary: Any note that the instructor wishes to place at the bottom of this evaluation.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridCell
member.summary: Holds one recorded cell value for a tooth grid, which is a special kind of sheet field type that shows a grid with 32 rows and configurable columns. The entire grid is a single large sheet field.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridCell.ToothGridCellNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridCell.SheetFieldNum
member.summary: FK to sheet.SheetFieldNum. Required.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridCell.ToothGridColNum
member.summary: FK to toothgridcol.ToothGridColNum. This tells which column it belongs in. Can't use the column name here because multiple columns could have the same name.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridCell.ValueEntered
member.summary: Cannot be empty. For a tooth-level cell, the only allowed value is X. If the cell is unchecked, then it won't even have a row in this table. For a surface level column, only valid surfaces can be entered:MOIDBFLV Enforced. FreeText columns can have any text up to 255 char.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridCell.ToothNum
member.summary: Corresponds exactly to procedurelog.ToothNum. May be blank, otherwise 1-32, 51-82, A-T, or AS-TS, 1 or 2 char. Gets internationalized as being displayed.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridCol
member.summary: Defines the columns present in a single completed tooth grid, which is a special kind of sheet field that shows a grid with 32 rows and configurable columns. The entire grid is a single large sheet field. This table defines how the grid is layed out on an actual sheet, pulled initially from a ToothGridDef. The data itself is recorded in ToothGridCell.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridCol.ToothGridColNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridCol.SheetFieldNum
member.summary: FK to sheet.SheetFieldNum. Required.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridCol.NameItem
member.summary: Pulled from the ToothGridDef. This can be a NameInternal , or it can be a NameShowing if it's a user-defined column.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridCol.CellType
member.summary: Enum:ToothGridCellType 0=HardCoded, 1=Tooth, 2=Surface, 3=FreeText.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridCol.ItemOrder
member.summary: Order of the column to display. Every entry must have a unique itemorder.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridCol.CodeNum
member.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum. This allows data entered to flow into main program as actual completed or tp procedures.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridCol.ProcStatus
member.summary: Enum:ProcStat If these flow into main program, then this is the status that the new procs will have.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridDef
member.summary: Defines the columns present in a tooth grid, which is a special kind of sheet field def that shows a grid with 32 rows and configurable columns. Can be edited without damaging any completed sheets.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridDef.ToothGridDefNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridDef.NameShowing
member.summary: The user may override the internal name for display purposes. If this is a user-defined column, this is the only name, since there is no NameInternal.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridDef.CellType
member.summary: Enum:ToothGridCellType 0=HardCoded, 1=Tooth, 2=Surface, 3=FreeText.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridDef.ItemOrder
member.summary: Order of the column to display. Every entry must have a unique itemorder.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridDef.CodeNum
member.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum. This allows data entered to flow into main program as actual completed or tp procedures.

member.summary: Enum:ProcStat If these flow into main program, then this is the status that the new procs will have.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.ToothGridCellType
member.summary: 0=HardCoded, 1=Tooth, 2=Surface, 3=FreeText.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.DocumentMisc
member.summary: For storing docs/images in database. This table is for the various miscellaneous documents that are not in the normal patient subfolders.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DocumentMisc.DocMiscNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DocumentMisc.DateCreated
member.summary: Date created.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DocumentMisc.FileName
member.summary: The name the file would have if it was not in the database. Does not include any directory info. DocumentMisc rows that store the contents of the UpdateFiles folder will set this column to an "item order". Due to severe limitations with sending large amounts of data all in one query we are going to store the UpdateFiles over several rows. The FileName column will store the order of which the UpdateFiles need to go back into when we try to reconstruct it.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DocumentMisc.DocMiscType
member.summary: Enum:DocumentMiscType Corresponds to the same subfolder within AtoZ folder. eg. UpdateFiles

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DocumentMisc.RawBase64
member.summary: The raw file data encoded as base64.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.DocumentMisc.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this DocumentMisc.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.DocumentMiscType
member.summary: More types will be added to correspond to most of the subfolders inside the AtoZ folder. But no point adding them until we implement.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DocumentMiscType.UpdateFiles
member.summary: 0- There will just be zero or one row of this type. It will contain a zipped archive.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DocumentMiscType.UpdateFilesSegment
member.summary: 1- Entries with this doc type hold segments of the UpdateFiles RawBase64 zip contents that will be pieced back together later. Storing the entire Update Files contents into one row was exceeding MySQL max_allowed_packet limitations so this new type is required. Each row of this type will contain ~1MB of RawBase64 data.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.DashboardAR

One entry per month going back at least 12 months. This table gets automatically filled the first time that the dashboard is used. The most recent month also gets added by using the dashboard.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.HL7DefMessage
member.summary: There is no field for MessageStructureHL7 (ADT_A01), because that will be inferred. Defined in HL7 specs, section 2.16.3.

member.summary: Stored in db as string, but used in OD as enum MessageTypeHL7. Example: ADT

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.HL7DefMessage.EventType

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.HL7DefMessage.InOrOut
member.summary: Enum:InOutHL7 Incoming, Outgoing

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.HL7DefMessage.ItemOrder
