member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.HL7DefMessage.Note
member.summary: text

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.HL7DefMessage.MessageStructure
member.summary: Stored in db as string, but used in OD as enum MessageStructure. Example: ADT_A01, which is the structure used for event types A01, A04, A08, and A13.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.HL7DefMessage.hl7DefSegments
member.Summary: List of segments associated with this hierarchical definition. Use items in this list to get to items lower in the hierarchy.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.MessageTypeHL7
member.summary: The items in this enumeration can be freely rearranged without damaging the database. But can't change spelling or remove existing item.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageTypeHL7.NotDefined
member.summary: Use this for unsupported message types

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageTypeHL7.ACK
member.summary: Message Acknowledgment

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageTypeHL7.ADT
member.summary: Demographics - A01,A04,A08,A28,A31

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageTypeHL7.DFT
member.summary: Detailed Financial Transaction - P03

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageTypeHL7.ORU
member.summary: Unsolicited Observation Message - R01

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageTypeHL7.PPR
member.summary: Patient Problem - PC1,PC2,PC3

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageTypeHL7.SIU
member.summary: Schedule Information Unsolicited - Event types S12 through S26. Currently only S12, S14, S15, and S17 events are supported. Inbound for eCW, outbound for other interfaces.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageTypeHL7.SRM
member.summary: Schedule Request Message - Event types S01 through S11. Currently only S03 and S04 events are supported. Not used for eCW, inbound for other interfaces.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageTypeHL7.SRR
member.summary: Schedule Request Response - Event types S01 through S11. Currently only S03 and S04 events are supported. Not used for eCW, inbound for other interfaces.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageTypeHL7.VXU
member.summary: Unsolicited Vaccination Record Update - V04

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.EventTypeHL7
member.summary: The items in this enumeration can be freely rearranged without damaging the database. But can't change spelling or remove existing item.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EventTypeHL7.NotDefined
member.summary: Use this for unsupported event types

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EventTypeHL7.A04
member.summary:
Only used with ADT/ACK.
A04 - Register a Patient
For eCW, the A04 and A08 are inbound messages and are processed the same. We attempt to locate the patient, if not found we insert one.
For other interfaces, the same method of locating a patient and if not found inserting one will be used for inbound ADT^A04 and ADT^A08 messages.
Outbound messages will have an A04 event type if a new patient is added

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EventTypeHL7.A08
member.summary:
Only used with ADT/ACK.
A08 - Update Patient Info
A04 and A08 inbound are processed the same, but we will send the A08 event type if updating a patient in an outbound ADT.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EventTypeHL7.P03
member.summary: Only used with DFT/ACK.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EventTypeHL7.PC1
member.summary:
Only used with PPR/ACK (Patient Problem messages).
Not used for eCW.
These are inbound messages for adding/updating patient problems.
PC1 is the Add event. Add and Update events will be handled the same for now.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EventTypeHL7.PC2
member.summary:
Only used with PPR/ACK (Patient Problem messages).
Not used for eCW.
PC2 is the Update event. Add and Update events will be handled the same for now.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EventTypeHL7.S03
member.summary:
Only used with SRM/SRR/ACK. S03 - Request Appointment Modification.
Not used for eCW.
These will be inbound and are used for updating a limited amount of information for an existing appointment.
S03 messages are used to update appointments.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EventTypeHL7.S04
member.summary:
Only used with SRM/SRR/ACK. S04 - Request Appointment Cancellation.
Not used for eCW.
S04 messages are used to set an appointment.AptStatus to ApptStatus.Broken.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EventTypeHL7.S12
member.summary:
Only used with SIU/ACK.
S12 - New Appt
For eCW, these are inbound, OD is considered an auxiliary application, and S12 and S14 messages are processed the same.
For interfaces that require outbound SIU messages, OD is considered the filler application since OD has control over the operatories and schedules.
As the filler application, events S12-S26 are the message events and they all have the same structure defined by HL7.
Different actions in OD will cause a different outbound event type to be inserted, but the defined segments and fields will otherwise be the same.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EventTypeHL7.S13
member.summary:
Only used with SIU/ACK.
S13 - Appt Rescheduling

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EventTypeHL7.S14
member.summary:
Only used with SIU/ACK.
S14 - Appt Modification

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EventTypeHL7.S15
member.summary:
Only used with SIU/ACK.
S15 - Appt Cancellation

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EventTypeHL7.S17
member.summary:
Only used with SIU/ACK.
S17 - Appt Deletion

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageStructureHL7.NotDefined
member.summary: Use this for unsupported message structures

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageStructureHL7.ADT_A01
member.summary:
Used for ADT/ACK event types A01, A04, A08, and A13.
We currently only support A04 and A08 event types, both will use this structure.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageStructureHL7.DFT_P03
member.summary:
Used for DFT/ACK event type P03.
All outbound DFT's are this structure.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageStructureHL7.ORU_R01
member.summary:
Used for ORU/ACK event type R01.
All inbound ORU - Unsolicited transmission of an observation message will use this structure.
This is used for all inbound LabCorp messages.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageStructureHL7.PPR_PC1
member.summary:
Used for PPR/ACK event types PC1, PC2, and PC3.
We currently only support PC1 (add problem) and PC2 (update problem), both use this structure.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageStructureHL7.SIU_S12
member.summary:
Used for SIU/ACK event types S12 through S24 and S26.
We currently only support S12 through S17.
Inbound SIU's are all treated the same, regardless of the event type.
We send different event types in outbound SIU's depending on the action that causes the message.
All SIU's, inbound or outbound, use this message structure.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageStructureHL7.SRM_S01
member.summary:
Used for SRM/ACK event types S01 through S11.
We currently only support S03 (update appt request) and S04 (cancel appt request).
SRM's are inbound and when the action of updating or cancelling the appt is completed, an SRR is sent.
SRM's and SRR's still require ACK's. i.e. SRM received, ACK sent, action completed leads to SRR sent, ACK received.
SRM's and SRR's will all use this message structure.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MessageStructureHL7.SRR_S01
member.summary:
Used for SRR/ACK event types S01 through S11.
We currently only support S03 and S04 (see SRM_S01).
SRR's are outbound and sent when an SRM is processed correctly.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.HL7InternalType
member.summary: Stored in the database as a string. The items in this enumeration can be freely rearranged without damaging the database. But can't change spelling or remove existing items.

summary.para: Message structure is identical to eCWTight, minor changes in the program like showing patient demographics and the account module.
Like eCWTight, eCW dictates the patients' PatNums in PID.2, so we try to locate the patient with that PatNum.
If not found we do not attempt to use PID.4 ChartNumber or name, we assume new patient and insert.
Only Incoming ADT messages are processed, OD is responsible for adding patients so we assign PatNum.
The incoming messages patient ID in PID.2 is stored as ChartNumber and PID.4 is not processed.
The Account and Chart modules are visible and the users can change and add patients in OD. No outgoing messages.
Patient demographics are hidden as well as account and appt modules.
We let eCW dictate the PatNum values in PID.2 and trust that they are unique and longs (no string characters).
Unlike Standalone, if the pat isn't found by PID.2 PatNum we don't try to locate the pat by PID.4 ChartNumber or name, we assume it's a new pat.
Account and Appointment modules are visible and users can change and add patients.
Only outgoing DFT message defined, no incoming messages are processed.
Our default behavior for processing and sending HL7 messages.
Send and receive ADT and SIU messages, receive DFT messages.
The v2.6 documentation claims both PID.2 and PID.4 are only retained for backward compatibility and PID.3 is now required and used for a list of patient IDs.
We will still put ChartNumber in PID.2 (used to be referred to as 'external ID' by HL7 doc) for outgoing msgs and look for our PatNum in PID.2 for incoming msgs.
We will now also check PID.3 for a repitition that contains our PatNum as part of the CX data type.
Account and Appointments module are visible and users can change and add patients.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.HL7InternalType.MedLabv2_3
member.summary:
This is currently used for LabCorp and is based on HL7 version 2.3 specifications.
This interface has been built to the LabCorp standards and may not match the HL7 version 2.3 specs exactly.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7
member.summary: Data types are listed in HL7 docs section 2.15. The items in this enumeration can be freely rearranged without damaging the database. But can't change spelling or remove existing item.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.CE
member.summary: Coded element. Has been replaced in v2.6 with CNE and CWE, retained for backward compatibility only.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.CNE
member.summary: Coded with no exceptions. Examples: ProcCode (Dxxxx) or TreatmentArea like tooth^surface

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.CP
member.summary: Composite price. Example: 125.00

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.CQ
member.summary: Composite quantity with units. Example: 123.7^kg

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.CWE
member.summary: Coded with exceptions. Example: Race: American Indian or Alaska Native,Asian,Black or African American,Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific,White, Hispanic,Other Race.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.CX
member.summary: Extended composite ID with check digit. Example: patient.PatNum or patient.ChartNumber or appointment.AptNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.DT
member.summary: Date. yyyyMMdd. 4,6,or 8

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.DTM
member.summary: Date/Time. yyyyMMddHHmmss etc. Allowed 4,6,8,10,12,14. Possibly more, but unlikely.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.EI
member.summary: Entity identifier. Example: appointment.AptNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.EIP
member.summary: Entity identifier pair.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.FT
member.summary: Formatted text data. We support new lines identified by '\.br\' (where '\' is the defined escape char, \ is the default)

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.HD
member.summary: Hierarchic designator. Application identifier. Example: "OD" for OpenDental.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.ID
member.summary: Coded value for HL7 defined tables. Must include TableId. Example: 0003 is eCW's event type table id.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.IS
member.summary: Coded value for user-defined tables. Example: Administrative Sex, F=Female, M=Male,U=Unknown.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.MSG
member.summary: Message type. Example: composed of messageType^eventType like DFT^P03

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.NM
member.summary: Numeric. Example: transaction quantity of 1.0

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.PL
member.summary: Person Location. ^^^^^Person Location Type^^^Location Description. Example: ^^^^^S^^^West Salem Elementary. S=site (or grade school) description.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.PRL
member.summary: Parent Result Link.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.PT
member.summary: Processing type. Examples: P-Production, T-Test.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.SI
member.summary: Sequence ID. Example: for repeating segments number that begins with 1.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.ST
member.summary: String, alphanumeric. Example: SSN or patient.FeeSchedule

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.TQ
member.summary: Timing quantity. Example: for eCW appointment ^^duration^startTime^endTime like ^^1200^20120101112000^20120101114000 for 20 minute (1200 second) appointment starting at 11:20 on 01/01/2012

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.Varied
member.summary: Used if the data type for a field can vary based on other factors. For example, when the field is a test observation value, the data type depends on the type of test and how the results of the test are reported.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.VID
member.summary: Version identifier. Example: 2.3

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.XAD
member.summary: Extended address. Example: Addr1^Addr2^City^State^Zip like 120 Main St.^Suite 3^Salem^OR^97302

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.XCN
member.summary: Extended composite ID number and name for person. Example: provider.EcwID^provider.LName^provider.FName^provider.MI

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.XON
member.summary: Extended composite ID number and name for organizations.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.XPN
member.summary: Extended person name. Composite data type. Example: LName^FName^MI).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DataTypeHL7.XTN
member.summary: Extended telecommunication number. Example: 5033635432

Not at plan level because might be specific to subscriber. If blank, we try to display a benefitNote for another subscriber to the plan.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsSub.SubscNote

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsSub.SecDateTEdit

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.InsSub.Copy

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Guardian
member.summary: Links patient to patient in a many to many database relationship. The two PatNums need not be in the same family, but will usually be. The two PatNums could be in different families if the relationship was entered, then one of the patients in the relationship is moved to another family. This table can also be used for other relationship types besides guardians. The table name is guardian because we only supported guardian relationships in the past, and we did not want to risk breaking queries by changing the table or column names. User can specify any relationship as a guardian or not a guardian. For example, a retired person might specify their brother or child as their guardian, or the user may want to record the brother of a patient as a non-guardian.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Guardian.GuardianNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Guardian.PatNumChild
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. If Relationship is "Mother", then this PatNum is the child of the mother.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Guardian.PatNumGuardian
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. If Relationship is "Mother", then this is the PatNum of the mother.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Guardian.Relationship
member.summary: Enum:GuardianRelationship .

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Guardian.IsGuardian
member.summary: True if this specifies a guardian relationship, or false if any other relationship. When this flag is true, the relationship will show in the "Guardians" appointment view field and in the family module "Guardians" display field for the patient. This also grants PHI access in the patient portal to the specific patient designated via PatNumChild.

member.summary: The exact server time when this signal was entered into db. This does not need to be set by sender since it's handled automatically.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.KeyType.SmsMsgUnreadCount
member.summary: 7 - Special KeyType that does not use a FK but instead will set FKey to a count of unread messages. Used along side the SmsTextMsgReceivedUnreadCount InvalidType.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.TableBase
member.summary: The base class for classes that correspond to a table in the database. Make sure to mark each derived class [Serializable].

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.TableBase.IsNew
member.summary: Not a db column. Always false by default. Will only be true if explicitly set to true by programmer. When CRUD grabs a table from db, it is naturally set to False. Once set, this value is not used by the CRUD in any manner. Just used by the programmer for making decisions about whether to Insert or Update.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.TimeCardRule
member.summary: A rule for automation of timecard overtime. Can apply to one employee or all.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TimeCardRule.TimeCardRuleNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TimeCardRule.EmployeeNum
member.summary: FK to employee.EmployeeNum. If zero, then this rule applies to all employees.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TimeCardRule.OverHoursPerDay
member.summary: Typical example is 8:00. In California, any work after the first 8 hours is overtime.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TimeCardRule.AfterTimeOfDay
member.summary: Typical example is 16:00 to indicate that all time worked after 4pm for specific employees is at differential rate.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TimeCardRule.BeforeTimeOfDay
member.summary: Typical example is 6:00 to indicate that all time worked before 6am for specific employees is at differential rate.

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.TimeCardRule.OverHoursPerDayXml
member.summary: Used only for serialization purposes

member.summary: Used only for serialization purposes

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.TimeCardRule.BeforeTimeOfDayXml
member.summary: Used only for serialization purposes

member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.VaccineDef.VaccineName
member.summary: Name of vaccine. RXA-5-2.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.VaccineDef.DrugManufacturerNum

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.VaccinePat

member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.VaccinePat.VaccineDefNum
member.summary: FK to vaccinedef.VaccineDefNum. Can be 0 if and only if CompletionStatus=NotAdministered, in which case CVX code is assumed to be 998 (not administered) and there is no manufacturer.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.VaccinePat.DateTimeStart
member.summary: The datetime that the vaccine was administered.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.VaccinePat.DateTimeEnd
member.summary: Typically set to the same as DateTimeStart. User can change.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.VaccinePat.AdministeredAmt
member.summary: Size of the dose of the vaccine. 0 indicates unknown and gets converted to 999 on HL7 output.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.VaccinePat.DrugUnitNum
member.summary: FK to drugunit.DrugUnitNum. Unit of measurement of the AdministeredAmt. 0 represents null. When going out in HL7 RXA-7, the units must be valid UCUM or the export will be blocked. Sometime in the future, we may want to convert this column to a string and name it "UcumCode". For now left alone for backwards compatibility.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.VaccinePat.LotNumber
member.summary: Optional. Used in HL7 RXA-9.1.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.VaccinePat.PatNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.VaccinePat.Note

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Vitalsign
member.summary: For EHR module, one dated vital sign entry. BMI is calulated on demand based on height and weight and may be one of 4 ALOINC codes. 39156-5 "Body mass index (BMI) [Ratio]" is most applicable.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Vitalsign.VitalsignNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Vitalsign.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Vitalsign.Height
member.summary: Height of patient in inches. Fractions might be needed some day. Allowed to be 0. Six possible LOINC codes, most applicable is 8302-2, "Body height".

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Vitalsign.Weight
member.summary: Lbs. Allowed to be 0. Six possible LOINC codes, most applicable is 29463-7, "Body weight".

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Vitalsign.BpSystolic
member.summary: Units are mmHg (millimeters of mercury). Allowed to be 0. LOINC code 8480-6.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Vitalsign.BpDiastolic
member.summary: Units are mmHg (millimeters of mercury). Allowed to be 0. LOINC code 8462-4.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Vitalsign.DateTaken
member.summary: The date that the vitalsigns were taken.

members.member: For an abnormal BMI measurement this must be true in order to meet quality measurement.//intervention? I think these should be deprecated and use an Intervention object instead.

If a BMI was not recorded, this must be true in order to meet quality measurement. For children, this is used as an IsPregnant flag, the only valid reason for not taking BMI on children.//intervention? I think these should be deprecated and use an Intervention object instead.
For HasFollowupPlan or IsIneligible, this documents the specifics.//intervention? I think these should be deprecated and use an Intervention object instead.
.//intervention? I think these should be deprecated and use an Intervention object instead.
.//intervention? I think these should be deprecated and use an Intervention object instead.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Vitalsign.WeightCode
member.summary: Used for CQMs. SNOMED CT code either Normal="", Overweight="238131007", or Underweight="248342006". Set when BMI is found to be "out of range", based on age groups. Should be calculated when vital sign is saved. Calculate based on age as of Jan 1 of the year vitals were taken. Not currently displayed to user.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Vitalsign.HeightExamCode
member.summary: FK to ehrcode.CodeValue. Also FK to LOINC.LoincCode. Used for CQMs. LOINC code used to describe the height exam performed. Examples: Body Height Measured=3137-7, Body Height Stated=3138-5, Body Height --pre surgery=8307-1. We will default to Body Height=8302-2, but user can choose another from the list of 6 allowed. Can be blank if BP only.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Vitalsign.WeightExamCode
member.summary: FK to ehrcode.CodeValue. Also FK to LOINC.LoincCode. Used for CQMs. LOINC code used to describe the weight exam performed. Examples: Body Weight Measured=3141-9, Body Weight Stated=3142-7, Body Weight --with clothes=8350-1. We will default to Body Weight=29463-7, but user can choose another from the list of 6 allowed. Can be blank if BP only.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Vitalsign.BMIExamCode
member.summary: FK to ehrcode.CodeValue. Also FK to LOINC.LoincCode. Used for CQMs. LOINC code used to describe the BMI percentile calculated. We will use LOINC 59576-9 - BMI Percentile Per age and gender. Can be blank if BP only.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Vitalsign.EhrNotPerformedNum
member.summary: FK to ehrnotperformed.EhrNotPerformedNum. This will link a vitalsign to the EhrNotPerformed object where the reason not performed will be stored. The linking will allow us to display the not performed reason directly in the vital sign window and will make CQM queries easier. Will be 0 if not linked to an EhrNotPerformed object.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Vitalsign.PregDiseaseNum
member.summary: FK to disease.DiseaseNum. This will link this vitalsign object to a pregnancy diagnosis for this patient. It will be 0 for non pregnant patients. The disease it is linked to will be inserted automatically based on the default value set. In order to change this code for this specific exam it will have to be changed in the problems list.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Vitalsign.BMIPercentile
member.summary: BMI percentile of patient, based on gender and age and the calculated BMI. We will use the CDC numbers to calculate percentile found here: (http://www.cdc.gov/nchs/data/series/sr_11/sr11_246.pdf).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Vitalsign.Pulse
member.summary: Recorded pulse of the patient. Stored in beats per minute.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse
member.summary: Received as XML output from XWeb gateway. Not all fields are available for all method calls. This is a combination of all possible output fields. The fields that are available are dependent on which method was called and the given result. HPF (XWeb Hosted Payment Form) Payments and HPF CC Alias creations will each enter a row in this table. That row will be monitored by the eConnector and updated when the XWebResponseCode changes from Pending. -- 1) Create the row and indicate the HPF/OTK. -- 2) Poll the OTK (one-time key) until an XWebResponseCode is available. Update the row with information about the transaction. DTG (XWeb Direct To Gateway) Will enter 1 row in this table. -- 1) Make the DTG payment using a pre-authorized CC alias. Create row with information about the transaction. Any fields prefixed with 'Gateaway output' come directly as XML output from the XWeb Gateway. All other fields are derived by OD. The class instance will created by eConnector by deserializing an XML string as received from XWeb Gateway. The fields names MUST NOT CHANGE for this reason. XML will not deserialize if the names do not match EXACTLY.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.XWebResponseNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.ProvNum
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.ClinicNum
member.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.PaymentNum
member.summary: FK to payment.PaymentNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.DateTEntry
member.summary: Timestamp at which this row was created. Auto generated on insert.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.DateTUpdate
member.summary: Timestamp at which this row was last updated. Will be updated each time the OTK status is polled and one final time when XWebResponseCode changes from Pending.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.TransactionStatus
member.summary: Inidicates which phase of the XWeb process this transaction is in. See class summary for details.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.ResponseCode
member.summary: Gateaway output. Pre-defined responses generated by XWeb. Will be converted to strongly typed enum XWebResponseCode.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.XWebResponseCode
member.summary: Strongly typed representation of ResponseCode. Initialized by XWebInputAbs.CreateGatewayResponse().

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.ResponseDescription
member.summary: Gateaway output. Gives a more detailed description on the ResponseCode.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.OTK
member.summary: Gateaway output. This is the One Time Key that is used to launch the Hosted Payment Form. The status of the OTK can be polled to determine if the end user has completed the HPF or if it has expired.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.HpfUrl
member.summary: This URL will be generated as a result of the OTK. The URL can be browsed in an IFRAME to create a secure portal between a browser and the XWeb server.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.HpfExpiration
member.summary: Timestamp at which this HPF will expire. The end user will only be able to access the HPF before it has expired. This expiration is set explicitly when creating the HPF.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.TransactionID
member.summary: Gateaway output. Each transaction is given a reference for future use. This can be used to void the transaction.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.TransactionType
member.summary: Gateaway output. The type of transaction that was processed. Must be a string data type because it comes from the Gateway as a string.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.Alias
member.summary: Gateaway output. A credit transaction will return an alias which is now linked to the credit card which was used. This alias can be used in the future to make DTG payments and circumvent the need for the secure HPF. Only applies when Credit (not Debit) data is submitted on the HPF.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.CardType
member.summary: Gateaway output. The card type used for this transaction. "Credit" - for cards that support signature only. "Debit/Credit" - for cards that support either PIN-entry or signature. "Debit/ATM" - for cards that support PIN-entry only. "FSA" - for Flexible Spending Accounts

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.CardBrand
member.summary: Gateaway output. The card brand used for this transaction. Possible values include "Visa", "MasterCard", "Discover", "American Express", "Diners Club", "JCB", "PayPal".

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.CardBrandShort
member.summary: Gateaway output. The industry standard abbreviation of the card brand. Possible values include "VS", "MC", "DS", "AX", "DCIDISC", "JCB-DISC", "PP" (order respective to CardBrand above).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.MaskedAcctNum
member.summary: Gateaway output. Provides a masked format of the account number. The format will show the last 4 digits, the remainder will masked out with an asterisk character. End user will be presented with a list of previously generated MaskedAcctNum(s) when making a payment. These are linked to an alias which can be used to make a DTG payment. This ciccumvents the need to use the HPF.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.Amount
member.summary: Gateaway output. Amount of credit card and check transactions.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.ApprovalCode
member.summary: Gateaway output. A 6 digit authorization approval code.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.CardCodeResponse
member.summary: Gateaway output. Response from the Card Security Code lookup. Only applies when Credit(not Debit) data is submitted on the HPF.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.ReceiptID
member.summary: Gateaway output. An identification number assigned by the OpenEdge Gateway to the receipt.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.ExpDate
member.summary: Gateaway output. Provides the Expiration Date of the account being accessed. Format is yyMM from XWeb gateway. Will be converted to ExpirationDate.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.EntryMethod
member.summary: Gateaway output. Indicates how the account number was entered by the end user. Always 'KEYED' in our case.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.ProcessorResponse
member.summary: Gateaway output. The response from the processor. It is only returned on transactions that are processed by the processor (Auth, Sales and Settlements).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.BatchNum
member.summary: Gateaway output. This indicates the current open batch number.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.BatchAmount
member.summary: Gateaway output. Net amount of Credit and Debit Card transactions in batch.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.AccountExpirationDate
member.summary: The expiration date of the credit card that was referenced in this transaction. DateTime representation of ExpDate. Initialized by XWebInputAbs.CreateGatewayResponse().

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.DebugError
member.summary: Debug information regarding this response. Can only be set by XWebResponses.ProcessOutstandingTransactions().

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.PayNote
member.summary: Will be entered as Payment.PayNote once payment transaction has completed.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.ConvertResponseCode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returned from XWeb Gateway as an int. Helper method to convert to enum.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.ConvertExpDate(System.String)
member.summary: Returned from XWeb Gateway as a string. Helper method to convert to DateTime. Format is yyMM from XWeb gateway

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.SetPersistentFields(System.Int64,System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Double,System.String,System.String,System.DateTime,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: These fields should persist from instance to instance for the same OTK.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponse.GetFormattedNote(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Formats a note that can be used as a PayNote on a payment. If the XWebResponse is a return or a void of a positive payment, pass in false for keepAmountPositive.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponseCodes
member.summary: OTK POLL statuses that provide a real-time check on the HPF transaction and will immediately return a response indicating an Approval, HPF timeout, or another termination event has occurred. If not, a Pending response will be returned. These states are returned directly from the XWeb gateway.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponseCodes.ExpiredWithoutApproval
member.summary: 101 - Expired Without Approval. Hosted Form timed out without Approval, OTK was never launched, or Invalid OTK

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebResponseCodes.Pending
member.summary: 102 - Pending (neither of the above events has occurred yet)

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.XWebTransactionStatus
member.summary: Track which phase of the XWebResponse a given transaction is currently in. This will be used by the eConnector when monitoring and processing XWeb payments.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.XWebTransactionType
member.summary: Transaction types avaialble for XWeb API. Not all are implemented.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebTransactionType.PollOtkUnspecified
member.summary: OTK status polling does not require a specific transaction type.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebTransactionType.CreditSaleTransaction
member.summary: This transaction type is used to purchase goods and services. When a sale occurs, the cardholder's credit limit is checked to see if the funds are available. If the funds are available, an approval code is transmitted to the XWeb gateway and is forwarded to the POS device. If approved, the transaction is flagged for inclusion in the settlement batch.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebTransactionType.AliasCreateTransaction
member.summary: This transaction will enable the merchant to obtain an "alias" of payment account information to be created and security stored at XWeb.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebTransactionType.CheckSaleTransaction
member.summary: NOT IMPLEMENTED. A Check is accepted for payment of services and processed either as an ACH transaction or a Check21 transaction.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebTransactionType.CreditAuthTransaction
member.summary: NOT IMPLEMENTED. This transaction will check the cardholder's funds and if the funds are sufficient for the purchase amount, the funds will be reserved on the cardholder's account for a period of time. A capture on this transaction will flag the transaction for settlement.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebTransactionType.CreditVoidTransaction
member.summary: This transaction removes a Sale, Capture or Return transaction from the current batch. Also, a void can be used on an Authorization transaction to prevent it from being captured in the future. Finally, the Void transaction can be used to reverse the Authorization or Sale transaction, thereby restoring the open-to-buy amount on the consumer card.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebTransactionType.CreditReturnTransaction
member.summary: This transaction will return the funds to a customer's account after settlement of the original batch has occurred.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebTransactionType.CheckCreditTransaction
member.summary: NOT IMPLEMENTED. A credit is issued to a bank account via the ACH network.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebTransactionType.CheckAliasCreateTransaction
member.summary: NOT IMPLEMENTED. This transaction will allow the ability to create a check alias to account information securely stored at XWeb.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebTransactionType.SaleTransaction
member.summary: NOT IMPLEMENTED. A SaleTransaction is identical to a CreditSaleTransaction, but allows a PIN-based DebitSaleTransaction to be initiated from the Hosted Payment Form. A PIN-based Debit Sale transaction can be performed by sending a SaleTransaction Request during the OTK Call. With a SaleTransaction Request, the Hosted Payment Form will appear identical to that for a CreditSaleTransaction Request, and support for the MagTek IPAD is available. If a PIN-based Debit Sale transaction is processed using the MagTek IPAD, then a DebitSaleTransaction will be sent to XWeb, and this transaction type will be returned during the Results Call.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebTransactionType.DebitSaleTransaction
member.summary: NOT IMPLEMENTED. This transaction type is used to process EMV Debit transactions using the Interac network. EMV Debit transactions require the XCharge Remote Client Manager to be installed on the local merchant PC and are only available to Global Canada merchants at this time.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebTransactionType.DebitReturnTransaction
member.summary: NOT IMPLEMENTED. This transaction will return the funds to a customer's bank account using the Interac network. EMV Debit transactions require the XCharge Remote Client Manager to be installed on the local merchant PC and are only available to Global Canada merchants at this time.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebTransactionType.AliasDeleteTransaction
member.summary: This transaction will allow the merchant to delete a pre-existing account number that is on-file at the Edge Gateway.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XWebTransactionType.Undefined
member.summary: Value could not be parsed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.UI.ApptDrawing.ProvBar
member.summary: Stores the shading info for the provider bars on the left of the appointments module

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.UI.ApptDrawing.ColWidth

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.DropboxApi.ODDropbox.MoveAsync(OpenDentBusiness.DropboxApi.TaskStateMove)
member.summary: Asynchronous. Moves the fromPath's contents to the toPath's location. This will not work if the toPath location already exists. This means if passing in two folders, the toPath folder can't exist. If trying to move a file, both paths must be a file path (i.e fromPath="/AtoZ/A/Albus/testfile.txt", toPath="/AtoZ/P/Peterson/testfile.txt". If one path is a folder, and the other is a file, it will fail. If toPath is a folder, it will attempt to move the entire directory with all of its contents along with it.

member.summary: Synchronous. The folder of the corresponding file to be downloaded. fromPath and toPath should be specific file paths, not folder paths.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.WebTypes.WebSched.TimeSlot.TimeSlots.GetAvailableWebSchedTimeSlots(System.Int64,System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets up to 30 days of open time slots based on the recall passed in. Open time slots are found by looping through operatories flagged for Web Sched and finding openings that can hold the recall. The amount of time required to be considered "available" is dictated by the RecallType associated to the recall passed in. Throws exceptions.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.WebTypes.WebSched.TimeSlot.TimeSlots.GetAvailableWebSchedTimeSlots(OpenDentBusiness.RecallType,System.Collections.Generic.List{OpenDentBusiness.Provider},OpenDentBusiness.Clinic,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,OpenDentBusiness.Recall)
member.summary: Gets up to 30 days of open time slots based on the RecallType passed in. Open time slots are found by looping through operatories flagged for Web Sched and finding openings that can hold the RecallType. The RecallType passed in must be a valid recall type. Providers passed in will be the only providers considered when looking for available time slots. Passing in a null clinic will only consider operatories with clinics set to 0 (unassigned). The timeslots on and between the Start and End dates passed in will be considered and potentially returned as available. Optionally pass in a recall object in order to consider all other recalls due for the patient. This will potentially affect the time pattern. Throws exceptions.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.WebTypes.WebSched.TimeSlot.TimeSlots.GetAvailableNewPatApptTimeSlots(System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Int64)
member.summary: Gets up to 30 days of open time slots for New Patient Appointments based on the timePattern passed in. Open time slots are found by looping through the passed in operatories and finding openings that can hold the entire appointment. Passing in a clinicNum of 0 will only consider unassigned operatories. The timeslots on and between the Start and End dates passed in will be considered and potentially returned as available. Throws exceptions.

Gets up to 30 days of open time slots based on the timePattern passed in. Open time slots are found by looping through the passed in operatories and finding openings that can hold the entire appointment. Providers passed in will be the only providers considered when looking for available time slots. Passing in a null clinic will only consider operatories with clinics set to 0 (unassigned). The timeslots on and between the Start and End dates passed in will be considered and potentially returned as available. Throws exceptions.

Adds valid time slots to listAvailableTimeSlots if the time slot found does NOT already exist within the list. This is a helper method to better break up the complexity of GetAvailableWebSchedTimeSlots() so that it is easier to follow.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.WebTypes.WebSched.TimeSlot.TimeSlots.IsApptPatternDoubleBooked(System.Collections.Generic.List{OpenDentBusiness.ApptSearchProviderSchedule},System.Int64,System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Checks to see if the provider has any double booking issues with the appointment time pattern passed in. Logic in this method ignores HYG conflicts purposefully for Web Sched. timePattern must be a time pattern in 5 minute increments.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.WebTypes.WebSched.TimeSlot.TimeSlots.IsTimeOverlapping(System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Checks if the two times passed in overlap.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.WebTypes.WebBase
member.summary: This is a base class for all classes that are not associated to a table in the database but both OpenDentBusiness and OpenDentalWebCore need to know about. Currently this class is used via reflection to quickly find all classes that extend this base class.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.X835
member.summary: X12 835 Health Care Claim Payment/Advice. This transaction type is a response to an 837 claim submission. The 835 will always come after a 277 is received and a 277 will always come after a 999. Neither the 277 nor the 999 are required, so it is possible that an 835 will be received directly after the 837. The 835 is not required either, so it is possible that none of the 997, 999, 277 or 835 reports will be returned from the carrier.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.X835._tranSetId
member.summary: ST02 Empty string if this instance corresponds to the first transaction (EOB) within the 835. Otherwise, a specific Transaction Set Identifer for a particular transaction (EOB) within the 835.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X835.IsDentical(OpenDentBusiness.X12object)
member.summary: Returns true if the required Application Sender's Code within the GS - Functional Group Header is "DENTICAL". Returns false if there is no FunctGroups or the sender's code is not "DENTICAL".

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X835.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: See guide page 62 for format outline. Specify a specific Transaction Set Identifier (ST02) for a particular EOB within the 835. Or set tranSetId to empty string to load the first EOB in the 835. This class is only capable of loading a single transaction (EOB).

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X835.ProcessMIA(System.Int32)
member.summary: The MIA segment is for Medicare inpatient adjudication information.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X835.ProcessMOA(System.Int32)
member.summary: The MOA segment is for Medicare outpatient adjudication information.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X835.ProcessN1_PR(System.Int32)
member.summary: 1000A N1*PR: Payer Identification. Required. Repeat 1. Guide page 87.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X835.ProcessN1_PE(System.Int32)
member.summary: 1000B N1*PE: Payee identification. Required. Repeat 1. Guide page 102. We include this information because it could be helpful for those customers who are using clinics.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X835.ProcessN3_PR(System.Int32)
member.summary: 1000A N3: Payer Address. Required. Repeat 1. Guide page 89.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X835.ProcessN4_PR(System.Int32)
member.summary: 1000A N4: Payer City, State, ZIP Code. Required. Repeat 1. Guide page 90.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X835.ProcessNM1_Person(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts an NM1 segment for a person into a name object including the full name and identifier. All fields are optional, thus this function returns what is available.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X835.ProcessPER_BL(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the contact information from segment PER*BL appended into a single string. Phone/email in PER04 or the contact phone/email in PER06 or both. If neither PER04 nor PER06 are present, then returns empty string.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X835.ProcessPLB(System.Int32)
member.summary: PLB: Provider Admustment. Situational. Repeat >1. Guide page 217. Each PLB segment can return up to 6 adjustments.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X835.ProcessTRN(System.Int32)
member.summary: TRN: Reassociation Trace Number. Required. Repeat 1. Guide page 77.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X835.GetDescriptForProvAdjCode(System.String)
member.summary: Used for the reason codes in the PLB segment.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X835.GetDescriptForTransactionHandlingCode(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the description for the transaction handling code in Table 1 (Header) BPR01. Required.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X835.GetDescriptFrom139(System.String)
member.summary: Code Source 139. Claim Adjustment Reason Codes. http://www.wpc-edi.com/reference/codelists/healthcare/claim-adjustment-reason-codes/ . Used for claim and procedure reason codes.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X835.GetDescriptFrom411(System.String)
member.summary: Code Source 411. Remittance Advice Remark Codes. https://www.wpc-edi.com/reference/codelists/healthcare/remittance-advice-remark-codes/

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_ProvAdj.ReasonCodeDescript
member.summary: Description of the ReasonCode in human readable terms

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_ProvAdj.ReasonCode
member.summary: PLB03-1 or PLB05-1 or PLB07-1 or PLB09-1 or PLB11-1 or PLB13-1

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_ProvAdj.RefIdentification
member.summary: PLB03-2 or PLB05-2 or PLB07-2 or PLB09-2 or PLB11-2 or PLB13-2

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim
member.summary: Information about a single EOB. There can be many EOBs within a single 835.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.SegmentCount
member.summary: The number of X12 segments that this claim and all data within it span.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.Npi
member.summary: TS301. Situational.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.ClaimTrackingNumber
member.summary: CLP01 in loop 2100. Referred to in this format as a Patient Control Number. The claim tracking numbers correspond to CLM01 exactly as submitted in the 837. We refer to CLM01 as the claim identifier on our end. We allow alphanumeric in our claim identifiers, so we must store as a string.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.PayerControlNumber
member.summary: CLP07 The claim control number used to identify the claim in the insurance company's database.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.StatusCodeDescript
member.summary: CLP02 A human readable copy of the claim status code.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.ClaimFee
member.summary: CLP03 The total amount charged by the dentist for the claim.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.InsPaid
member.summary: CLP04 The total amount insurance paid.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.PatientRespAmt
member.summary: CLP05 A portion of the ChargeAmtTotal which the patient is responsible for.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.PatientDeductAmt
member.summary: Patient deductible total for this claim. This is an amount calculated based on the requirements in the standard.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.PatientName
member.summary: NM1*QC of loop 2100. Required for Dental and Medical. Optional for Pharmacy. For our purposes (Dental and Medical), this data will always be provided.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.SubscriberName
member.summary: NM1*IL of loop 2100. Required for Dental and Medical. Optional for Pharmacy. For our purposes (Dental and Medical), this data will always be provided.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.DateServiceStart
member.summary: DTM*232 of loop 2100. Situational, but if not present, then service lines will include service dates. Service line dates override this date when both are present.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.DateServiceEnd
member.summary: DTM*233 of loop 2100. Situational, but if not present, then service lines will include service dates. Service line dates override this date when both are present.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.DatePayerReceived
member.summary: DTM*050 of loop 2100. Situational. Will be set to 0001/01/01 if not present for this claim.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.ListClaimAdjustments
member.summary: CAS Adjustments made by the insurance company at the claim level. These adjustments help explain part of the amount difference between the claim fee and the amount paid. There are also adjustments at the procedure level and the patient portion to account for when balancing.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.ListAdjudicationInfo
member.summary: MIA and MOA segments.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.ListSupplementalInfo
member.summary: AMT segments.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.ListProcs
member.summary: SVC segments.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.ClaimAdjustmentTotal
member.summary: The sum of all adjustment amounts in ListClaimAdjustments.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.AllowedAmt
member.summary: AllowedAmt = (Claim InsPaid)+(Claim PatientRespAmt)

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.IsSplitClaim
member.summary: True if remark code MA15 is used in either segment MIA or MOA (if present). Claim splits are intended to expedite payment when one or two procedures on the original claim are pending for an extended period of time.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.DateReceived
member.summary: Does not correspond to a particular segment in the 835, internally created based on 835 payment method and date effective.

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.ClaimNum
member.summary: Attempts to get the original ClaimNum corresponding to claim from the 835 in the database, or from cache. Returns 0 if not found.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.GetClaimFromDb
member.summary: Attempts to get the original claim from the database. Returns null if not found.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.GetPaymentsForClaimProcs(System.Collections.Generic.List{OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc})
member.summary: There could be multiple matches for a claimproc if the procedure was split or unbundled. For each claimproc in listClaimProcs, a list of Hx835_Procs will be returned. If there are no matches for a claimProc, then the list corresponding to that claimProc will be an empty list (not null).

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Claim.GetRemarks
member.summary: Concats all adjustment descriptions from ListClaimAdjustments into a single string, separated by newlines.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Proc
member.summary: Information about a single procedure on an EOB. There can be many of these for each Hx835_Claim.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Proc.SegmentCount
member.summary: The number of X12 segments that this claim and all data within it span.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Proc.ProcCodeAdjudicated
member.summary: SVC1-2. The adjudicated procedure code. Can be different than the submitted procedure code in the case of bundling/unbundling and procedure splits.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Proc.ProcFee
member.summary: SVC2.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Proc.InsPaid
member.summary: SVC3.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Proc.ProcCodeBilled
member.summary: SVC6-2. The procedure code submitted with the claim. Helps identify the procedure the adjudication is regarding in case of bundling/unbundling and procedure splits.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Proc.DateServiceStart
member.summary: DTM*150 or DTM*472 of loop 2110. Situational. If not present, then the procedure service start date is the same as the claim service start date.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Proc.DateServiceEnd
member.summary: DTM*151 of loop 2110. Situational. If not present, then the procedure service end date is the same as the claim service end date.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Proc.ProcNum
member.summary: REF*6R from the 837, or zero for older claims.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Proc.PatRespTotal
member.summary: The sum of all adjustment amounts in ListProcAdjustments where CAS01=PR, including but not limited to deductibles. PatRespTotal=PatientPortionAmt+DeductibleAmt

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Proc.PatientPortionAmt
member.summary: The sum of all adjustment amounts in ListProcAdjustments where CAS01=PR and CAS02!=1. PatientPortionAmt=PatRespTotal-DeductibleAmt

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Proc.DeductibleAmt
member.summary: The sum of all adjustment amounts in ListProcAdjustments where CAS01=PR and CAS02=1. DeductibleAmt=PatRespTotal-PatientPortionAmt

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Proc.AllowedAmt
member.summary: AllowedAmt = (InsPay)+(PatRespTotal)

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Proc.GetRemarks
member.summary: Concats all remarks in ListRemarks into a single string.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Adj
member.summary: Corresponds to a CAS segment. Both the claim level and procedure level include CAS segments.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Adj.AdjCode
member.summary: Will be one of these 4 values: CO=Contractual Obligations, PI=Payer Initiated Reduction, PR=Patient Responsibility, OA=Other Adjustment.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Adj.IsDeductible
member.summary: True when CAS01 = PR and (CAS02 or CAS05 or CAS08 or CAS11 or CAS14 or CAS17) is 1. See code source 139 at http://www.wpc-edi.com/reference/codelists/healthcare/claim-adjustment-reason-codes/. The most useful values in code source 139 are: 1=Deductible Amount, 2=Coinsurance Amount, 3=Co-payment Amount.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Info
member.summary: The values loaded into this class come from multiple segments, including the MIA, MOA, and AMT segments.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Info.FieldValue
member.summary: The user display value of FieldValueRaw.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Info.FieldValueRaw
member.summary: For logic, not for display.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Info.IsRemarkCode
member.summary: True if is a claim payment remark code.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Hx835_Name
member.summary: Corresponds to various NM1 segments.

member.summary: NM101 of loop 2100A.

member.summary: Last STC segment in loop 2200B. Returns -1 on error.

member.summary: QTY02 of loop 2200B.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X277.GetQuantityRejected
member.summary: QTY02 of loop 2200B.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X277.GetAmountAccepted
member.summary: AMT02 of loop 2200B.

member.summary: AMT02 of loop 2200B.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X277.GetClaimTrackingNumbers
member.summary: TRN02 in loop 2200D. Do this first to get a list of all claim tracking numbers that are contained within this 277. Then, for each claim tracking number, we can later retrieve the AckCode for that single claim. The claim tracking numbers correspond to CLM01 exactly as submitted in the 837. We refer to CLM01 as the claim identifier on our end. We allow more than just digits in our claim identifiers, so we must return a list of strings.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X277.GetClaimInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Result will contain strings in the following order: 0 Patient Last Name (NM103), 1 Patient First Name (NM104), 2 Patient Middle Name (NM105), 3 Claim Status (STC03), 4 Payor's Claim Control Number (REF02), 5 Institutional Type of Bill (REF02), 6 Claim Date Service Start (DTP03), 7 Claim Date Service End (DTP03), 8 Reason (STC01-2), 9 Amount (STC04), 10 SubscriberId (NM109)

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X277.GetStringForExternalSourceCode507(System.String)
member.summary: Code source 507. Since we only send batches, we can only get status codes starting with "A" returned to us. Returns empty string if no matches. The codes are pulled from the Washington Publishing Company website (the makers of X12). http://www.wpc-edi.com/reference/codelists/healthcare/claim-status-category-codes.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X277.GetStringForExternalSourceCode508(System.String)
member.summary: Convert the given source code to a string. Only 0 to 56 included so far. All codes listed at http://www.wpc-edi.com/reference/codelists/healthcare/claim-status-codes.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X999.GetBatchNumber
member.summary: In X12 lingo, the batchNumber is known as the functional group.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X999.GetTransNums
member.summary: Do this first to get a list of all trans nums that are contained within this 999. Then, for each trans num, we can later retrieve the AckCode for that single trans num.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X999.GetAckForTrans(System.Int32)
member.summary: Use after GetTransNums. Will return A=Accepted, R=Rejected, or "" if can't determine.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X999.GetBatchAckCode
member.summary: Will return "" if unable to determine. But would normally return A=Accepted or R=Rejected or P=Partially accepted if only some of the transactions were accepted.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.X837_5010.s
member.summary: Data element separator character. Almost always '*', the ASCII hexadecimal value of 2A. For Denti-Cal, ASCII hexadecimal value of 1D which is an unprintable character.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.X837_5010.isa16
member.summary: Component element separator character. Almost always ':', the ASCII hexadecimal value of 3A. For Denti-Cal, ASCII hexadecimal value of 22 which is '"'.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.X837_5010.endSegment
member.summary: Segment terminator character. We also add the newline to this variable, although we plan to move that into EndSegment() eventually. Almost always '~', the ASCII hexadecimal value of 7E. For Denti-Cal, ASCII hexadecimal value of 1C which is an unprintable character.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X837_5010.Sout(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)

member.summary: If blank or invalid, returns 0. Otherwise, parses.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.PIn.Int(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set has exceptions to false to supress exceptions and return 0 if the input string is not an int.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.PIn.Enum``1(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Strongly types the value provided to the enumeration value of declared enum type (T). When isEnumAsString is false, value should be the integer value of the desired enum item. E.g. T = ApptStatus, value = "5", retVal = ApptStatus.Broken When isEnumAsString is true, value must be the enum item name. E.g. T = ProgramName, value = programCur.ProgName, retVal = ProgramName.Podium This will mainly get called to circumvent double casting. E.g. ApptStatus stat=(ApptStatus)PIn(table["ApptStatus"].ToString());

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.PIn.Enum``1(System.Int32)
member.summary: Strongly types the integer provided to the enumeration value of the declaraed enum type (T).

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.PIn.Sound(System.String,System.String)

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.PIn.String(System.String)
member.summary: Currently does nothing.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.PIn.TSpan(System.String)
member.summary: Timespans that might be invalid time of day. Can be + or - and can be up to 800+ hours. Stored in Oracle as varchar2.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.PIn.Time(System.String)
member.summary: Used for Timespans that are guaranteed to always be a valid time of day. No negatives or hours over 24. Stored in Oracle as datetime.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.POut
member.summary: Converts various datatypes into strings formatted correctly for MySQL. "P" was originally short for Parameter because this class was written specifically to replace parameters in the mysql queries. Using strings instead of parameters is much easier to debug. I would rather not ever depend on the mysql connector for this because the authors of the connector have been known to suddenly change its behavior.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.POut.DateT(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Always encapsulates the result, depending on the current database connection.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.POut.Date(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Converts a date to yyyy-MM-dd format which is the format required by MySQL. myDate is the date you want to convert. encapsulate is true for the first overload, making the result look like this: 'yyyy-MM-dd' for MySQL.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.POut.TSpan(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Timespans that might be invalid time of day. Can be + or - and can be up to 800+ hours. Stored in Oracle as varchar2. Never encapsulates

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.POut.Time(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Timespans that are guaranteed to always be a valid time of day. No negatives or hours over 24. Stored in Oracle as datetime. Encapsulated by default.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.POut.Time(System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Timespans that are guaranteed to always be a valid time of day. No negatives or hours over 24. Stored in Oracle as datetime. Encapsulated by default.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.POut.Double(System.Double)
member.summary: Rounds input up to max of 2 decimal places. EG: .0047 will return "0.00"; .0051 will return "0.01".

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.POut.Decimal(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Rounds input up to max of 2 decimal places. EG: .0047 will return "0.00"; .0051 will return "0.01".

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.POut.String(System.String)
member.summary: Escapes all necessary characters.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.POut.StringNote(System.String)
member.summary: Should never be used outside of the crud. Used for large columns (larger than varchar, i.e. text, mediumtext, longtext) where it is possible to enter too many consecutive new line characters for the windows control to draw. This can cause a graphics memory error. If there are more than 50 consecutive new line characters, this will replace them with a single new line. This is called for TextIsClob column types that are sent as parameters. This does not escape any characters like POut.String does because escaping characters is not required when using parameters.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.POut.Sound(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified wav file into a string representation. The timing of this is a little different than with the other "P" functions and is only used by the import button in FormSigElementDefEdit. After that, the wav spends the rest of it's life as a string until "played" or exported.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.POut.Base64(System.String)
member.summary: The supplied string should already be in safe base64 format, and should not need any special escaping. The purpose of this function is to enforce that the supplied string meets these requirements. This is done quickly.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.GrowthBehaviorEnum
member.summary: For sheetFields

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.GrowthBehaviorEnum.None
member.Summary: Not allowed to grow. Max size would be Height and Width.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.GrowthBehaviorEnum.DownLocal
member.Summary: Can grow down if needed, and will push nearby objects out of the way so that there is no overlap.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.GrowthBehaviorEnum.DownGlobal
member.Summary: Can grow down, and will push down all objects on the sheet that are below it. Mostly used when drawing grids.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldType.OutputText
member.Summary: 0-Pulled from the database to be printed on the sheet. Or also possibly just generated at runtime even though not pulled from the database. User still allowed to change the output text as they are filling out the sheet so that it can different from what was initially generated.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldType.InputField
member.Summary: 1-A blank box that the user is supposed to fill in.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldType.StaticText
member.Summary: 2-This is text that is defined as part of the sheet and will never change from sheet to sheet.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldType.Parameter
member.summary: 3-Stores a parameter other than the PatNum. Not meant to be seen on the sheet. Only used for SheetField, not SheetFieldDef.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldType.Image
member.Summary: 4-Any image of any size, typically a background image for a form.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldType.Drawing
member.summary: 5-One sequence of dots that makes a line. Continuous without any breaks. Each time the pen is picked up, it creates a new field row in the database.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldType.Line
member.Summary: 6-A simple line drawn from x,y to x+width,y+height. So for these types, we must allow width and height to be negative or zero.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldType.Rectangle
member.Summary: 7-A simple rectangle outline.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldType.CheckBox
member.summary: 8-A clickable area on the screen. It's a form of input, so treated similarly to an InputField. The X will go from corner to corner of the rectangle specified. It can also behave like a radio button

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldType.SigBox
member.summary: 9-A signature box, either Topaz pad or directly on the screen with stylus/mouse. The signature is encrypted based an a hash of all other field values in the entire sheet, excluding other SigBoxes. The order is critical.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldType.PatImage
member.Summary: 10-An image specific to one patient.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldType.Special
member.Summary: 11-Special: Currently only used for Toothgrid

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldType.Grid
member.summary: 12-Grid: Placable grids similar to ODGrids. Used primarily in statements.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldType.ComboBox
member.summary: 13-ComboBox: Placeable combo box for selecting filled options.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldType.ScreenChart
member.summary: 14-ScreenChart: A tooth chart that is desiged for screenings.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetInternalType.MedLabResults

member.summary: Width of each page in the sheet in pixels, 100 pixels per inch.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetDef.Height
member.summary: Height of each page in the sheet in pixels, 100 pixels per inch.

member.summary: Set to true to print landscape.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetDef.PageCount
member.summary: Amount of editable space. Actual size when filling sheet may be different.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetDef.IsMultiPage
member.summary: If false, forces old single page behavior which ignores page breaks.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetDef.Parameters
member.Summary: A collection of all parameters for this sheetdef. There's usually only one parameter. The first parameter will be a List long if it's a batch. If a sheet has already been filled, saved to the database, and printed, then there is no longer any need for the parameters in order to fill the data. So a retrieved sheet will have no parameters, signalling a skip in the fill phase. There will still be parameters tucked away in the Field data in the database, but they won't become part of the sheet.

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.SheetDef.HeightPage
member.summary: Vertical height per page taking into account the IsLandscape flag.

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.SheetDef.WidthPage
member.summary: Horizontal width per page taking into account the IsLandscape flag.

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.SheetDef.HeightTotal
member.summary: Takes into account IsLandscape and PageCount. Sets the size of the editable area, This does not represent printed height, as some controls may grow.

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.SheetDef.SheetFieldDefsXml
member.summary: Used only for serialization purposes

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldDef
member.summary: One field on a sheetDef.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldDef.SheetFieldDefNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldDef.SheetDefNum
member.summary: FK to sheetdef.SheetDefNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldDef.FieldType
member.summary: Enum:SheetFieldType OutputText, InputField, StaticText,Parameter(only used for SheetField, not SheetFieldDef),Image,Drawing,Line,Rectangle,CheckBox,SigBox,PatImage.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldDef.FieldName
member.summary:
FieldName is used differently for different FieldTypes.
For OutputText, each sheet typically has a main datatable type. For example statements correspond to the statment table. See SheetFieldsAvailable.GetList() for available values.
If the output field exactly matches a column from the main table this will be the <ColumnName>. For example, "FName" on patient Forms.
If the output field exactly matches a column from a different table this will be the <tablename>.<ColumnName>. For example, appt.Note on Routing Slips.
If the output field is not a database column it must start with a lowercase letter. For example, "statementReceiptInvoice" on Statements.
For InputField, these are hardcoded to correspond to DB fields, for example "FName" corresponsds to patient.FName. See SheetFieldsAvailable.GetList() for available values.
For Image, this file name with extention, for example "image1.jpg". Some image names are handled specially, for example "Patient Info.gif". Images are stored in <imagefolder>\SheetImages\image1.jpg.
For CheckBox, this groups checkboxes together so that only one per group can be checked.
For PatImage, this is the name of the DocCategory.
For Special, identifies the type of special field. Currently only ToothChart and ToothChartLegend.
For Grid, this is the specific type of grid. See SheetUtil.GetDataTableForGridType() for values. For example "StatementPayPlan".
For all other fieldtypes, FieldName is blank or irrelevant.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldDef.FieldValue
member.summary:
For StaticText, this text can include bracketed fields, like [nameLF].
For OutputText and InputField, this will be blank.
For CheckBoxes, either X or blank. Even if the checkbox is set to behave like a radio button.
For Pat Images, this is blank. The filename of a PatImage will later be stored in SheetField.FieldValue.
For ComboBoxes, the chosen option, semicolon, then a pipe delimited list of options such as: March;January|February|March|April
For ScreenCharts, a semicolon delimited list of comma separated surfaces. It may look like S,P,N;S,S,S;... etc.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldDef.FontSize
member.summary: The fontSize for this field regardless of the default for the sheet. The actual font must be saved with each sheetField.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldDef.FontName
member.summary: The fontName for this field regardless of the default for the sheet. The actual font must be saved with each sheetField.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldDef.XPos
member.summary: In pixels.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldDef.YPos
member.summary: In pixels.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldDef.Width
member.summary: The field will be constrained horizontally to this size. Not allowed to be zero.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldDef.Height
member.summary: The field will be constrained vertically to this size. Not allowed to be 0. It's not allowed to be zero so that it will be visible on the designer.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldDef.GrowthBehavior
member.summary: Enum:GrowthBehaviorEnum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldDef.RadioButtonValue
member.summary: This is only used for checkboxes that you want to behave like radiobuttons. Set the FieldName the same for each Checkbox in the group. The FieldValue will likely be X for one of them and empty string for the others. Each of them will have a different RadioButtonValue. Whichever box has X, the RadioButtonValue for that box will be used when importing. This field is not used for "misc" radiobutton groups.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetFieldDef.RadioButtonGroup
member.summary: Name which identifies the group within which the radio button belongs. FieldName must be set to "misc" in order for the group to take effect.

member.summary: Set to true if this field is required to have a value before the sheet is closed.

member.summary: The Bitmap should be converted to Base64 using POut.Bitmap() before placing in this field. Not stored in the database. Only used when uploading SheetDefs to the web server.

member.summary: Tab stop order for all fields. One-based. Only checkboxes and input fields can have values other than 0.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.AutoCode
member.summary: An autocode automates entering procedures. The user only has to pick composite, for instance, and the autocode figures out the code based on the number of surfaces, and posterior vs. anterior. Autocodes also enforce and suggest changes to a procedure code if the number of surfaces or other properties change.
