member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Benefit
member.summary:
Corresponds to the benefit table in the database which replaces the old covpat table. A benefit is usually a percentage, deductible, limitation, max, or similar. Each row represents a single benefit. A benefit can have a value in EITHER PlanNum OR PatPlanNum. If it is for a PlanNum, the most common, then the benefit is attached to an insurance plan. If it is for a PatPlanNum, then it overrides the plan benefit, usually a percentage, for a single patient. Benefits we can't handle yet include posterior composites, COB duplication, amounts used, in/out of plan network, authorization required, missing tooth exclusion, and any date related limitations like waiting periods.
Here are examples of typical usage which parallel X12 usage.
Example fields shown in this order:
CovCat, ProcCode(- indicates blank), BenefitType, Percent, MonetaryAmt, TimePeriod, QuantityQualifier, Quantity, CoverageLevel
Annual Max Indiv $1000: None/General,-,Limitations,-1,1000,CalendarYear,None,0,Individual
Restorative 80%: Restorative,-,CoInsurance,80,-1,CalendarYear,None,0,None
$50 deductible: None/General,-,Deductible,-1,50,CalendarYear,None,0,Individual
Deductible waived on preventive: Preventive,-,Deductible,-1,0,CalendarYear,None,0,Individual
1 pano every 5 years: None,D0330,Limitations,-1,-1,Years?,Years,5,None
2 exams per year: Preventive(or Diagnostic),-,Limitations,-1,-1,BenefitYear,NumberOfServices,2,None
Fluoride limit 18yo: None, D1204, Limitations, -1, -1, CalendarYear/None, AgeLimit, 18,None (might require a second identical entry for D1205)
4BW every 6 months: None, D0274, Limitations, -1, -1, None, Months, 6,None.
The text above might be difficult to read. We are trying to improve the white spacing.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Benefit.BenefitNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Benefit.PlanNum
member.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum. Most benefits should be attached using PlanNum. The exception would be if each patient has a different percentage. If PlanNum is used, then PatPlanNum should be 0.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Benefit.PatPlanNum
member.summary: FK to patplan.PatPlanNum. It is rare to attach benefits this way. Usually only used to override percentages for patients. In this case, PlanNum should be 0.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Benefit.CovCatNum
member.summary: FK to covcat.CovCatNum. Corresponds to X12 EB03- Service Type code. Situational, so it can be 0. Will probably be 0 for general deductible and annual max. There are very specific categories covered by X12. Users should set their InsCovCats to the defaults we provide.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Benefit.BenefitType
member.summary: Enum:InsBenefitType Corresponds to X12 EB01. Examples: 0=ActiveCoverage, 1=CoInsurance, 2=Deductible, 3=CoPayment, 4=Exclusions, 5=Limitations. ActiveCoverage doesn't really provide meaningful information.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Benefit.Percent
member.summary: Only used if BenefitType=CoInsurance. Valid values are 0 to 100. -1 indicates empty, which is almost always true if not CoInsurance. The percentage that insurance will pay on the procedure. Note that benefits coming from carriers are usually backwards, indicating the percetage that the patient is responsible for.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Benefit.MonetaryAmt
member.summary: Used for CoPayment, Limitations, and Deductible. -1 indicates empty

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Benefit.TimePeriod
member.summary: Enum:BenefitTimePeriod Corresponds to X12 EB06, Time Period Qualifier. Examples: 0=None,1=ServiceYear,2=CalendarYear,3=Lifetime,4=Years. Might add Visit and Remaining.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Benefit.QuantityQualifier
member.summary: Enum:BenefitQuantity Corresponds to X12 EB09. Not used very much. Examples: 0=None,1=NumberOfServices,2=AgeLimit,3=Visits,4=Years,5=Months

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Benefit.Quantity
member.summary: Corresponds to X12 EB10. Qualify the quantity using QuantityQualifier.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Benefit.CodeNum
member.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum. Typical uses include fluoride, sealants, etc. If a specific code is used here, then the CovCat should be None.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Benefit.CoverageLevel
member.summary: Enum:BenefitCoverageLevel Corresponds to X12 EB02. None, Individual, or Family. Individual and Family are commonly used for deductibles and maximums. None is commonly used for percentages and copays.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Benefit.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: IComparable.CompareTo implementation. This is used to order benefit lists as well as to group benefits if the type is essentially equal. It doesn't compare values such as percentages or amounts. It only compares types.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Benefit.IsSimilar(OpenDentBusiness.Benefit)
member.summary: Returns true if most of the fields match except BenefitNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Carrier.ElectID
member.summary: E-claims electronic payer id. 5 char in USA. 6 digits in Canada. I've seen an ID this long before: "LA-DHH-MEDICAID". The user interface currently limits length to 20, although db limits length to 255. X12 requires length between 2 and 80.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Carrier.NoSendElect
member.summary: Do not send electronically. It's just a default; you can still send electronically.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Carrier.IsCDA
member.summary: Canada: True if a CDAnet carrier. This has significant implications: 1. It can be filtered for in the list of carriers. 2. An ElectID is required. 3. The ElectID can never be used by another carrier. 4. If the carrier is attached to any etrans, then the ElectID cannot be changed (and, of course, the carrier cannot be deleted or combined).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Carrier.CDAnetVersion
member.summary: The version of CDAnet supported. Either 02 or 04.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Carrier.CanadianEncryptionMethod

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Carrier.SecDateTEdit

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Carrier.TIN
member.summary: Tax ID Number. Not user editable. No UI for this field. Used in when importing insurance plans from 834s to uniquely identify carriers.

member.summary: Type 23, Predetermination EOB (regular and embedded) are not included because they are not part of the testing scripts. The three required types are not included: ClaimTransaction_01, ClaimAcknowledgement_11, and ClaimEOB_21. Can't find specs for PredeterminationEobEmbedded.

member.summary: Single char: U,H,W,P,S,or R. U=Unsent, H=Hold until pri received, W=Waiting in queue, S=Sent, R=Received. A(adj) is no longer used. P(prob sent) is no longer used.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.DateReceived

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.ProvTreat

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.ClaimFee

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.DedApplied

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.ReasonUnderPaid

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.ClaimNote

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.ClaimType
member.summary: "P"=primary, "S"=secondary, "PreAuth"=preauth, "Other"=other, "Cap"=capitation. Not allowed to be blank. Might need to add "Med"=medical claim.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.ProvBill

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.ReferringProv

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.PatRelat

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.PlanNum2
member.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum. Other coverage plan number. 0 if none. This provides the user with total control over what other coverage shows. This obviously limits the coverage on a single claim to two insurance companies.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.PatRelat2

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.WriteOff
member.summary: Sum of ClaimProc.Writeoff for this claim.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.Radiographs
member.summary: The number of x-rays enclosed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.ClinicNum
member.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. 0 if no clinic. Since one claim cannot have procs from multiple clinics, the clinicNum is set when creating the claim and then cannot be changed. The claim would have to be deleted and recreated. Otherwise, if changing at the claim level, a feature would have to be added that synched all procs, claimprocs, and probably some other tables.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.ClaimForm
member.summary: FK to claimform.ClaimFormNum. 0 if not assigned to use the claimform for the insplan.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.AttachedImages
member.summary: The number of intraoral images attached. Not the number of files attached. This is the value that goes on the 2006 claimform.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.AttachedModels
member.summary: The number of models attached.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.AttachedFlags
member.summary: A comma-delimited set of flag keywords. Can have one or more of the following: EoB,Note,Perio,Misc. Must also contain one of these: Mail or Elect.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.AttachmentID
member.summary: Example: NEA#1234567. If present, and if the claim note does not already start with this Id, then it will be prepended to the claim note for both e-claims and mail. If using e-claims, this same ID will be used for all PWK segements.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CanadianMaterialsForwarded
member.summary: A08. Any combination of E(email), C(correspondence), M(models), X(x-rays), and I(images). So up to 5 char. Gets converted to a single char A-Z for e-claims.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CanadianReferralProviderNum
member.summary: B05. Optional. The 9-digit CDA number of the referring provider, or identifier of referring party up to 10 characters in length.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CanadianReferralReason
member.summary: B06. A number 0(none) through 13.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CanadianIsInitialLower
member.summary: F18. Y, N, or X(not a lower denture, crown, or bridge).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CanadianDateInitialLower
member.summary: F19. Mandatory if F18 is N.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CanadianMandProsthMaterial
member.summary: F21. If crown, not required. If denture or bridge, required if F18 is N. Single digit number code, 0-6. We added type 7, which is crown.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CanadianIsInitialUpper
member.summary: F15. Y, N, or X(not an upper denture, crown, or bridge).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CanadianDateInitialUpper
member.summary: F04. Mandatory if F15 is N.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CanadianMaxProsthMaterial
member.summary: F20. If crown, not required. If denture or bridge, required if F15 is N. 0 indicates empty response. Single digit number code, 1-6. We added type 7, which is crown.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.InsSubNum
member.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.InsSubNum2
member.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum. The fk to the 'Other' insurance subscriber. For a primary claim, this will be the secondary insurance subscriber. For a secondary claim, this will be primary insurance subscriber.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CanadaTransRefNum
member.summary: G01 assigned by carrier/network and returned in acks. Used for claim reversal. For Claim Acknowledgements, this can sometimes be a series of spaces, which means the number is effectively empty. This happens when the Claim Acknowledgement is forwarded to the carrier as part of a batch.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CanadaEstTreatStartDate
member.summary: F37 Used for predeterminations.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CanadaInitialPayment
member.summary: F28 Used for predeterminations.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CanadaPaymentMode
member.summary: F29 Used for predeterminations.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CanadaTreatDuration
member.summary: F30 Used for predeterminations.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CanadaNumAnticipatedPayments
member.summary: F31 Used for predeterminations.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CanadaAnticipatedPayAmount
member.summary: F32 Used for predeterminations.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.PriorAuthorizationNumber
member.summary: This is NOT the predetermination of benefits number. In X12, this is REF G1.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.SpecialProgramCode
member.summary: Enum:EnumClaimSpecialProgram This is used to track EPSDT.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.UniformBillType
member.summary: A three digit number used on 837I. Aka Bill Code. UBO4 4. Examples: 321,823,131,652. The third digit is claim frequency code. If this is used, then our CorrectionType should be 0=original.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.MedType
member.summary: Enum:EnumClaimMedType 0=Dental, 1=Medical, 2=Institutional

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.AdmissionTypeCode
member.summary: Used for inst claims. Single digit. X12 2300 CL101. UB04 14. Should only be required for IP, but X12 clearly states required for all.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.AdmissionSourceCode
member.summary: Used for inst claims. Single char. X12 2300 CL102. UB04 15. Should only be required for IP, but X12 clearly states required for all.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.PatientStatusCode
member.summary: Used for inst claims. Two digit. X12 2300 CL103. UB04 17. Should only be required for IP, but X12 clearly states required for all.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CustomTracking
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Most users will leave this blank. Some offices may set up tracking statuses such as 'review', 'hold', 'riskmanage', etc.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.DateResent
member.summary: Used for historical purposes only, not sent electronically. Automatically set when CorrectionType is not original and the claim is resent.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.CorrectionType
member.summary: X12 CLM05-3. Usually set to original, but can be used to resubmit claims.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.ClaimIdentifier
member.summary: X12 CLM01. Semi-unique identifier for the claim within the current database. Defaults to PatNum/ClaimNum, but can be edited by user, and is often modified by the clearinghouse to ensure uniqueness on their end. This also set for PreAuth claims. The ClaimIdentifier for a PreAuth will probably not match the ClaimIdentifier for a regular claim, which makes ERA claim matching more straight forward for both PreAuths and regular claims.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.OrigRefNum
member.summary: X12 2300 REF (F8). Used when resending claims to refer to the original claim. The user must type this value in after reading it from the original claim response report.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.ProvOrderOverride
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Ordering provider override. Goes hand-in-hand with OrderingReferralNum. Medical eclaims only. Defaults to zero.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.OrthoTotalM
member.summary: Total estimated months of ortho. Valid values are 1-36, although we allow greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.ShareOfCost
member.summary: Sum of all amounts paid specifically to this claim by the patient or family. Goes out in X12 4010/5010 loop 2300 AMT segment if greater than zero. Default value is 0, thus will not go out by default unless the user enters a value. This field was added for Denti-Cal certification, but can go out for any clearinghouse.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.SecUserNumEntry
member.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.SecDateEntry
member.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change. The actual date of entry.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.SecDateTEdit
member.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates. Not user editable with the UI.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.OrderingReferralNum
member.summary: FK to referral.ReferralNum. Goes hand-in-hand with ProvOrderOverride. Medical eclaims only. Defaults to zero. If set, and the ProvOrderOverride is not set, then this referral will go out at the ordering provider on medical e-claims.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.Attachments
member.summary: Not a data column.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Claim.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of the claim.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.EnumClaimSpecialProgram
member.summary: 0=none, 1=EPSDT_1, 2=Handicapped_2, 3=SpecialFederal_3, (no 4), 5=Disability_5, 9=SecondOpinion_9

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimCorrectionType.Original
member.summary: 0 - X12 1. Use for claims that are not ongoing.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimCorrectionType.Replacement
member.summary: 1 - X12 7. Use to entirely replace an original claim. A claim reference number will be required.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimCorrectionType.Void
member.summary: 2 - X12 8. Use to undo an original claim. A claim reference number will be required.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimForm
member.summary: Stores the information for printing different types of claim forms. Each claimform has many claimformitems attached to it, one for each field on the claimform. This table has nothing to do with the actual claims. It just describes how to print them.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimForm.ClaimFormNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimForm.Description
member.summary: eg. ADA2002 or CA Medicaid

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimForm.IsHidden
member.summary: If true, then it will not be displayed in various claim form lists as a choice.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimForm.FontName
member.summary: Valid font name for all text on the form.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimForm.FontSize
member.summary: Font size for all text on the form.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimForm.UniqueID
member.summary: For instance OD12 or JoeDeveloper9. If you are a developer releasing claimforms, then this should be your name or company followed by a unique number. This will later make it easier for you to maintain your claimforms for your customers. All claimforms that we release will be of the form OD##. Forms that the user creates will have this field blank, protecting them from being changed by us. So far, we have built the following claimforms: ADA2002=OD1, Denti-Cal=OD2, ADA2000=OD3, HCFA1500=OD4, HCFA1500preprinted=OD5, Canadian=OD6, Belgian=OD7, ADA2006=OD8, 1500 version 05/08=OD9, UB04=OD10, ADA2012=OD11, 1500 version 02/12=OD12

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimForm.PrintImages
member.summary: Set to false to not print images. This removes the background for printing on premade forms.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimForm.OffsetX
member.summary: Shifts all items by x/100th's of an inch to compensate for printer, typically less than 1/4 inch.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimForm.OffsetY
member.summary: Shifts all items by y/100th's of an inch to compensate for printer, typically less than 1/4 inch.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimForm.Items
member.summary: This is not a database column. It is an array of all claimformItems that are attached to this ClaimForm.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimForm.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of the claimform including the Items. Only used in FormClaimForms.butCopy_Click.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimFormItem
member.summary: One item is needed for each field on a claimform.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimFormItem.ClaimFormItemNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimFormItem.ClaimFormNum
member.summary: FK to claimform.ClaimFormNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimFormItem.ImageFileName
member.summary: If this item is an image. Usually only one per claimform. eg ADA2002.emf. Otherwise it MUST be left blank, or it will trigger an error that the image cannot be found.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimFormItem.FieldName
member.summary: Must be one of the hardcoded available fieldnames for claims.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimFormItem.FormatString
member.summary: For dates, the format string. ie MM/dd/yyyy or M d y among many other possibilities.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimFormItem.XPos
member.summary: The x position of the item on the claim form. In pixels. 100 pixels per inch.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimFormItem.YPos
member.summary: The y position of the item.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimFormItem.Width
member.summary: Limits the printable area of the item. Set to zero to not limit.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimFormItem.Height
member.summary: Limits the printable area of the item. Set to zero to not limit.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimFormItem.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of the claimformitem.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimPayment
member.summary: Each row represents a single check from the insurance company. The amount may be split between patients using claimprocs. The amount of the check must always exactly equal the sum of all the claimprocs attached to it. There might be only one claimproc.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimPayment.ClaimPaymentNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimPayment.CheckDate
member.summary: Date the check was entered into this system, not the date on the check.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimPayment.CheckAmt
member.summary: The amount of the check.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimPayment.CheckNum
member.summary: The check number.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimPayment.BankBranch
member.summary: Bank and branch.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimPayment.Note
member.summary: Note for this check if needed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimPayment.ClinicNum
member.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. 0 if no clinic.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimPayment.DepositNum
member.summary: FK to deposit.DepositNum. 0 if not attached to any deposits.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimPayment.CarrierName
member.summary: Descriptive name of the carrier just for reporting purposes. We use this because the CarrierNums could conceivably be different for the different claimprocs attached.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimPayment.DateIssued
member.summary: Date that the carrier issued the check. Date on the check.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimPayment.PayType
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. 0 if not attached to any definitions

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimPayment.SecUserNumEntry
member.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimPayment.SecDateEntry
member.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change. The actual date of entry.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimPayment.SecDateTEdit
member.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates. Not user editable with the UI.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimPayment.PayGroup
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. The payment group for this claim payment.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimPayment.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this ClaimPayment.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc
member.summary: Links procedures to claims. Also links ins payments to procedures or claims. Also used for estimating procedures even if no claim yet. Warning: One proc might be linked twice to a given claim if insurance made two payments. Many of the important fields are actually optional. For instance, ProcNum is only required if itemizing ins payment, and ClaimNum is blank if Status=adjustment,cap,or estimate.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.ClaimProcNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.ProcNum
member.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum. Is 0 for payments by total.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.ClaimNum
member.summary: FK to claim.ClaimNum. Is 0 for estimates, adjustments and capitation (CapClaim and CapComplete).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.ProvNum
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. At least one office has been manually setting their claimproc provider to a different provider when entering payments as a means to track provider income. So we can't force this to always be the same as the procedure. We also don't want to change any historical data, so only synched when setting appt complete or if an estimate. Right now on e-claims, we are sending the prov from the procedure. When we have time, we will change e-claims to send the prov from the ClaimProc.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.FeeBilled
member.summary: Fee billed to insurance. Might not be the same as the actual fee. The fee billed can be different than the actual procedure. For instance, if you have set the insurance plan to bill insurance using UCR fees, then this field will contain the UCR fee instead of the fee that the patient was charged.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.InsPayEst
member.summary: Only if attached to a claim. Actual amount this carrier is expected to pay, after taking everything else into account. Considers annual max, override, percentAmt, copayAmt, deductible, etc. This estimate is computed automatically when sent to ins.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.DedApplied
member.summary: 0 if blank. Deductible applied to this procedure only. Only for procedures attached to claims. Otherwise, the DedEst and DedEstOverride are used.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.Status
member.summary: Enum:ClaimProcStatus .

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.InsPayAmt
member.summary: Amount insurance actually paid.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.Remarks
member.summary: The remarks that insurance sends in the EOB about procedures.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.ClaimPaymentNum
member.summary: FK to claimpayment.ClaimPaymentNum(the insurance check).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.PlanNum
member.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.DateCP
member.summary: This is the date that is used for payment reports and tracks the payment date. Always exactly matches the date of the ClaimPayment it's attached to. See the note under Ledgers.ComputePayments. This will eventually not be used for aging. The ProcDate will instead be used. See ProcDate.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.WriteOff
member.summary: Amount not covered by ins which is written off. The writeoff estimate goes in a different column. This is filled with the WriteOffEst value when a claim is created.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.CodeSent
member.summary: The procedure code that was sent to insurance. This is not necessarily the usual procedure code. It will already have been trimmed to 5 char if it started with "D", or it could be the alternate code. Not allowed to be blank if it is procedure.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.AllowedOverride
member.summary: The allowed fee (not the override) is a complex calculation which is performed on the fly in Procedure.ComputeEstimates/ClaimProc.ComputeBaseEst. It is the amount that the percentage is based on. If this carrier has a lower UCR than the office, then the allowed fee is where that is handled. It can be pulled from an allowed fee schedule. It is also where substitutions for posterior composites are handled. The AllowedOverride allows the user to override the calculation. -1 indicates blank. A new use of this field is for when entering insurance payments. On the eob, it will tell you what the allowed/UCR fee is. The user will now be able to enter this information into the AllowedOverride field. They will simultaneously pass the info to the allowed fee schedule. AllowedOverride is never changed automatically by the program except to sometimes set it to -1 if NoBillIns.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.Percentage
member.summary: -1 if blank. Otherwise a number between 0 and 100. The percentage that insurance pays on this procedure, as determined from insurance categories. Not user editable.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.PercentOverride
member.summary: -1 if blank. Otherwise a number between 0 and 100. Can only be changed by user.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.CopayAmt
member.summary: -1 if blank. Calculated automatically. User cannot edit but can use CopayOverride instead. Opposite of InsEst, because this is the patient portion estimate. Two different uses: 1. For capitation, this automates calculation of writeoff. 2. For any other insurance, it gets deducted during calculation as shown in the edit window. Neither use directly affects patient balance.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.NoBillIns
member.summary: Set to true to not bill to this insurance plan.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.PaidOtherIns
member.summary: -1 if blank. The amount paid or estimated to be paid by another insurance. This amount is then subtracted from what the current insurance would pay. When running the calculation and considering other claimprocs, it will ignore any patPlan with a higher ordinal. So, always blank for primary claims. User cannot edit, but can use PaidOtherInsOverride.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.BaseEst
member.summary: Always has a value. Used in TP, etc. The base estimate is the ((fee or allowedOverride)-Copay) x (percentage or percentOverride). Does not include all the extras like ded, annualMax,and paidOtherIns that InsEstTotal holds. BaseEst cannot be overridden by the user. Instead, the following fields can be manipulated: allowedOverride, CopayOverride, PercentOverride.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.CopayOverride
member.summary: -1 if blank. See description of CopayAmt. This lets the user set a copay that will never be overwritten by automatic calculations.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.ProcDate
member.summary: Date of the procedure. Displayed in Edit Claim window procedures grid. Currently only used for tracking annual insurance benefits remaining. Important in Adjustments to benefits. For total claim payments, MUST be the date of the procedures to correctly figure benefits. Will eventually transition to use this field to actually calculate aging. See the note under Ledgers.ComputePayments.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.DateEntry
member.summary: Date that it was changed to status received or supplemental. It is usually attached to a claimPayment at that point, but not if user forgets. This is still the date that it becomes important financial data. Only applies if Received or Supplemental. Otherwise, the date is disregarded. User may never edit. Important in audit trail.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.LineNumber
member.summary: Assigned when claim is created as a way to order the procs showing on a claim. Indireclty goes out in X12 loop 2400. Used in Canadian eclaims (field F07).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.DedEst
member.summary: -1 if blank. Not sure why we need to allow -1. Calculated automatically. User cannot edit, but can use DedEstOverride instead.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.DedEstOverride
member.summary: -1 if blank. Overrides the DedEst value.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.InsEstTotal
member.summary: Always has a value. BaseEst-(DedEst or DedEstOverride)-PaidOtherIns-OverAnnualMax. User cannot edit, but can instead use InsEstTotalOverride. Recalculated each time TP is viewed, is saved as the value calculated for the last viewed TP. This variable should probably just be moved to memory and removed as a DB field.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.InsEstTotalOverride
member.summary: -1 if blank. Overrides the InsEstTotal value.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.PaidOtherInsOverride
member.summary: -1 if blank. Overrides the PaidOtherIns value.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.EstimateNote
member.summary: An automatically generated note that displays information about over max, exclusions, and other limitations for which there are no fields. Only applies to estimate. Once it's attached to a claim, similar information can go in the remarks field.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.WriteOffEst
member.summary: -1 if blank. The estimated writeoff as calculated by OD. Usually only used for PPOs.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.WriteOffEstOverride
member.summary: -1 if blank. Overrides WriteOffEst. Usually only used for PPOs.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.ClinicNum
member.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Can be zero. No user interface for editing. Forced to always be the same as the procedure, or if no procedure, then the claim.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.InsSubNum
member.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.PaymentRow
member.summary: 1-indexed. Allows user to sort the order of payments on an EOB. All claimprocs for a payment will have the same PaymentRow value.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.DoDelete
member.summary: Not a database column. Used to help manage passing lists around.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.PayPlanNum
member.summary: FK to payplan.PayPlanNum. 0 if not attached to a payplan.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.ClaimPaymentTracking
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Connected to the ClaimPaymentTracking DefCat.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.SecUserNumEntry
member.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.SecDateEntry
member.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change. The actual date of entry.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.SecDateTEdit
member.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates. Not user editable with the UI.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.DateSuppReceived
member.summary: The date the claim proc was first set to received or supplemental. If status is set to something other than received/supplemental, this field will be set to DateTime.MinValue if DateSuppReceived is today. If DateSuppReceived is set to a day in the past and the status is changed from received/supplemental to something else, the field will not be cleared or updated. Db only field used by one customer and this is how they requested it. PatNum #19191

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimProc.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this ClaimProc.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimValCodeLog
member.summary: Value codes for institutional 'claims'. Can have up to 12 per claim.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimValCodeLog.ClaimValCodeLogNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimValCodeLog.ClaimNum
member.summary: FK to claim.ClaimNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimValCodeLog.ClaimField
member.summary: Descriptive abbreviation to help place field on form (Ex: "FL55" for field 55).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimValCodeLog.ValCode
member.summary: Value Code. 2 char.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimValCodeLog.ValAmount
member.summary: Value Code Amount.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClaimValCodeLog.Ordinal
member.summary: Order of Value Code

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse
member.summary: Since we can send e-claims to multiple clearinghouses, this table keeps track of each clearinghouse. Will eventually be used for individual carriers as well if they accept

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.ClearinghouseNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.Description
member.summary: Description of this clearinghouse

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.ExportPath
member.summary: The path to export the X12 file to. \ is now optional. Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.Payors
member.summary: A list of all payors which should have claims sent to this clearinghouse. Comma delimited with no spaces. Not necessary if IsDefault.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.Eformat
member.summary: Enum:ElectronicClaimFormat The format of the file that gets sent electronically.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.ISA05
member.summary: Sender ID Qualifier. Usually ZZ, sometimes 30. Seven other values are allowed as specified in X12 document, but probably never used.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.SenderTIN
member.summary: Used in ISA06, GS02, 1000A NM1, and 1000A PER. If blank, then 810624427 is used to indicate Open Dental. Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.ISA07
member.summary: Receiver ID Qualifier. Usually ZZ, sometimes 30. Seven other values are allowed as specified in X12 document, but probably never used.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.ISA08
member.summary: Receiver ID. Also used in GS03. Provided by clearinghouse. Examples: BCBSGA or 0135WCH00(webMD)

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.ISA15
member.summary: "P" for Production or "T" for Test.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.Password
member.summary: Password is usually combined with the login ID for user validation. Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.ResponsePath
member.summary: The path that all incoming response files will be saved to. \ is now optional. Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.CommBridge
member.summary: Enum:EclaimsCommBridge One of the included hard-coded communications briges. Or none to just create the claim files without uploading.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.ClientProgram
member.summary: If applicable, this is the name of the client program to launch. It is even used by the hard-coded comm bridges, because the user may have changed the installation directory or exe name. Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.LastBatchNumber
member.summary: Each clearinghouse increments their batch numbers by one each time a claim file is sent. User never sees this number. Maxes out at 999, then loops back to 1. This field must NOT be cached and must be ignored in the code except where it explicitly retrieves it from the db. Defaults to 0 for brand new clearinghouses, which causes the first batch to go out as #1.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.ModemPort
member.summary: Was not used. 1,2,3,or 4. The port that the modem is connected to if applicable. Always uses 9600 baud and standard settings. Will crash if port or modem not valid.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.LoginID
member.summary: A clearinghouse usually has a login ID that is used with the password in order to access the remote server. This value is not usualy used within the actual claim. Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.SenderName
member.summary: Used in 1000A NM1 and 1000A PER. But if SenderTIN is blank, then OPEN DENTAL SOFTWARE is used instead. Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.SenderTelephone
member.summary: Used in 1000A PER. But if SenderTIN is blank, then 8776861248 is used instead. 10 digit phone is required by WebMD and is universally assumed, so for now, this must be either blank or 10 digits. Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.GS03
member.summary: Usually the same as ISA08, but at least one clearinghouse uses a different number here.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.ISA02
member.summary: Authorization information. Almost always blank. Used for Denti-Cal.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.ISA04
member.summary: Security information. Almost always blank. Used for Denti-Cal.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.ISA16
member.summary: X12 component element separator. Two digit hexadecimal string representing an ASCII character or blank. Usually blank, implying 3A which represents ':'. For Denti-Cal, hexadecimal value 22 must be used, corresponding to '"'.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.SeparatorData
member.summary: X12 data element separator. Two digit hexadecimal string representing an ASCII character or blank. Usually blank, implying 2A which represents '*'. For Denti-Cal, hexadecimal value 1D must be used, corresponding to the "group separator" character which has no visual representation.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.SeparatorSegment
member.summary: X12 segment terminator. Two digit hexadecimal string representing an ASCII character or blank. Usually blank, implying 7E which represents '~'. For Denti-Cal, hexadecimal value 1C must be used, corresponding to the "file separator" character which has no visual representation.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.ClinicNum
member.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. ClinicNum=0 for HQ.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clearinghouse.HqClearinghouseNum
member.summary: FK to ClearinghouseNum. Never 0. Points to the HQ copy of this clearinghouse. If this copy is the HQ copy, then HqClearinghouseNum=ClearinghouseNum.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Clinic
member.summary: A clinic is usually a separate physical office location. If multiple clinics are sharing one database, then this is used. Patients, Operatories, Claims, and many other types of objects can be assigned to a clinic.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clinic.ClinicNum
member.summary: Primary key. Used in patient,payment,claimpayment,appointment,procedurelog, etc.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clinic.Description
member.summary: Use Abbr for all user-facing forms.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clinic.Address2
member.summary: Second line of address.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clinic.State
member.summary: 2 char in the US.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Clinic.BillingAddress
member.summary: Overrides Address on claims if not blank.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.ClockEvent
member.summary: One clock-in / clock-out pair. Of, if the pair is a break, then it's an out/in pair. With normal clock in/out pairs, we want to know how long the employee was working. It's the opposite with breaks. We want to know how long they were not working, so the pair is backwards. This means that a normal clock in is left incomplete when the clock out for break is created. And once both are finished, the regular in/out will surround the break. Breaks cannot be viewed easily on the same grid as regular clock events for this reason. And since breaks do not affect pay, they should not clutter the normal grid.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClockEvent.ClockEventNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClockEvent.EmployeeNum
member.summary: FK to employee.EmployeeNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClockEvent.TimeEntered1
member.summary: The actual time that this entry was entered. Cannot be 01-01-0001.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClockEvent.TimeDisplayed1
member.summary: The time to display and to use in all calculations. Cannot be 01-01-0001.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClockEvent.ClockStatus
member.summary: Enum:TimeClockStatus Home, Lunch, or Break. The status really only applies to the clock out. Except the Break status applies to both out and in.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClockEvent.TimeEntered2
member.summary: The user can never edit this, but the program has to be able to edit this when user clocks out. Can be 01-01-0001 if not clocked out yet.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClockEvent.TimeDisplayed2
member.summary: User can edit. Can be 01-01-0001 if not clocked out yet.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClockEvent.OTimeHours
member.summary: This is a manual override for OTimeAuto. Typically -1 hour (-01:00:00) to indicate no override. When used as override, allowed values are zero or positive. This is an alternative to using a TimeAdjust row.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClockEvent.OTimeAuto
member.summary: Automatically calculated OT. Will be zero if none.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClockEvent.Adjust
member.summary: This is a manual override of AdjustAuto. Ignored unless AdjustIsOverridden set to true. When used as override, it's typically negative, although zero and positive are also allowed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClockEvent.AdjustAuto
member.summary: Automatically calculated Adjust. Will be zero if none.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClockEvent.AdjustIsOverridden
member.summary: True if AdjustAuto is overridden by Adjust.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClockEvent.Rate2Hours
member.summary: This is a manual override for Rate2Auto. Typically -1 hour (-01:00:00) to indicate no override. When used as override, allowed values are zero or positive. This is the portion of the hours worked which are at Rate2, so it's not in addition to the hours worked. Also used to calculate the Rate2 OT.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ClockEvent.Rate2Auto
member.summary: Automatically calculated rate2 pay. Will be zero if none.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Computer
member.summary: Keeps track of the computers in an office. The list will eventually become cluttered with the names of old computers that are no longer in service. The old rows can be safely deleted. Although the primary key is used in at least one table, this will probably be changed, and the computername will become the primary key.

member.summary: Primary key.

member.summary: Name of the computer.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Computer.LastHeartBeat
member.summary: Allows use to tell which computers are running. All workstations record a heartbeat here at an interval of 3 minutes. And when they shut down, they set this value to min. So if the heartbeat is fairly fresh, then that's an accurate indicator of whether Open Dental is running on that computer.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ComputerPref.GraphicsUseHardware

Of course, the final pixel format on the customer machine depends on the list of available formats. Best match pixel format is always used. This option only applies if GraphicsSimple is set to false.

member.summary: One field on a sheet.

member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SheetField.FieldType
member.summary: Enum:SheetFieldType OutputText, InputField, StaticText,Parameter(only used for SheetField, not SheetFieldDef),Image,Drawing,Line,Rectangle,CheckBox,SigBox,PatImage.

summary.para: Mostly for OutputText and InputField types. Each sheet typically has a main datatable type.

OutputText: FieldName is usually the string representation of the database column for the main table. For other tables, it can be of the form table.Column. There may also be extra fields available that are not strictly pulled from the database. Extra fields will start with lowercase to indicate that they are not pure database fields. The list of available fields for each type in SheetFieldsAvailable. Users can pick from that list.
InputField: are internally tied to actions to persist the data. So they are also hard coded and are available in SheetFieldsAvailable.
Static images: this is the full file name including extension, but without path. Static images paths are reconstructed by looking in the AtoZ folder, SheetImages folder.

PatImage: This is the DefNum for the document category. This is used in SheetFiller to find a document num, this is translated in FormSheetFillEdit to a human readable name. Example: 113 (if 113 is the defnum for photos). In FormSheetFillEdit, this will display as PatImg:photos.
Parameter: the FieldName stores the name of the parameter.

For OutputText, this value is set before printing. This is the data obtained from the database and ready to print. For StaticText, this is copied from the sheetFieldDef, but in-line fields like [this] will have been filled. For an archived sheet retrieved from the database (all SheetField rows), this value will have been saved and will not be filled again automatically.
Parameter fieldtype: this will store the value of the parameter.
Drawing fieldtype: this will be the point data for the lines. The format would look similar to this: 45,68;48,70;49,72;0,0;55,88;etc. It's simply a sequence of points, separated by semicolons.
CheckBox: it will either be an X or empty.
SigBox: the first char will be 0 or 1 to indicate SigIsTopaz, and all subsequent chars will be the Signature itself.
PatImage: Docnum or blank, FK to document.DocNum.
ComboBox: The chosen option, semicolon, then a pipe delimited list of options such as: March;January|February|March|April

ScreenChart: Contains a semicolon delimited list of a single number followed by groups of comma separated surfaces. The first digit represents what type of ScreenChart it is. 0 = Permanent, 1 = Primary It may look like 0;S,P,N;S,S,S;... etc.

member.summary: This is only used for checkboxes that you want to behave like radiobuttons. Set the FieldName the same for each Checkbox in the group. The FieldValue will likely be X for one of them and empty string for the others. Each of them will have a different RadioButtonValue. Whichever box has X, the RadioButtonValue for that box will be used when importing. This field is not used for "misc" radiobutton groups.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Sheet.Parameters
member.Summary: A collection of all parameters for this sheetdef. There's usually only one parameter. The first parameter will be a List long if it's a batch. If a sheet has already been filled, saved to the database, and printed, then there is no longer any need for the parameters in order to fill the data. So a retrieved sheet will have no parameters, signalling a skip in the fill phase. There will still be parameters tucked away in the Field data in the database, but they won't become part of the sheet.

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.Sheet.HeightPage
member.summary: Vertical height per page taking into account the IsLandscape flag.

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.Sheet.WidthPage
member.summary: Horizontal width per page taking into account the IsLandscape flag.

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.Sheet.HeightLastField
member.summary: Finds the lowest lower bound of all of the SheeFields. Recalculated every time this property is called.

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.Sheet.SheetFieldsXml
member.summary: Used only for serialization purposes

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Site
member.summary: Generally used by mobile clinics to track the temporary locations where treatment is performed, such as schools, nursing homes, and community centers. Replaces the old school table.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Site.SiteNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Site.Note
member.summary: Notes could include phone, contacts, etc.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Site.Address2
member.summary: Optional second address line.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Site.State
member.summary: 2 Char in USA. Used to store province for Canadian users.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Site.Zip
member.summary: Postal code.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Site.ProvNum
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Default provider for the site.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Site.PlaceService
member.summary: Enum:PlaceOfService Describes where the site is located.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Statement
member.summary: Represents one statement for one family. Usually already sent, but could still be waiting to send.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.StatementNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Typically the guarantor. Can also be the patient for walkout statements.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.SuperFamily
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Typically zero unless a super family statement is desired. Will be non-zero if the patient is associated with a super family and a super family statement is desired.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.DateSent
member.summary: This will always be a valid and reasonable date regardless of whether it's actually been sent yet.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.DateRangeFrom
member.summary: Typically 45 days before dateSent

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.DateRangeTo
member.summary: Any date >= year 2200 is considered max val. We generally try to automate this value to be the same date as the statement rather than the max val. This is so that when payment plans are displayed, we can add approximately 10 days to effectively show the charge that will soon be due. Adding the 10 days is not done until display time.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.Note
member.summary: Can include line breaks. This ordinary note will be in the standard font.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.NoteBold
member.summary: More important notes may go here. Font will be bold. Color and size of text will be customizable in setup.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.Mode_
member.summary: Enum:StatementMode Mail, InPerson, Email, Electronic.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.HidePayment
member.summary: Set true to hide the credit card section, and the please pay box.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.SinglePatient
member.summary: One patient on statement instead of entire family.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.Intermingled
member.summary: If entire family, then this determines whether they are all intermingled into one big grid, or whether they are all listed in separate grids.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.IsSent
member.summary: True

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.DocNum
member.summary: FK to document.DocNum when a pdf has been archived.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.DateTStamp
member.summary: Date/time last altered.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.IsReceipt
member.summary: The only effect of this flag is to change the text at the top of a statement from "statement" to "receipt". It might later do more.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.IsInvoice
member.summary: This flag is for marking a statement as Invoice. In this case, it must have procedures and/or adjustments attached.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.IsInvoiceCopy
member.summary: Only used if IsInvoice=true. The first printout will not be a copy. Subsequent printouts will show "copy" on them.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.EmailSubject
member.summary: Empty string by default. Only used to override BillingEmailSubject pref when emailing statements. Only set when statements are created from the Billing Options window. No UI for editing.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.EmailBody
member.summary: Empty string by default. Only used to override BillingEmailBodyText pref when emailing statements. Only set when statements are created from the Billing Options window. No UI for editing. Limit in db: 16M char.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.IsBalValid
member.summary: True for statements generated in version 16.1 or greater. Older statements did not store InsEst or BalTotal.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.InsEst
member.summary: Insurance Estimate for entire family, taken from garantor at time of statement being sent/saved.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.BalTotal
member.summary: Total balance for entire family before insurance estimate. Not the same as the sum of the 4 aging balances because this can be negative.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.StatementType
member.summary: Enum:StmtType Statement, Receipt, Invoice, LimitedStatement.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement._listAdjNums
member.summary: List of attached adjustment.AdjNums for this statement. Limit in db: 16M char.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement._listPaySplitNums
member.summary: List of attached paysplit.PaySplitNums for this statement. Limit in db: 16M char.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Statement._listProcNums
member.summary: List of attached procedure.ProcNums for this statement. Limit in db: 16M char.

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.ListAdjNums
member.summary: Set list to null to force refresh.

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.ListPaySplitNums
member.summary: Set list to null to force refresh.

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.Statement.ListProcNums
member.summary: Set list to null to force refresh.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.StmtType
member.summary: The type of this statement. This will eventually replace IsReceipt and IsInvoice. Stored as EnumAsString.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.StmtType.NotSet
member.summary: Regular statement.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.StmtType.LimitedStatement
member.summary: Contains information about specific procedures.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.TaskAncestor
member.summary: Represents one ancestor of one task. Each task will have at least one ancestor unless it is directly on a main trunk. An ancestor is defined as a tasklist that is higher in the heirarchy for the task, regardless of how many levels up it is. This allows us to mark task lists as having "new" tasks, and it allows us to quickly check for new tasks for a user on startup.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TaskAncestor.TaskAncestorNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TaskAncestor.TaskNum
member.summary: FK to task.TaskNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TaskAncestor.TaskListNum
member.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.TaskSubscription
member.summary: A subscription of one user to either a tasklist or to a task.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TaskSubscription.TaskSubscriptionNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TaskSubscription.UserNum
member.summary: FK to userod.UserNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TaskSubscription.TaskListNum
member.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.SupplyOrderItem
member.summary: One item on one supply order. This table links supplies to orders as well as storing a small amount of additional info.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SupplyOrderItem.SupplyOrderItemNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SupplyOrderItem.SupplyOrderNum
member.summary: FK to supplyorder.supplyOrderNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SupplyOrderItem.SupplyNum
member.summary: FK to supply.SupplyNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SupplyOrderItem.Qty
member.summary: How many were ordered.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SupplyOrderItem.Price
member.summary: Price per unit on this order.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.SupplyOrder
member.summary: One supply order to one supplier. Contains SupplyOrderItems.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SupplyOrder.SupplyOrderNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SupplyOrder.SupplierNum
member.summary: FK to supplier.SupplierNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SupplyOrder.DatePlaced
member.summary: A date greater than 2200 (eg 2500), is considered a max date. A max date is used for an order that was started but has not yet been placed. This puts it at the end of the list where it belongs, but it will display as blank. Only one unplaced order is allowed per supplier.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SupplyOrder.AmountTotal
member.summary: The sum of all the amounts of each item on the order. If any of the item prices are zero, then it won't auto calculate this total. This will allow the user to manually put in the total without having it get deleted.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Supply
member.summary: A dental supply or office supply item.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supply.SupplyNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supply.SupplierNum
member.summary: FK to supplier.SupplierNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supply.CatalogNumber
member.summary: The catalog item number that the supplier uses to identify the supply.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supply.Descript
member.summary: The description can be similar to the catalog, but not required. Typically includes qty per box/case, etc.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supply.Category
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. User can define their own categories for supplies.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supply.ItemOrder
member.summary: The zero-based order of this supply within it's category.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supply.LevelDesired
member.summary: The level that a fresh order should bring item back up to. Can include fractions. If this is 0, then it will be displayed as having this field blank rather than showing 0. This simply gives a cleaner look.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supply.IsHidden
member.summary: If hidden, then this supply item won't normally show in the main list.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supply.Price
member.summary: The price per unit that the supplier charges for this supply. If this is 0.00, then no price will be displayed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supply.BarCodeOrID
member.summary: Scanned code from a reader.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supply.DispDefaultQuant
member.summary: Only used for dental schools. This is the typical quantity dispensed at the window.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supply.DispUnitsCount
member.summary: Only used in dental schools. For example, 20 capsules composite per container.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supply.DispUnitDesc
member.summary: Only used in dental schools. Description of the units when dispensing for use. For example: Capsule, cartridge, carpule, glove, or needle.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supply.LevelOnHand
member.summary: Quantity of the supply available.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Supplier
member.summary: A company that provides supplies for the office, typically dental supplies.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supplier.SupplierNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supplier.CustomerId
member.summary: The customer ID that this office uses for transactions with the supplier

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supplier.Website
member.summary: Full address to website. We might make it clickable.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supplier.UserName
member.summary: The username used to log in to the supplier website.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supplier.Password
member.summary: The password to log in to the supplier website. Not encrypted or hidden in any way.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Supplier.Note
member.summary: Any note regarding supplier. Could hold address, CC info, etc.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.SupplyNeeded
member.summary: A supply freeform typed in by a user.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SupplyNeeded.SupplyNeededNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Popup
member.summary: If an existing popup message gets changed, then an archive first gets created that's a copy of the original. This is so that we can track historical changes. When a new one gets created, all the archived popups will get automatically repointed to the new one. If you "delete" a popup, it actually archives that popup. All the other archives of that popup still point to the newly archived popup, but now there is no popup in that group with the IsArchived flag not set.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Popup.PopupNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Popup.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Popup.Description
member.summary: The text of the popup.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Popup.IsDisabled
member.summary: If true, then the popup won't automatically show when a patient is selected. Kind of useless except for offices that want to still show historical popups.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Popup.PopupLevel
member.summary: Enum:EnumPopupLevel 0=Patient, 1=Family, 2=Superfamily. If Family, then this Popup will apply to the entire family. If Superfamily, then this popup will apply to the entire superfamily.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Popup.UserNum
member.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Popup.DateTimeEntry
member.summary: The server time that this note was entered. Cannot be changed by user. Does not get changed automatically when level or isDisabled gets changed. If note itself changes, then a new popup is created along with a new DateTimeEntry. Current popup's edit date gets set to the previous entry's DateTimeEntry

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Popup.IsArchived
member.summary: Indicates that this is not the most current popup and that it is an archive. True for any archived or "deleted" popups.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Popup.PopupNumArchive
member.summary: This will be zero for current popups that show when a patient is selected. Archived popups will have a value which is the FK to its parent Popup. The parent popup could be the most recent popup or another archived popup. Will be zero for current and "deleted" popups.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EnumPopupLevel.Patient
member.summary: 0=Patient

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EnumPopupLevel.Family
member.summary: 1=Family

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EnumPopupLevel.SuperFamily
member.summary: 2=SuperFamily

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EnumPopupLevel.Automation
member.summary: 3=Automation

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.DisplayField
member.summary: Allows customization of which fields display in various lists and grids. For now, the only grid is ProgressNotes. Will also eventually let users set column widths and translate titles. For now, the selections are the same for all computers.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DisplayField.DisplayFieldNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DisplayField.InternalName
member.summary: This is the internal name that OD uses to identify the field within this category. This will be the default description if the user doesn't specify an alternate.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DisplayField.ItemOrder
member.summary: Order to display in the grid or list. Every entry must have a unique itemorder.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DisplayField.Description
member.summary: Optional alternate description to display for field. Can be in another language. For the ortho category, this is the 'key', since InternalName is blank.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DisplayField.ColumnWidth
member.summary: For grid columns, this lets user override the column width. Especially useful for foreign languages.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DisplayField.Category
member.summary: Enum:DisplayFieldCategory If category is 0, then this is attached to a ChartView.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DisplayField.ChartViewNum
member.summary: FK to chartview.ChartViewNum. 0 if attached to a category.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DisplayField.PickList
member.summary: Newline delimited string which contains the selectable options in combo box dropdowns. Specifically for the Ortho chart.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.DisplayField.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DisplayFieldCategory.None
member.summary: 0- This indicates progress notes.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DisplayFieldCategory.PatientInformation
member.summary: 2- Family module.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.DisplayFieldCategory.AccountPatientInformation
member.summary: 10- Account module patient information

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.ProcCodeNote
member.summary: Stores the default note and time increments for one procedure code for one provider. That way, an unlimited number of providers can each have different notes and times. These notes and times override the defaults which are part of the procedurecode table. So, for single provider offices, there will be no change to the current interface.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ProcCodeNote.ProcCodeNoteNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ProcCodeNote.CodeNum
member.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ProcCodeNote.ProvNum
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ProcCodeNote.Note
member.summary: The note.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ProcCodeNote.ProcTime
member.summary: X's and /'s describe Dr's time and assistant's time in the same increments as the user has set.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.ProcCodeNote.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this ProcCodeNote

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.ReqStudent

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ReqStudent.PatNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ReqStudent.InstructorNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ReqStudent.DateCompleted

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.LabTurnaround
member.summary: The amount of time it takes for a lab case to be processed at the lab. Used to compute due dates.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabTurnaround.LabTurnaroundNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabTurnaround.LaboratoryNum
member.summary: FK to laboratory.LaboratoryNum. The lab that this item is attached to.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabTurnaround.Description
member.summary: The description of the service that the lab is performing.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabTurnaround.DaysPublished
member.summary: The number of days that the lab publishes as the turnaround time for the service.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabTurnaround.DaysActual
member.summary: The actual number of days. Might be longer than DaysPublished due to travel time. This is what the actual calculations will be done on.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.LabCase
member.summary: A lab case.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabCase.LabCaseNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabCase.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabCase.LaboratoryNum
member.summary: FK to laboratory.LaboratoryNum. The lab that the case gets sent to. Required.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabCase.AptNum
member.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum. This is how a lab case is attached to a scheduled appointment. 1:1 relationship for now. Only one labcase per appointment, and (obviously) only one appointment per labcase. Labcase can exist without being attached to any appointments at all, making this zero.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabCase.PlannedAptNum
member.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum. This is how a lab case is attached to a planned appointment in addition to the scheduled appointment.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabCase.DateTimeDue
member.summary: The due date that is put on the labslip. NOT when you really need the labcase back, which is usually a day or two later and is the date of the appointment this case is attached to.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabCase.DateTimeCreated
member.summary: When this lab case was created. User can edit.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabCase.DateTimeSent
member.summary: Time that it actually went out to the lab.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabCase.DateTimeRecd
member.summary: Date/time received back from the lab. If this is filled, then the case is considered received.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabCase.DateTimeChecked
member.summary: Date/time that quality was checked. It is now completely ready for the patient.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabCase.ProvNum
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabCase.Instructions
member.summary: The text instructions for this labcase.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LabCase.LabFee
member.summary: There is no UI built yet for this field. Plugins might be making use of this field.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Laboratory

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Laboratory.LaboratoryNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Laboratory.Description
member.summary: Description of lab.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Laboratory.Phone
member.summary: Freeform text includes punctuation.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Laboratory.Notes
member.summary: Any notes. No practical limit to amount of text.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Laboratory.Slip
member.summary: FK to sheetdef.SheetDefNum. Lab slips can be set for individual laboratories. If zero, then the default internal lab slip will be used instead of a custom lab slip.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Mount

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Mount.MountNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Mount.DocCategory

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Mount.Description

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Mount.Note

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Mount.ImgType

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Mount.Width

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Mount.Height

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.MountItemDef

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MountItemDef.MountItemDefNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MountItemDef.MountDefNum
