member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MountItemDef.Width
member.summary: Ignored if mount IsRadiograph. For other mounts, the image will be scaled to fit within this space. Any cropping, rotating, etc, will all be defined in the original image itself.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MountItemDef.Height
member.summary: Ignored if mount IsRadiograph. For other mounts, the image will be scaled to fit within this space. Any cropping, rotating, etc, will all be defined in the original image itself.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.MountDef
member.summary: THIS TABLE IS NOT BEING USED. These can be freely deleted, renamed, moved, etc. without affecting any patient info. mountitemdef

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MountDef.MountDefNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MountDef.ItemOrder
member.summary: The order that the mount defs will show in various lists.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MountDef.IsRadiograph
member.summary: Set to true if this is just xrays. If true, this prevents image from being scaled to fit inside the mount. If false (composite photographs for example) then the images will be scaled to fit inside the mount. Later, the basic appearance or background color might be set based on this flag as well.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MountDef.Width
member.summary: The width of the mount, in pixels. For radiograph mounts, this could be very large. It must be large enough for the radiographs to fit in the mount without scaling. For photos, it should also be large so that the scaling won't be too noticeable. Shrinking to view or print will always produce nicer results than enlarging to view or print.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MountDef.Height
member.summary: Height of the mount in pixels.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans
member.summary: One electronic transaction. Typically, one claim or response. Or one benefit request or response. Is constantly being expanded to include more types of transactions with clearinghouses. Also stores printing of paper claims. Sometimes stores a copy of what was sent.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.EtransNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.DateTimeTrans
member.summary: The date and time of the transaction.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.ClearingHouseNum
member.summary: FK to clearinghouse.ClearinghouseNum . Can be 0 if no clearinghouse was involved.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.Etype
member.summary: Enum:EtransType

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.ClaimNum
member.summary: FK to claim.ClaimNum if a claim. Otherwise 0. Warning. Original claim might have been deleted. But if Canadian claim was successfully sent, then deletion will be blocked.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.OfficeSequenceNumber
member.summary: For Canada. Unique for every transaction sent. Increments by one until 999999, then resets to 1.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.CarrierTransCounter
member.summary: For Canada. Separate counter for each carrier. Increments by one until 99999, then resets to 1.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.CarrierTransCounter2
member.summary: For Canada. If this claim includes secondary, then this is the counter for the secondary carrier.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.CarrierNum
member.summary: FK to carrier.CarrierNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.CarrierNum2
member.summary: FK to carrier.CarrierNum Only used if secondary insurance info is provided on a claim. Necessary for Canada.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum This is useful in case the original claim has been deleted. Now, we can still tell who the patient was.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.BatchNumber
member.summary: Maxes out at 999, then loops back to 1. This is not a good key, but is a restriction of (canadian?). So dates must also be used to isolate the correct BatchNumber key. Specific to one clearinghouse. Only used with e-claims. Claim will have BatchNumber, and 997 will have matching BatchNumber. (In X12 lingo, it's a functional group number)

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.AckCode
member.summary: A=Accepted, R=Rejected, blank if not able to parse, Recd=Received (835s only). More options will be added later. The incoming 997 or 999 sets this flag automatically. To find the 997 or 999, look for a matching BatchNumber with a similar date, since both the claims and the 997 or 999 will both have the same batch number. The 997 or 999 does not have this flag set on itself.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.TransSetNum
member.summary: For sent e-claims, within each batch (functional group), each carrier gets it's own transaction set. Since 997s and 999s acknowledge transaction sets rather than batches, we need to keep track of which transaction set each claim is part of as well as which batch it's part of. This field can't be set as part of 997 or 999, because one 997 or 999 refers to multiple trans sets.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.Note
member.summary: Typical uses include indicating that the report was printed, the claim was resent, reason for rejection, etc. For a 270, this contains the automatically generated short summary of the response. The response could include the reason for failure, or it could be a short summary of the 271.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.EtransMessageTextNum
member.summary: FK to etransmessagetext.EtransMessageTextNum. Can be 0 if there is no message text. Multiple Etrans objects can refer to the same message text, very common in a batch.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.AckEtransNum
member.summary: FK to etrans.EtransNum. Only has a non-zero value if there exists an ack etrans, like a 997, 999, 277ack, 271, 835, or ackError. There can be only one ack for any given etrans, but one ack can apply to multiple etran's that were sent as one batch. 999 FK can be replaced by 277ack FK, and then by 835 FK. This column does triple duty.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.PlanNum
member.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum. Used if EtransType.BenefitInquiry270 and BenefitResponse271 and Eligibility_CA.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.InsSubNum
member.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum. Used if EtransType.BenefitInquiry270 and BenefitResponse271 and Eligibility_CA.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.TranSetId835
member.summary: X12 ST02 Transaction Set Identifier for an 835. Specifies the unique transaction id within the 835 that this etrans record corresponds to. This column will always be set for 835s imported in version 14.3 or greater. For 835s imported in version 14.2, this column will alway be blank. If blank, and there is more than one transaction id within the 835, then FormEtrans835PickEob will show and allow the user to select the desired EOB from a list. The X12 guide states that there is only one transaction (EOB) allowed per 835, but ClaimConnect returns multiple transactions (EOBs) within a single 835 and other clearinghouses probably do as well. When an 835 is imported, it is examined to determine the number of transactions within it. One etrans entry is created for each EOB within the 835. We may have a similar issue with multiple transactions within 277s as well, but we have not seen any evidence yet. Our current 277 implementation expects a single transaction, just as the X12 standard specifies.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.CarrierNameRaw
member.summary: Only used if the CarrierNum is 0. If CarrierNum is not 0, the name associated to CarrierNum will override CarrierNameRaw in the FormClaimsSend history grid. Added for 835s so that customer databases are not cluttered with dummy carriers and so there is no extra processing time when FormClaimsSend is loading. Size is 60 bytes to match 835 carrier name length.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Etrans.PatientNameRaw
member.summary: Only used if the PatNum is 0. If PatNum is not 0, the name associated to PatNum will override PatientNameRaw in the FormClaimsSend history grid. Added for 835s so that there is no extra processing time when FormClaimsSend is loading, and so text representing the patient count can be used instead of an actual patient name. Size is 133 bytes to match X12 specs for last name (60), first name (35), middle name (25), suffix (10), and spaces in between (3).

member.summary: Date that the disease was set resolved or inactive. Will be minval if still active. ProbStatus should be used to determine if it is active or not.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Disease.SnomedProblemType
member.summary: FK to snomed.SnomedCode. Used in EHR CCD export/import only. Must be one of the following SNOMED codes: Problem/Concern (55607006 or blank), Finding (404684003), Complaint (409586006), Dignosis (282291009), Condition (64572001), FunctionalLimitation (248536006), Symptom (418799008).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Disease.FunctionStatus
member.summary: Enum:FunctionalStatus Used to export EHR CCD functional status and/or cognitive status information only.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.FunctionalStatus
member.summary: Used in EHR to export patient functional and cognitive statuses on CCD documents.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FunctionalStatus.Problem
member.summary: 0 - Default value. If not using EHR, then each diseasedef will use this value.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FunctionalStatus.CognitiveResult
member.summary: 1 - This clinical statement contains details of an evaluation or assessment of a patients cognitive status. The evaluation may include assessment of a patient's mood, memory, and ability to make decisions. The statement will include, if present, supporting caregivers, non-medical devices, and the time period for which the evaluation and assessment were performed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FunctionalStatus.CognitiveProblem
member.summary: 2 - A cognitive status problem observation is a clinical statement that describes a patient's cognitive condition, findings or symptoms. Examples of cognitive problem observations are inability to recall, amnesia, dementia, and aggressive behavior. A cognitive problem observation is a finding or medical condition. This is different from a cognitive result observation, which is a response to a question that provides insight to the patient's cognitive status. It reflects findings that provide information about a medical condition, while a result observation reflects responses to questions in a cognitive test or those that provide information about a person's judgement, comprehension ability, and response speed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FunctionalStatus.FunctionalResult
member.summary: 3 - This clinical statement represents details of an evaluation or assessment of a patients functional status. The evaluation may include assessment of a patient's language, vision, hearing, activities of daily living, behavior, general function, mobility and self-care status. The statement will include, if present, supporting caregivers, non-medical devices, and the time period for which the evaluation and assessment were performed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.FunctionalStatus.FunctionalProblem
member.summary: 4 - A functional status problem observation is a clinical statement that represents a patients functional perfomance and ability.

member.summary: Crop rectangle Width in original image pixel coordinates. May be zero if no cropping. May be greater than original image width.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Document.CropH
member.summary: Crop rectangle Height in original image pixel coordinates. May be zero if no cropping. May be greater than original image height.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Document.WindowingMin
member.summary: The lower value of the "windowing" (contrast/brightness) for radiographs. Default is 0. Max is 255.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Document.WindowingMax
member.summary: The upper value of the "windowing" (contrast/brightness) for radiographs. Default is 0(no windowing). Max is 255.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Document.MountItemNum
member.summary: FK to mountitem.MountItemNum. If set, then this image will only show on a mount, not in the main tree. If set to 0, then no mount item is associated with this document.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Document.DateTStamp
member.summary: Date/time last altered.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Document.RawBase64
member.summary: The raw file data encoded as base64. Only used if there is no AtoZ folder.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Document.Thumbnail
member.summary: Thumbnail encoded as base64. Only present if not using AtoZ folder. 100x100 pixels, jpg, takes around 5.5k.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Document.ExternalGUID
member.summary: The primary key associated to a document hosted on an external source.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Document.ExternalSource
member.summary: Enum:ExternalSourceType The source for the corresponding ExternalGUID.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Document.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this Document.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.ExternalSourceType
member.summary: Supported sources that help identify what the corresponding ExternalGUID column should be used for.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ExternalSourceType.None
member.summary: This is a document that is not stored in an external source. All documents stored by Open Dental will be this type.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ExternalSourceType.Dropbox
member.summary: This document can be found in a corresponding Dropbox account.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Dunning
member.summary: A message that will show on certain patient statements when printing bills. Criteria must be met in order for the dunning message to show.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Dunning.DunningNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Dunning.DunMessage
member.summary: The actual dunning message that will go on the patient bill.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Dunning.BillingType
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Dunning.AgeAccount
member.summary: Program forces only 0,30,60,or 90.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Dunning.InsIsPending
member.summary: Enum:YN Set Y to only show if insurance is pending.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Dunning.MessageBold
member.summary: A message that will be copied to the NoteBold field of the Statement.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Dunning.EmailSubject
member.summary: An override for the default email subject.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Dunning.EmailBody
member.summary: An override for the default email body. Limit in db: 16M char.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Dunning.DaysInAdvance
member.summary: The number of days before an account reaches AgeAccount to include this dunning message on statements. Example: If DaysInAdvance=3 and AgeAccount=90, an account that is 87 days old when bills are generated will include this message.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Dunning.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this Dunning.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.ElectID
member.summary: Corresponds to the electid table in the database. Helps with entering elecronic/payor id's as well as keeping track of the specific carrier requirements. Only used by the X12 format.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ElectID.ElectIDNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ElectID.PayorID
member.summary: aka Electronic ID. A simple string.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ElectID.CarrierName
member.summary: Used when doing a search.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ElectID.IsMedicaid
member.summary: True if medicaid. Then, the billing and treating providers will have their Medicaid ID's attached.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ElectID.ProviderTypes
member.summary: Integers separated by commas. Each long represents a ProviderSupplementalID type that is required by this insurance. Usually only used for BCBS or other carriers that require supplemental provider id's. Even if we don't put the supplemental types in here, the user can still add them. This just helps by doing an additional check for known required types.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ElectID.Comments
member.summary: Any comments. Usually includes enrollment requirements and descriptions of how to use the provider id's supplied by the carrier because they might call them by different names.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.EmailAttach
member.summary: Keeps track of one file attached to an email. Multiple files can be attached to an email using this method.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailAttach.EmailAttachNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailAttach.EmailMessageNum
member.summary: FK to emailmessage.EmailMessageNum. 0 if EmailTemplateNum is set, otherwise must have a value.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailAttach.DisplayedFileName
member.summary: The name of the file that shows on the email. For example: tooth2.jpg.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailAttach.ActualFileName
member.summary: The actual file is stored in the A-Z folder in EmailAttachments. This field stores the name of the file. The files are named automatically based on Date/time along with a random number. This ensures that they will be sequential as well as unique.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailAttach.EmailTemplateNum
member.summary: FK to emailtemplate.EmailTemplateNum. 0 if EmailMessageNum is set, otherwise must have a value.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage
member.summary: Stores both sent and received emails, as well as saved emails which are still in composition.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage.EmailMessageNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The patient whom is sending this message. May be sent by a guarantor on behalf of a dependent.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage.ToAddress
member.summary: Either a single email address or a comma-delimited list of addresses. For web mail messages, this will not be an email address. Instead, it will be the name of the corresponding patient or provider.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage.FromAddress
member.summary: Valid email address. For web mail messages, this will not be an email address. Instead, it will be the name of the corresponding patient or provider.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage.Subject
member.summary: Subject line.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage.BodyText
member.summary: Body of the email

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage.MsgDateTime
member.summary: Date and time the message was sent. Automated at the UI level.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage.SentOrReceived
member.summary: Enum:EmailSentOrReceived Neither, Received, Read, WebMailReceived, WebMailRecdRead, WebMailSent, WebMailSentRead, SentDirect, ReceivedEncrypted, ReceivedDirect, ReadDirect, AckDirectProcessed, AckDirectNotSent

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage.RecipientAddress
member.summary: Copied from the EmailAddress.EmailUsername field when a message is received into the inbox. Similar to the ToAddress, except the ToAddress could contain multiple recipient addresses or group email address instead. The recipient address helps match the an email to a particular EmailAddress.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage.RawEmailIn
member.summary: For incomming email only. The raw email contents for encrypted email or email which we had trouble parsing. For unencrypted (clear text) email, this will be similar to the raw email except the attachments will be dissolved to prevent db bloating. Can be used for debugging if there are any issues parsing the content. This will bloat the database a little bit, but we need it for now to ensure our inbox is working in real world scenarios. Might be blank for a few emails downloaded immediately after the email inbox feature was created.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage.Attachments
member.summary: Not a database column.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage.ProvNumWebMail
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. The provider to whom this message was sent or from whom this message was sent. Only used when EmailSentOrReceived is WebMailReceived, WebMailRecdRead, WebMailSent, or WebMailSentRead. Will be 0 if not a web mail message.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage.PatNumSubj
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Represents the patient to whom this email message is addressed, or from whom it is being sent on behalf of. If guarantor is sending on behalf of self then this field will match PatNum field.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage.CcAddress
member.summary: Single address or comma-delimited list of addresses. User may enter multiple email addresses for visible carbon copies.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage.BccAddress
member.summary: Single email address or comma-delimited list of addresses. User may enter multiple email addresses for blind carbon copies.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage.HideIn
member.summary: Enum:HideInFlags None=0,EmailInbox=1. Indicates which places in the program that should not show this email message.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.EmailMessage.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.EmailSentOrReceived
member.summary: 0=Neither, 1=Sent, 2=Received, 3=Read, 4=WebMailReceived, 5=WebMailRecdRead, 6=WebMailSent, 7=WebMailSentRead, 8=SentDirect, 9=ReceivedEncrypted, 10=ReceivedDirect, 11=ReadDirect, 12=AckDirectProcessed, 13=AckDirectNotSent

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailSentOrReceived.Neither
member.summary: 0 Unsent

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailSentOrReceived.Sent
member.summary: 1 For regular email only.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailSentOrReceived.Received
member.summary: 2 For regular email only. Shows in Inbox. Once it's attached to a patient it will also show in Chart module.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailSentOrReceived.Read
member.summary: 3 For received regular email only. Has been read. Shows in Inbox. Once it's attached to a patient it will also show in Chart module.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailSentOrReceived.WebMailReceived
member.summary: 4 WebMail received from patient portal. Shows in OD Inbox and in pt Chart module. Also shows in PP as a sent and unread WebMail msg.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailSentOrReceived.WebMailRecdRead
member.summary: 5 WebMail received from patient portal that has been marked read. Shows in the OD Inbox and in pt Chart module. Also shows in PP as a sent and read WebMail.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailSentOrReceived.WebMailSent
member.summary: 6 Webmail sent from provider to patient. Shows in Chart module and also shows in PP as a received and unread WebMail msg.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailSentOrReceived.WebMailSentRead
member.summary: 7 Webmail sent from provider to patient and read by patient. Shows in Chart module and also shows in PP as a received and read WebMail msg.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailSentOrReceived.SentDirect
member.summary: 8 Sent and encrypted using Direct. Required for counting messages in EHR modules g.1 and g.2, Automated Measure Calculation.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailSentOrReceived.ReceivedEncrypted
member.summary: 9 Received email matches application/pkcs7-mime mime type, but could not be decrypted. Shows in Inbox. The user can decrypt from FormEmailMessageEdit. If the user has the correct private key, then the status will change to Read.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailSentOrReceived.ReceivedDirect
member.summary: 10 Received email matches application/pkcs7-mime mime type and has been decrypted. Shows in Inbox. Once it's attached to a patient it will also show in Chart module. When viewing inside of FormEmailMessageEdit, the XML body of the message shows as xhtml instead of raw. Still need to work on supporting collapsing and expanding, as required for meaningful use in 2014.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailSentOrReceived.ReadDirect
member.summary: 11 For received direct messages. Has been read. Shows in Inbox. Once it's attached to a patient it will also show in Chart module. When viewing inside of FormEmailMessageEdit, the XML body of the message shows as xhtml.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailSentOrReceived.AckDirectProcessed
member.summary: 12 Message Delivery Notification (MDN) processed. Always outgoing. Indicates to sender that a Direct message was received and decrypted, but not necessarily displayed for the user. Does not show in patient Chart. Attached to the same patient as the incoming email which caused the MDN to be sent.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EmailSentOrReceived.AckDirectNotSent
member.summary: 13 Message Delivery Notification (MDN) created and saved to db, but not sent yet. Does not show in patient Chart. Attached to the same patient as the incoming email which caused the MDN to be created. This status is used to try resending MDNs if they fail to send. The MDN is saved to the db so the unset MDNs can be found easily, and also because MDNs are hard to rebuild again later.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.HideInFlags.None
member.summary: 0 - None

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.HideInFlags.EmailInbox
member.summary: 1 - Hide email from inbox view

member.summary: Body of the email

member.summary: Different than Subject. The description of the email template. This is what the user sees in the list.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.EmailTemplate.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this EmailTemplate.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Employer
member.summary: Most insurance plans are organized by employer. This table keeps track of the list of employers. The address fields were added at one point, but I don't know why they don't show in the program in order to edit. Nobody has noticed their absence even though it's been a few years, so for now we are just using the EmpName and not the address.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Employer.State
member.summary: 2 char in the US.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Employer.Phone
member.summary: Includes any punctuation.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Fee
member.summary: There is one entry in this table for each fee for a single procedurecode. So if there are 5 different fees stored for one procedurecode, then there will be five entries here.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Fee.FeeNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Fee.Amount
member.summary: The amount usually charged. If an amount is unknown, then the entire Fee entry is deleted from the database. The absence of a fee is shown in the user interface as a blank entry. For clinic and/or provider fees, amount can be set to -1 which indicates that their fee should be blank and not use the default fee.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Fee.OldCode
member.summary: Do not use.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Fee.FeeSched

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Fee.UseDefaultFee
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Fee.UseDefaultCov
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Fee.CodeNum
member.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum.

member.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. (Used if localization of fees for a feesched is enabled)

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Fee.ProvNum
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. (Used if localization of fees for a feesched is enabled)

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Fee.SecUserNumEntry

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Fee.SecDateTEdit
member.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates. Not user editable with the UI.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.GroupPermission
member.summary: Every user group has certain permissions. This defines a permission for a group. The absense of permission would cause that row to be deleted from this table.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.GroupPermission.GroupPermNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.GroupPermission.NewerDate
member.summary: Only granted permission if newer than this date. Can be Minimum (01-01-0001) to always grant permission.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.GroupPermission.NewerDays
member.summary: Can be 0 to always grant permission. Otherwise, only granted permission if item is newer than the given number of days. 1 would mean only if entered today.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.GroupPermission.UserGroupNum
member.summary: FK to usergroup.UserGroupNum. The user group for which this permission is granted. If not authorized, then this groupPermission will have been deleted.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.GroupPermission.PermType

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Permissions.ProcEdit
member.summary: 100- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking. Currently only used for tracking automatically changing the IsCpoe flag on procedures. Can be enhanced to do more in the future. There is only one place where we could have automatically changed IsCpoe without a corresponding log of a different permission. That place is in the OnClosing of the Procedure Edit window. We update this flag even when the user Cancels out of it.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Permissions.ProviderMerge
member.summary: 101- Allows user to use the provider merge tool.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Permissions.MedicationMerge

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Permissions.InsPlanCreateSub

The naming convention of this permission was decided upon by Nathan and Derek based on the following existing permissions: InsPlanChangeSubsc, InsPlanChangeCarrierName, InsPlanChangeAssign. Currently only used in X12 834 insurance plan import.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Permissions.InsPlanEditSub
member.summary: 112 - Audit when an insurance subscriber is edited. The naming convention of this permission was decided upon by Nathan and Derek based on the following existing permissions: InsPlanChangeSubsc, InsPlanChangeCarrierName, InsPlanChangeAssign. Currently only used in X12 834 insurance plan import.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Permissions.InsPlanAddPat
member.summary: 113 - Audit when a patient is added to an insurance plan. The naming convention of this permission was decided upon by Nathan and Derek based on the following existing permissions: InsPlanChangeSubsc, InsPlanChangeCarrierName, InsPlanChangeAssign. Currently only used in X12 834 insurance plan import.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Permissions.InsPlanDropPat
member.summary: 114 - Audit when a patient is dropped from an insurance plan. The naming convention of this permission was decided upon by Nathan and Derek based on the following existing permissions: InsPlanChangeSubsc, InsPlanChangeCarrierName, InsPlanChangeAssign. Currently only used in X12 834 insurance plan import.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Permissions.InsPlanVerifyList
member.summary: 115 - Allows users to be assigned Insurance Verifications.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Permissions.SplitCreatePastLockDate
member.summary: 116 - Allows users to bypass the global lock date to add paysplits.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Permissions.ProcComplEditLimited
member.summary: 117 - Uses date restrictions. Covers editing some fields of completed procs. Limited list includes treatment area, diagnosis, add adjustment, Do Not Bill To Ins, Hide Graphics, Misc tab, Medical tab, E-claim note, and the Prosthesis Replacement group box.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Permissions.ClaimDelete
member.summary: 118 - Uses date restrictions based on the SecDateEntry field as the claim date. Covers deleting a claim of any status (Sent, Waiting to Send, Received, etc).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Permissions.InsWriteOffEdit
member.summary:
119 - Covers editing the Write Off and Write Off Override fields for claimprocs as well as deleting/creating claimprocs.
Uses date/days restriction based on the attached proc.DateEntryC; unless it's a total payment, then uses claimproc.SecDateEntry.
Applies to all plan types (i.e. PPO, Category%, Capitation, etc).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Permissions.ApptConfirmStatusEdit

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Permissions.GraphicsRemoteEdit

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Permissions.AuditTrail

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Permissions.ClaimProcReceivedEdit

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan
member.summary: Subscribers can share insplans by using the InsSub table. The patplan table determines coverage for individual patients. InsPlans can also exist without any subscriber.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.PlanNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.GroupName
member.summary: Optional

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.GroupNum
member.summary: Optional. In Canada, this is called the Plan Number.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.PlanNote
member.summary: Note for this plan. Same for all subscribers.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.FeeSched
member.summary: FK to feesched.FeeSchedNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.PlanType
member.summary: ""=percentage(the default),"p"=ppo_percentage,"f"=flatCopay,"c"=capitation.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.ClaimFormNum
member.summary: FK to claimform.ClaimFormNum. eg. "1" for ADA2002. For ADA2006, it varies by office.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.UseAltCode
member.summary: 0=no,1=yes. could later be extended if more alternates required

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.ClaimsUseUCR
member.summary: Fee billed on claim should be the UCR fee for the patient's provider.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.CopayFeeSched
member.summary: FK to feesched.FeeSchedNum. Not usually used. This fee schedule holds only co-pays(patient portions). Only used for Capitation or for fixed copay plans.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.EmployerNum
member.summary: FK to employer.EmployerNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.CarrierNum
member.summary: FK to carrier.CarrierNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.AllowedFeeSched
member.summary: FK to feesched.FeeSchedNum. Not usually used. This fee schedule holds amounts allowed by carriers.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.DivisionNo
member.summary: Only used in Canada. It's a suffix to the plan number (group number).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.IsMedical
member.summary: True if this is medical insurance rather than dental insurance. When creating a claim, this, along with pref.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.FilingCode
member.summary: FK to insfilingcode.InsFilingCodeNum. Used for e-claims. Also used for some complex reports in public health. The e-claim usage might become obsolete when PlanID implemented by HIPAA. Can be 0 to indicate none. Then 'CI' will go out on claims.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.DentaideCardSequence
member.summary: Canadian e-claim field. D11 and E07. Zero indicates empty. Mandatory value for Dentaide. Not used for all others. 2 digit.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.ShowBaseUnits
member.summary: If checked, the units Qty will show the base units assigned to a procedure on the claim form.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.CodeSubstNone
member.summary: Set to true to not allow procedure code downgrade substitution on this insurance plan.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.IsHidden
member.summary: Set to true to hide it from the pick list and from the main list.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.MonthRenew
member.summary: The month, 1 through 12 when the insurance plan renews. It will renew on the first of the month. To indicate calendar year, set renew month to 0.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.FilingCodeSubtype
member.summary: FK to insfilingcodesubtype.InsFilingCodeSubtypeNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.CanadianPlanFlag
member.summary: Canadian C12. Single char, usually blank. If non-blank, then it's one of three kinds of Provincial Medical Plans. A=Newfoundland MCP Plan. V=Veteran's Affairs Plan. N=NIHB. N and V are not yet in use, so they will result in blank being sent instead. See Elig5.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.CanadianDiagnosticCode
member.summary: Canadian C39. Required when CanadianPlanFlag is 'A'.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.CanadianInstitutionCode
member.summary: Canadian C40. Required when CanadianPlanFlag is 'A'.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.RxBIN
member.summary: BIN location number. Only used with EHR.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.CobRule
member.summary: Enum:EnumCobRule 0=Basic, 1=Standard, 2=CarveOut.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.SopCode
member.summary: FK to sop.SopCode. Examples: 121, 3115, etc. Acts as default for all patients using this insurance. When code is changed for an insplan, it should change automatically for patients having that primary insurance.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.SecUserNumEntry
member.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.SecDateEntry
member.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change. The actual date of entry.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.SecDateTEdit
member.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates. Not user editable with the UI.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.HideFromVerifyList
member.summary: Is false if this plan needs to be verified.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.NumberSubscribers
member.summary: This is not a database column. It is just used to display the number of plans with the same info.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.InsPlan.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this InsPlan.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EnumCobRule.Basic
member.summary: 0=Basic

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EnumCobRule.Standard
member.summary: 1=Standard

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.EnumCobRule.CarveOut
member.summary: 2=CarveOut

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Interval
member.summary: Currently used in recall interval. Uses all four values together to establish an interval between two dates, letting the user have total control. Will later be used for such things as lab cases, appointment scheduling, etc. Includes a way to combine all four values into one number to be stored in the database (as an int32). Each value has a max of 255, except years has a max of 127.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Interval.op_Equality(OpenDentBusiness.Interval,OpenDentBusiness.Interval)
member.summary: Define the == operator.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Interval.op_Inequality(OpenDentBusiness.Interval,OpenDentBusiness.Interval)
member.summary: Define the != operator.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Interval.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Required to override Equals since we defined == and !=

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Interval.GetHashCode
member.summary: Required to override since we defined == and !=

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Interval.op_Addition(System.DateTime,OpenDentBusiness.Interval)
member.summary: Specify a date and an interval to return a new date based on adding the interval to the original date.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Interval.ToString
member.summary: Example: 1y3m1w1d

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.JournalEntry
member.summary: Used in accounting to represent a single credit or debit entry. There will always be at least 2 journal enties attached to every transaction. All transactions balance to 0.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.JournalEntry.JournalEntryNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.JournalEntry.TransactionNum
member.summary: FK to transaction.TransactionNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.JournalEntry.AccountNum
member.summary: FK to account.AccountNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.JournalEntry.DateDisplayed
member.summary: Always the same for all journal entries within one transaction.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.JournalEntry.DebitAmt
member.summary: Negative numbers never allowed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.JournalEntry.CreditAmt
member.summary: Negative numbers never allowed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.JournalEntry.Splits
member.summary: A human-readable description of the splits. Used only for display purposes.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.JournalEntry.CheckNumber
member.summary: Any user-defined string. Usually a check number, but can also be D for deposit, Adj, etc.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.JournalEntry.ReconcileNum
member.summary: FK to reconcile.ReconcileNum. 0 if not attached to a reconcile. Not allowed to alter amounts if attached.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Language
member.summary: This is a list of phrases that need to be translated. The primary key is a combination of the ClassType and the English phrase. This table is currently filled dynmically at run time, but the plan is to fill it using a tool that parses the code.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Language.LanguageNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Language.EnglishComments
member.summary: No longer used.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Language.ClassType
member.summary: A string representing the class where the translation is used. Maximum length is 25 characters.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Language.English
member.summary: The English version of the phrase, case sensitive.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Language.IsObsolete
member.summary: As this gets more sophisticated, we will use this field to mark some phrases obsolete instead of just deleting them outright. That way, translators will still have access to them. For now, this is not used at all.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.LanguageForeign
member.summary: Will usually only contain translations for a single foreign language, although more are allowed. The primary key is a combination of the ClassType and the English phrase and the culture.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LanguageForeign.LanguageForeignNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LanguageForeign.ClassType
member.summary: A string representing the class where the translation is used.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LanguageForeign.English
member.summary: The English version of the phrase. Case sensitive.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LanguageForeign.Culture
member.summary: The specific culture name. Almost always in 5 digit format like this: en-US.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LanguageForeign.Translation
member.summary: The foreign translation. Remember we use Unicode-8, so this translation can be in any language, including Russian, Hebrew, and Chinese.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LanguageForeign.Comments
member.summary: Comments for other translators for the foreign language.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Letter
member.summary: These are templates that are used to send simple letters to patients.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Letter.LetterNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Letter.Description
member.summary: Description of the Letter.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Letter.BodyText
member.summary: Text of the letter

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.LetterMerge
member.summary: Describes the templates for letter merges to Word.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LetterMerge.LetterMergeNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LetterMerge.Description
member.summary: Description of this letter.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LetterMerge.TemplateName
member.summary: The filename of the Word template. eg MyTemplate.doc.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LetterMerge.DataFileName
member.summary: The name of the data file. eg MyTemplate.txt.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LetterMerge.Category
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LetterMerge.Fields
member.summary: Not a database column. Filled using fk from the lettermergefields table. A collection of strings representing field names.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.LetterMergeField
member.summary: When doing a lettermerge, a data file is created with certain fields. This is a list of those fields for each lettermerge.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LetterMergeField.FieldNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LetterMergeField.LetterMergeNum
member.summary: FK to lettermerge.LetterMergeNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LetterMergeField.FieldName
member.summary: One of the preset available field names.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Medication
member.summary: A list of medications, not attached to any particular patient. Not allowed to delete if in use by a patient. Not allowed to edit name once created due to possibility of damage to patient record.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Medication.MedicationNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Medication.MedName
member.summary: Name of the medication. User can change this. If an RxCui is present, the RxNorm string can be pulled from the in-memory table for UI display in addition to the MedName.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Medication.GenericNum
member.summary: FK to medication.MedicationNum. Cannot be zero. If this is a generic drug, then the GenericNum will be the same as the MedicationNum. Otherwise, if this is a brand drug, then the GenericNum will be a non-zero value corresponding to another medicaiton.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Medication.Notes
member.summary: Notes.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Medication.DateTStamp
member.summary: The last date and time this row was altered. Not user editable.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Medication.RxCui
member.summary: RxNorm Code identifier. We should have used a string type. Used by EHR in CQM. But the queries should use medicationpat.RxCui, NOT this RxCui, because all medicationpats (meds and orders) coming back from NewCrop will not have a FK to this medication table. When this RxCui is modified by the user, then medicationpat.RxCui is automatically updated where medicationpat.MedicationNum matches this medication.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Medication.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this Medication.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.MedicationPat
member.summary: Links medications to patients. For ehr, some of these can be considered 'medication orders', but only if they contain a PatNote (instructions), a ProvNum, and a DateStart.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedicationPat.MedicationPatNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedicationPat.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedicationPat.MedicationNum
member.summary: FK to medication.MedicationNum. If 0, implies that the medication order came from NewCrop or was a Manual Rx order. This was done to allow MU2 measures to be set by either creating a medication from the medical window, or by creating an manual prescription.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedicationPat.PatNote
member.summary: Medication notes specific to this patient.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedicationPat.DateTStamp
member.summary: The last date and time this row was altered. Not user editable.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedicationPat.DateStart
member.summary: Date that the medication was started. Can be minval if unknown.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedicationPat.DateStop
member.summary: Date that the medication was stopped. Can be minval if unknown. If minval, then the medication is not "discontinued". If prior to today, then the medication is "discontinued". If today or a future date, then not discontinued yet.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedicationPat.ProvNum
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Can be 0. Gets set to the patient's primary provider when adding a new med. If adding the med from EHR, gets set to the ProvNum of the logged-in user.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedicationPat.MedDescript
member.summary: Only use when MedicationNum=0. For medication orders pulled back from NewCrop during synch.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedicationPat.RxCui
member.summary: For NewCrop medical orders, corresponds to the RxCui of the prescription (NewCrop only returns a value sometimes). Otherwise, this field is synched with the medication.RxCui field based on medication.MedicationNum. We should have used a string type. The only purpose of this field is so that when CCDs are created, we have structured data to put in the XML, not just plain text. Allergies exported in CCD do not look at this table, but only at the medication table. Medications require MedicationPat.RxCui or Medication.RxCui to be exported on CCD.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedicationPat.NewCropGuid
member.summary: Only use when MedicationNum=0. For medication orders pulled back from NewCrop during synch. The NewCrop GUID which uniquely identifies the prescription corresponding to the medical order. Allows us to update existing NewCrop medical orders when refreshing prescriptions in the Chart (similar to how prescriptions are updated).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.MedicationPat.IsCpoe
member.summary: If NewCrop is used to prescribe a medication, a medication order is imported automatically into Open Dental. If a provider is logged in, then this is CPOE (Computerized Provider Order Entry), and this will be true. Or, if a provider is logged in and Rx entered through OD, it's also CPOE. If a staff person is logged in, and enters an Rx through NewCrop or OD, then this is non-CPOE, so false.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Operatory
member.summary: Each row is a single operatory or column in the appts module.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Operatory.OperatoryNum
member.summary: Primary key

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Operatory.OpName
member.summary: The full name to show in the column.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Operatory.Abbrev
member.summary: 5 char or less. Not used much.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Operatory.ItemOrder
member.summary: The order that this op column will show. Changing views only hides some ops; it does not change their order. Zero based.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Operatory.IsHidden
member.summary: Used instead of deleting to hide an op that is no longer used.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Operatory.ProvDentist
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. The dentist assigned to this op. If more than one dentist might be assigned to an op, then create a second op and use one for each dentist. If 0, then no dentist is assigned.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Operatory.ProvHygienist
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. The hygienist assigned to this op. If 0, then no hygienist is assigned.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Operatory.IsHygiene
member.summary: Set true if this is a hygiene operatory. The hygienist will then be considered the main provider for this op.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Operatory.ClinicNum
member.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. 0 if no clinic.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Operatory.SetProspective
member.summary: If true patients put into this operatory will have status set to prospective.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Operatory.IsWebSched
member.summary: Operatories with IsWebSched set to true will be the ONLY operatories considered when searching for available time slots.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Operatory.IsNewPatAppt
member.summary: Operatories with IsNewPatAppt set to true will be the ONLY operatories considered when searching for available time slots. This is in regards to the New Patient Appointment portion of the Web Sched web application.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Operatory.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this Operatory.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.PatField
member.summary: These are custom fields added and managed by the user.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatField.PatFieldNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatField.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatField.FieldName
member.summary: FK to patfielddef.FieldName. The full name is shown here for ease of use when running queries. But the user is only allowed to change fieldNames in the patFieldDef setup window.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatField.FieldValue
member.summary: Any text that the user types in. For picklists, this will contain the picked text. For dates, this is stored as the user typed it, after validating that it could be parsed. So queries that involve dates won't work very well. If we want better handling of date fields, we should add a column to this table. Checkbox will either have a value of 1, or else the row will be deleted from the db. Currency is handled in a culture neutral way, just like other currency in the db.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatField.SecUserNumEntry
member.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatField.SecDateEntry
member.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change. The actual date of entry.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatField.SecDateTEdit
member.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates. Not user editable with the UI.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.PatFieldDef
member.summary: These are the definitions for the custom patient fields added and managed by the user.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatFieldDef.PatFieldDefNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatFieldDef.FieldName
member.summary: The name of the field that the user will be allowed to fill in the patient info window.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatFieldDef.FieldType
member.summary: Enum:PatFieldType Text=0,PickList=1,Date=2,Checkbox=3,Currency=4

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatFieldDef.PickList
member.summary: The text that contains pick list values.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatFieldType.Date
member.summary: 2-Stored in db as entered, already localized. For example, it could be 2/04/11, 2/4/11, 2/4/2011, or any other variant. This makes it harder to create queries that filter by date, but easier to display dates as part of results.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatFieldType.Checkbox
member.summary: 3-If checked, value stored as "1". If unchecked, row deleted.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatFieldType.Currency
member.summary: 4-This seems to have been added without implementing. Not sure what will happen if someone tries to use it.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatFieldType.InCaseOfEmergency
member.summary: 5 - DEPRECATED. (Only used 16.3.1, deprecated by 16.3.4)

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.FName
