member.summary: Enum:PatientGender

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.Position
member.summary: Enum:PatientPosition Marital status would probably be a better name for this column.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.Birthdate
member.summary: Age is not stored in the database. Age is always calculated as needed from birthdate.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.SSN
member.summary: In the US, this is 9 digits, no dashes. For all other countries, any punctuation or format is allowed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.Address2
member.summary: Optional second address line.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.State
member.summary: 2 Char in USA. Used to store province for Canadian users.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.Zip
member.summary: Postal code. For Canadian claims, it must be ANANAN. No validation gets done except there.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.HmPhone
member.summary: Home phone. Includes any punctuation

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.Guarantor
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Head of household.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient._age
member.summary: Derived from Birthdate. Not in the database table.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.CreditType
member.summary: Single char. Shows at upper right corner of appointments. Suggested use is A,B,or C to designate creditworthiness, but it can actually be used for any purpose.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.Salutation
member.summary: Dear __. This field does not include the "Dear" or a trailing comma. If this field is blank, then the typical salutation is FName. Or, if a Preferred name is present, that is used instead of FName.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.EstBalance
member.summary: Current patient balance.(not family). Never subtracts insurance estimates.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.PriProv
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. The patient's primary provider. Required. The database maintenance tool ensures that every patient always has this number set, so the program no longer has to handle 0.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.SecProv
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Secondary provider (hygienist). Optional.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.FeeSched
member.summary: FK to feesched.FeeSchedNum. Fee schedule for this patient. Usually not used. If missing, the practice default fee schedule is used. If patient has insurance, then the fee schedule for the insplan is used.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.BillingType
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Must have a value, or the patient will not show on some reports.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.ImageFolder
member.summary: Name of folder where images will be stored. Not editable for now.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.AddrNote
member.summary: Address or phone note. Unlimited length in order to handle data from other programs during a conversion.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.FamFinUrgNote
member.summary: Family financial urgent note. Only stored with guarantor, and shared for family.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.MedUrgNote
member.summary: Individual patient note for Urgent medical.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.ApptModNote
member.summary: Individual patient note for Appointment module note.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.StudentStatus
member.summary: Single char. Nonstudent='N' or blank, Parttime='P', Fulltime='F'.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.SchoolName
member.summary: College name. If Canadian, then this is field C10 and must be filled if C9 (patient.CanadianEligibilityCode) is 1 and patient is 18 or older.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.ChartNumber
member.summary: Max 15 char. Used for reference to previous programs.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.MedicaidID
member.summary: Optional. The Medicaid ID for this patient.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.Bal_0_30
member.summary: Aged balance from 0 to 30 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family. Only stored with guarantor.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.Bal_31_60
member.summary: Aged balance from 31 to 60 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family. Only stored with guarantor.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.Bal_61_90
member.summary: Aged balance from 61 to 90 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family. Only stored with guarantor.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.BalOver90
member.summary: Aged balance over 90 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family. Only stored with guarantor.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.InsEst
member.summary: Insurance Estimate for entire family.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.BalTotal
member.summary: Total balance for entire family before insurance estimate. Not the same as the sum of the 4 aging balances because this can be negative. Only stored with guarantor.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.EmployerNum
member.summary: FK to employer.EmployerNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.EmploymentNote
member.summary: Not used since version 2.8.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.County
member.summary: FK to county.CountyName, although it will not crash if key absent.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.GradeLevel
member.summary: Enum:PatientGrade Gradelevel.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.Urgency
member.summary: Enum:TreatmentUrgency Used in public health screenings.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.DateFirstVisit
member.summary: The date that the patient first visited the office. Automated.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.ClinicNum
member.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Can be zero if not attached to a clinic or no clinics set up.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.HasIns
member.summary: For now, an 'I' indicates that the patient has insurance. This is only used when displaying appointments. It will later be expanded. User can't edit.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.TrophyFolder
member.summary: The Trophy bridge is inadequate, this attempts to make it usable for offices that have invested in Trophy hardware.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.PlannedIsDone
member.summary: This simply indicates whether the 'done' box is checked in the chart module. Used to be handled as a -1 in the NextAptNum field, but now that field is unsigned.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.Premed
member.summary: Set to true if patient needs to be premedicated for appointments, includes PAC, halcion, etc.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.Ward
member.summary: Only used in hospitals.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.PreferConfirmMethod
member.summary: Enum:ContactMethod. Used for eCR, which includes eReminders eConfirmations.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.PreferContactMethod
member.summary: Enum:ContactMethod

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.PreferRecallMethod
member.summary: Enum:ContactMethod

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.SchedDayOfWeek
member.summary: We do not use this, but some users do, so here it is. 0=none. Otherwise, 1-7 for day.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.Language
member.summary: The primary language of the patient. Typically eng (English), fra (French), spa (Spanish), or similar. If it's a custom language, then it might look like Tahitian.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.AdmitDate
member.summary: Used in hospitals. It can be before the first visit date. It typically gets set automatically by the hospital system.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.Title
member.summary: Includes any punctuation. For example, Mr., Mrs., Miss, Dr., etc. There is no selection mechanism yet for user; they must simply type it in.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.PayPlanDue
member.summary: Amount "due now" for all payment plans such that someone in this family is the payment plan guarantor. This is the total of all payment plan charges past due (taking into account the PayPlansBillInAdvanceDays setting) subtract the amount already paid for the payment plans. Only stored with family guarantor.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.SiteNum
member.summary: FK to site.SiteNum. Can be zero. Replaces the old GradeSchool field with a proper foreign key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.DateTStamp
member.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates. Not user editable.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.ResponsParty
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Can be zero. Person responsible for medical decisions rather than finances. Guarantor is still responsible for finances. This is useful for nursing home residents. Part of public health.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.CanadianEligibilityCode
member.summary: C09. Eligibility Exception Code. A number between 1-4. 0 is not acceptable for e-claims. 1=FT student, 2=disabled, 3=disabled student, 4=code not applicable. Warning. 4 is a 0 if using CDAnet version 02. This column should have been created as an int.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.AskToArriveEarly
member.summary: Number of minutes patient is asked to come early to appointments.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.PreferContactConfidential
member.summary: Enum:ContactMethod Used for EHR.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.SuperFamily
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. If this is the same as PatNum, then this is a SuperHead. If zero, then not part of a superfamily. Synched for entire family. If family is part of a superfamily, then the guarantor for this family will show in the superfamily list in the Family module for anyone else who is in the superfamily. Only a guarantor can be a superfamily head.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.TxtMsgOk
member.summary: Enum:YN

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.SmokingSnoMed
member.summary: EHR smoking status as a SNOMED code. Will always be the most recent smoking status for the patient.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.Country
member.summary: Country name. Only used by HQ to add country names to statements.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.DateTimeDeceased
member.summary: Needed for EHR syndromic surveillance messaging. Used in HL7 PID-29. Also for feature request #3040. Date and time because we need precision to the minute in syndromic surveillence messging.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.BillingCycleDay
member.summary: A number between 1 and 31 that is the day of month that repeat charges should be applied to this account. Previously this was determined by the start date of the repeate charges.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.SecUserNumEntry
member.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.SecDateEntry
member.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change. The actual date of entry.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.HasSuperBilling
member.summary: 0 by default. If true, this guarantor should be included in superbilling statements.

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.SchedBeforeTimeXml
member.summary: Used only for serialization purposes

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.SchedAfterTimeXml
member.summary: Used only for serialization purposes

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this Patient.

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.Age
member.summary: Calculated from birthdate.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.GetNameLF
member.summary: LName, 'Preferred' FName M

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.GetNameLFnoPref
member.summary: LName, FName M

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.GetNameFL
member.summary: FName 'Preferred' M LName

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.GetNameFLnoPref
member.summary: FName M LName

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.GetNameFirstOrPrefL
member.summary: FName/Preferred LName

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.GetNameFirstOrPrefML
member.summary: FName/Preferred M. LName

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.GetNameFLFormal
member.summary: Title FName M LName

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.GetNameFirst
member.summary: Includes preferred.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.GetSalutation
member.summary: Dear __. Does not include the "Dear" or the comma.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Patient.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Useful for sorting and binary searching. The X12 834 implementation uses this for binary searching to improve efficiency. If this function is changed in the future, it will heavily impact our X12 834 implementation. Be cautious. In the end, this function will probably not need to change anyway, since it will only be used for comparing patients when the PatNums are not known.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.PatientNote
member.summary: Essentially more columns in the patient table. They are stored here because these fields can contain a lot of information, and we want to try to keep the size of the patient table a bit smaller.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatientNote.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Also the primary key for this table. Always one to one relationship with patient table. A new patient might not have an entry here until needed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatientNote.FamFinancial
member.summary: Only one note per family stored with guarantor.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatientNote.ApptPhone
member.summary: No longer used.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatientNote.Medical
member.summary: Medical Summary

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatientNote.Service
member.summary: Service notes

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatientNote.MedicalComp
member.summary: Complete current Medical History

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatientNote.Treatment
member.summary: Shows in the Chart module just below the graphical tooth chart.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatientNote.ICEName
member.summary: In Case of Emergency Name.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatientNote.ICEPhone
member.summary: In Case of Emergency Phone.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.PatPlan
member.summary: Each row represents the linking of one insplan to one patient for current coverage. Dropping a plan will delete the entry in this table. Deleting a plan will delete the actual insplan (if no dependencies).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatPlan.PatPlanNum
member.summary: Primary key

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatPlan.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The patient who currently has the insurance. Not the same as the subscriber.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatPlan.Ordinal
member.summary: Number like 1, 2, 3, etc. Represents primary ins, secondary ins, tertiary ins, etc. 0 is not used

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatPlan.IsPending
member.summary: For informational purposes only. For now, we lose the previous feature which let us set isPending without entering a plan. Now, you have to enter the plan in order to check this box.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatPlan.Relationship
member.summary: Enum:Relat Remember that this may need to be changed in the Claim also, if already created.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatPlan.PatID
member.summary: An optional patient ID which will override the insplan.SubscriberID on eclaims. For Canada, this holds the Dependent Code, C17 and E17, and in that use it doesn't override subscriber id, but instead supplements it.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PatPlan.InsSubNum
member.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum. Gives info about the subscriber.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Payment
member.summary: A patient payment. Always has at least one split.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.PayNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.PayType
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. This will be 0 if this is an income transfer to another provider.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.PayDate
member.summary: The date that the payment displays on the patient account.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.PayAmt
member.summary: Amount of the payment. Must equal the sum of the splits.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.CheckNum
member.summary: Check number is optional.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.BankBranch
member.summary: Bank-branch for checks.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.PayNote
member.summary: Any admin note. Not for patient to see. Length 4000.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.IsSplit
member.summary: Set to true to indicate that a payment is split. Just makes a few functions easier. Might be eliminated.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The patient where the payment entry will show. But only the splits affect account balances. This has a value even if the 'payment' is actually an income transfer to another provider.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.ClinicNum
member.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Can be 0. Copied from patient.ClinicNum when creating payment, but user can override. Not used in provider income transfers. Cannot be used in financial reporting when grouping by clinic, because payments may be split between clinics.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.DateEntry
member.summary: The date that this payment was entered. Not user editable.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.DepositNum
member.summary: FK to deposit.DepositNum. 0 if not attached to any deposits. Cash does not usually get attached to a deposit; only checks.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.Receipt
member.summary: Text of printed receipt if the payment was done electronically. Allows reprinting if needed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.IsRecurringCC
member.summary: True if this was an automatically added recurring CC charge rather then one entered by the user. This was set to true for all historical entries before version 11.1, but will be accurate after that.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.SecUserNumEntry
member.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.SecDateTEdit
member.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates. Not user editable with the UI.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.PaymentSource
member.summary: Enum:CreditCardSource Indicates the origin of the payment if the payment came from a credit card. Will be 'None' if this payment did not use a credit card.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Payment.ProcessStatus
member.summary: Enum:ProcessStat Flags whether a payment came from online and needs to be processed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ProcessStat.OfficeProcessed
member.summary: 0 - Payment made within the OD program.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ProcessStat.OnlineProcessed
member.summary: 1 - Payment made from the Patient Portal and has been processed within OD.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ProcessStat.OnlinePending
member.summary: 2 - Payment made from the Patient Portal and needs to be processed within OD.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.PayPeriod
member.summary: Used to view employee timecards. Timecard entries are not linked to a pay period. Instead, payperiods are setup, and the user can only view specific pay periods. So it feels like they are linked, but it's date based.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPeriod.PayPeriodNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPeriod.DateStart
member.summary: The first day of the payperiod

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPeriod.DateStop
member.summary: The last day of the payperiod. Inclusive, ignoring time of day.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPeriod.DatePaycheck
member.summary: The date that paychecks will be dated. A few days after the dateStop. Optional.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlan
member.summary: Each row represents one signed agreement to make payments.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlan.PayPlanNum
member.summary: Primary key

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlan.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The patient who had the treatment done.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlan.Guarantor
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The person responsible for the payments. Does not need to be in the same family as the patient. Not necessarily the same as the guarantor on the PayPlanCharge.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlan.PayPlanDate
member.summary: Date that the payment plan will display in the account.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlan.APR
member.summary: Annual percentage rate. eg 18. This does not take into consideration any late payments, but only the percentage used to calculate the amortization schedule.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlan.Note
member.summary: Generally used to archive the terms when the amortization schedule is created.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlan.PlanNum
member.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum. Will be 0 if standard payment plan. But if this is being used to track expected insurance payments, then this will be the foreign key to insplan.PlanNum, and Guarantor will be 0.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlan.CompletedAmt
member.summary: The amount of the treatment that has already been completed. This should match the sum of the principal amounts for most situations. But if the procedures have not yet been completed, and the payment plan is to make any sense, then this number must be changed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlan.InsSubNum
member.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum. Will be 0 if standard payment plan. But if this is being used to track expected insurance payments, then this will be the foreign key to inssub.InsSubNum, and Guarantor will be 0.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlan.PaySchedule
member.summary: Enum:PaymentSchedule How often payments are scheduled to be made.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlan.NumberOfPayments
member.summary: The number of payments that will be made to complete the payment plan.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlan.PayAmt
member.summary: Payment amount due per payment plan charge.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlan.DownPayment
member.summary: The amount paid toward the payment plan when it was first opened.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlan.IsClosed
member.summary: True if this payment plan is closed. Closed should not be edited.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlan.Signature
member.summary: The encrypted and bound signature in base64 format. The signature is bound to the concatenation of the Total Amount,APR,Number of Payments,Payment Amount

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlan.SigIsTopaz
member.summary: True if the signature is in Topaz format rather than OD format.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaymentSchedule.Monthly
member.summary: 0 - Pay 1 time every month.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaymentSchedule.MonthlyDayOfWeek
member.summary: 1 - Pay 1 time every month on a certain day of the week.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaymentSchedule.Weekly
member.summary: 2 - Pay every week per month.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaymentSchedule.BiWeekly
member.summary: 3 - Pay every other week per times per month.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaymentSchedule.Quarterly
member.summary: 4 - Pay 4 times per year.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlanCharge
member.summary: One of the dated charges attached to a payment plan. This has nothing to do with payments, but rather just causes the amount due to increase on the date of the charge. The amount of the charge is the sum of the principal and the interest.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlanCharge.PayPlanChargeNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlanCharge.PayPlanNum
member.summary: FK to payplan.PayPlanNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlanCharge.Guarantor
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The guarantor account that each charge will affect. Does not have to match the guarantor of the payment plan. This column doesn't even have to point to a guarantor at all. E.g. Credits and Closeout debits will be linked to the patient, not guarantor.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlanCharge.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The patient account that the principal gets removed from.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlanCharge.ChargeDate
member.summary: The date that the charge will show on the patient account. Any charge with a future date will not show on the account yet and will not affect the balance.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlanCharge.Principal
member.summary: For Debits, this is the principal charge amount. For Credits (version 2 only), then this is the credit amount.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlanCharge.Interest
member.summary: For Debits, this is the interest portion of this payment. Always 0 for Credits.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlanCharge.Note
member.summary: Any note about this particular payment plan charge

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlanCharge.ProvNum
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Since there is no ProvNum field at the payplan level, the provider must be the same for all payplancharges. It's initially assigned as the patient priProv. Payments applied should be to this provnum, although the current user interface does not help with this.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlanCharge.ClinicNum
member.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Since there is no ClincNum field at the payplan level, the clinic must be the same for all payplancharges. It's initially assigned using the patient clinic. Payments applied should be to this clinic, although the current user interface does not help with this.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlanCharge.ChargeType
member.summary: Enum: The charge type of the payment plan. 0 - Debit, 1 - Credit. Only relevant for those on Payment Plan Version 2.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlanCharge.ProcNum
member.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum. The procedure that this payplancharge is attached to. Only applies to credits. Always 0 for debits. Can be 0 for credits not attached to a procedure.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlanChargeType.Debit
member.summary: 0 - Debit

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PayPlanChargeType.Credit
member.summary: 1 - Credit

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit
member.summary: Always attached to a payment. Always affects exactly one patient account and one provider.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit.SplitNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit.SplitAmt
member.summary: Amount of split.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Can be the PatNum of the guarantor if this is a split for a payment plan and the guarantor is in another family.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit.ProcDate
member.summary: Procedure date. Typically only used if tied to a procedure. In older versions (before 7.0), this was the date that showed on the account. Frequently the same as the date of the payment, but not necessarily. Not when the payment was made.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit.PayNum
member.summary: FK to payment.PayNum. Every paysplit must be linked to a payment.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit.IsDiscount
member.summary: No longer used.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit.DiscountType
member.summary: No longer used

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit.ProvNum
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit.PayPlanNum
member.summary: FK to payplan.PayPlanNum. 0 if not attached to a payplan.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit.DatePay
member.summary: Date always in perfect synch with Payment date.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit.ProcNum
member.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum. 0 if not attached to a procedure.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit.DateEntry
member.summary: Date this paysplit was created. User not allowed to edit.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit.UnearnedType
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Usually 0 unless this is a special unearned split.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit.ClinicNum
member.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Can be 0. Need not match the ClinicNum of the Payment, because a payment can be split between clinics.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit.SecUserNumEntry
member.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit.SecDateTEdit
member.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates. Not user editable with the UI.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PaySplit.PrepaymentNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PerioMeasure.MBvalue

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.AgingBeginDateTime
member.summary: Stored as DateTime, but cleared when aging finishes. The DateTime will be used as a flag to signal other connections that aging calculations have started and prevents another connection from running simultaneously. In order to run aging, this will have to be cleared, either by the connection that set the flag when aging finishes, or by the user overriding the lock and manually clearing this pref.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.AgingIsEnterprise
member.summary: If true, aging will use the intermediate table famaging for calculating aging.

member.summary: For Ontario Dental Association fee schedules.

member.summary: This is the hash of the password that is needed to open the Central Manager tool.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.CentralManagerSyncCode
member.summary: Blank by default. Contains a key for the CEMT. Each CEMT database contains a unique sync code. Syncing from the CEMT will skip any databases without the correct sync code.

member.summary: Deprecated.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ChartAddProcNoRefreshGrid
member.summary: Deprecated. If set to true (1), then after adding a proc, a row will be added to datatable instead of rebuilding entire datatable by making queries to the database. This preference was never fully implemented and should not be used. We may revisit some day.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ChartNonPatientWarn
member.summary: Preference to warn users when they have a nonpatient selected.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ClaimMedProvTreatmentAsOrdering
member.summary: When true, the default ordering provider on medical eclaim procedures will be set to the procedure treating provider.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ClaimProcsNotBilledToInsAutoGroup
member.summary: For the Procedures Not Billed to Insurance report. If true, when creating new claims from the report window, will group procedures by clinic and site. If false, will block user from creating claims if the selected procedures for a specific patient have different clinis or different sites. Default value is true to encourage automation.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ClaimReportComputerName
member.summary: Blank by default. Computer name to receive reports from automatically.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ClaimReportReceiveInterval
member.summary: Report receive interval. 30 by default.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ClaimReportReceiveLastDateTime
member.summary: Stores last time the reports were ran.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ClaimsSendWindowValidatesOnLoad
member.summary: Boolean. 0 by default. If enabled, the Send Claims window will automatically validate e-claims upon loading the window. Validating all claims on load was old behavior that was significantly slowing down the loading of the send claims window. Several offices complained that we took away the validation until they attempt sending the claim.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ClaimSnapshotEnabled
member.summary: Boolean. 0 by default. If enabled, snapshots of claimprocs are created when claims are created.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ClaimSnapshotRunTime
member.summary: DateTime where the time is the only useful part. Stores the time of day that the eConnector should create a claimsnapshot.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ClaimSnapshotTriggerType
member.summary: Enumeration of type "ClaimSnapshotTrigger". ClaimCreate by default. This preference determines how ClaimSnapshots get created. Stored as the enumeration.ToString().

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ClearinghouseDefaultEligibility
member.summary: FK to clearinghouse.ClearingHouseNum. Allows a different clearinghouse to be used for checking eligibility. Defaults to the current dental (or medical) clearinghouse which preserves old behavior.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ClinicListIsAlphabetical
member.summary: Boolean. 0 by default. If enabled, lists clinics in alphabetical order.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ClinicTrackLast
member.summary: String, "Workstation"(default), "User", "None". See FormMisc. Determines how recently viewed clinics should be tracked.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ConfirmStatusEmailed
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Initially 0.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ConfirmStatusTextMessaged
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ConfirmTextMessage
member.summary: The message that goes out to patients when doing a batch confirmation.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ConnGroupCEMT
member.summary: Selected connection group within the CEMT.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.CorruptedDatabase
member.summary: Boolean. Typically set to true when an update is in progress and will be set to false when finished. Otherwise true means that the database is in a corrupt state.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.CQMDefaultEncounterCodeValue
member.summary: This is the default encounter code used for automatically generating encounters when specific actions are performed in Open Dental. The code is displayed/set in FormEhrSettings. We will set it and give the user a list of 9 suggested codes to use such that the encounters generated will cause the pateint to be considered part of the initial patient population in the 9 clinical quality measures tracked by OD. CQMDefaultEncounterCodeSystem will identify the code system this code is from and the code value will be a FK to that code system.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.CustListenerConnectionRequestTimeoutMS
member.summary: Used by OD HQ. Not added to db convert script. Allowable timeout for Negotiator to establish a connection with Listener. Different than SocketTimeoutMS and TransmissionTimeoutMS. Specifies the allowable timeout for Patient Portal Negotiator to establish a connection with Listener. Negotiator will only wait this long to get an acknowledgement that the Listener is available for a transmission before timing out. Initially 10000

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.CustListenerHeartbeatFrequencyMinutes
member.summary: Used by OD HQ. Not added to db convert script. Will be passed to OpenDentalEConnector when service initialized. Specifies the time (in minutes) between each time that the listener service will upload it's current heartbeat to HQ. Initially 360

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.CustListenerPort
member.summary: Used by OpenDentalEConnector. String specifies which port the OpenDentalWebService should look for on the customer's server in order to create a socket connection. Initially 25255

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.CustListenerSocketTimeoutMS
member.summary: Used by OD HQ. Not added to db convert script. Will be passed to OpenDentalEConnector when service initialized. Specifies the read/write socket timeout. Initially 3000

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.CustListenerTransmissionTimeoutMS
member.summary: Used by OD HQ. Not added to db convert script. Specifies the entire wait time alloted for a transmission initiated by the patient portal. Negotiator will only wait this long for a valid response back from Listener before timing out. Initially 30000

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.DistributorKey
member.summary: Boolean. Set to 1 to indicate that this database holds customers instead of patients. Used by OD HQ. Used for showing extra phone numbers, showing some extra buttons for tools that only we use, behavior of checkboxes in repeating charge window, etc. But phone panel visibility is based on DockPhonePanelShow.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.DocPath

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.DxIcdVersion

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.EasyHideAdvancedIns

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.EConnectorEnabled
member.summary: Boolean, false by default. Will be set to true when the update server successfully upgrades the CustListener service to the eConnector service. This only needs to happen once. This will automatically happen after upgrading past v15.4. If automatically upgrading the CustListener service to the eConnector service fails, they can click Install in eService Setup. NEVER programmatically set this preference back to false.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.ImeCompositionCompatibility

When enabled a fix is enabled within ODTextBox (RichTextBox) for foreign users that use a different language input methodology that requires the composition of symbols in order to display their language correctly. E.g. the Korean symbol '' (dur) will not display correctly inside ODTextBoxes without this set to true.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.InsBillingProv

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.InsPpoAlwaysUseUcrFee

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.InsPPOsecWriteoffs

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.LanguageAndRegion
member.summary: Used to determine how many windows are displayed throughout the program, translation, charting, and other features. Version 15.4.1

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.LanguagesIndicateNone
member.summary: Initially set to Declined to Specify. Indicates which language from the LanguagesUsedByPatients preference is the language that indicates the patient declined to specify. Text must exactly match a language in the list of available languages. Can be blank if the user deletes the language from the list of available languages.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.LanguagesUsedByPatients
member.summary: Comma-delimited list of two-letter language names and custom language names. The custom language names are the full string name and are not necessarily supported by Microsoft.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.LocalTimeOverridesServerTime
member.summary: Boolean. Only used to override server time in the following places: Time Cards.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.MeaningfulUseTwo
member.summary: 0=Meaningful Use Stage 1, 1=Meaningful Use Stage 2. Global, affects all providers. Changes the MU grid that is seen for individual patients and for summary reports.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.MedDefaultStopDays
member.summary: Number of days after medication order start date until stop date. Used when automatically inserting a medication order when creating a new Rx. Default value is 7 days. If set to 0 days, the automatic stop date will not be entered.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.MedicalFeeUsedForNewProcs
member.summary: New procs will use the fee amount tied to the medical code instead of the ADA code.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.MedicationsIndicateNone
member.summary: FK to medication.MedicationNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.MedLabReconcileDone
member.summary: If MedLabReconcileDone=="0", a one time reconciliation of the MedLab HL7 messages is needed. The reconcile will reprocess the original HL7 messages for any MedLabs with PatNum=0 in order to create the embedded PDF files from the base64 text in the ZEF segments. The old method of waiting to extract these files until the message is manually attached to a patient was very slow using the middle tier. The new method is to create the PDF files and save them in the image folder in a subdirectory called "MedLabEmbeddedFiles" if a pat is not located from the details in the PID segment of the message. Attaching the MedLabs to a patient is now just a matter of moving the files to the patient's image folder. All files will now be extracted and stored, either in a pat's folder or in the "MedLabEmbeddedFiles" folder, by the HL7 service.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.MobileSynchNewTables79Done
member.summary: Used one time after the conversion to 7.9 for initial synch of the provider table.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.MobileSynchNewTables112Done
member.summary: Used one time after the conversion to 11.2 for re-synch of the patient records because a)2 columns BalTotal and InsEst have been added to the patientm table. b) the table documentm has been added

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.MobileSynchNewTables121Done
member.summary: Used one time after the conversion to 12.1 for the recallm table being added and for upload of the practice Title.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.MySqlVersion

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.NetProdDetailUseSnapshotToday

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.NewCropAccountId
member.summary: There is no UI for user to change this. Format, if OD customer, is PatNum-(RandomString)(CheckSum). Example: 1234-W6c43. Format for resellers is up to them.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.NewCropDateLastAccessCheck
member.summary: The date this customer last checked with HQ to determine which provider have access to eRx.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.NewCropIsLegacy
member.summary: True for customers who were using NewCrop before version 15.4. True if NewCropAccountId was not blank when upgraded.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.NewCropIsLexiData
member.summary: Controls which NewCrop database to use. If false, then the customer uses the First Data Bank (FDB) database, otherwise the customer uses the LexiData database. Connecting to LexiData saves NewCrop some money on the new accounts. Additionally, the RxNorms which come back from the prescription refresh in the Chart are more complete for the LexiData database than for the FDB database.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.PrefName.PregnancyDefaultCodeValue
member.summary: This is the default pregnancy code used for diagnosing pregnancy from FormVitalSignEdit2014 and is displayed/set in FormEhrSettings. When the check box for BMI and BP not taken due to pregnancy Dx is selected, this code value will be inserted into the diseasedef table in the column identified by the PregnancyDefaultCodeSystem (i.e. diseasedef.SnomedCode, diseasedef.ICD9Code). It will then be a FK in the diseasedef table to the associated code system table.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure
member.summary: Database table is procedurelog. A procedure for a patient. Can be treatment planned or completed. Once it's completed, it gets tracked more closely be the security portion of the program. A procedure can NEVER be deleted. Status can just be changed to "deleted".

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.Surf
member.summary: Surfaces, or use "UL" etc for quadrant, "2" etc for sextant, "U","L" for arches. Sextants in the United States are: 1 (Upper Right), 2 (Upper Anterior), 3 (Upper Left), 4 (Lower Left), 5 (Lower Anterior), 6 (Lower Right). In Canada, Sextants are 03 through 08 (add 2 to the US sextant and prepend a zero).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.ToothNum
member.summary: May be blank, otherwise 1-32, 51-82, A-T, or AS-TS, 1 or 2 char. For Canadian users, using FDI nomenclature, we use 51 as a placeholder for supernumerary teeth, which is tooth number 99 according to CDHA standards (2/17/2014). Logic for this is handled in the tooth logic class.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.ToothRange
member.summary: May be blank, otherwise is series of toothnumbers separated by commas.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.Priority
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum, which contains the text of the priority.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.ProcStatus
member.summary: Enum:ProcStat TP=1,Complete=2,Existing Cur Prov=3,Existing Other Prov=4,Referred=5,Deleted=6,Condition=7.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.ProvNum
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.Dx
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum, which contains text of the Diagnosis.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.PlannedAptNum
member.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum. Was called NextAptNum in older versions. Allows this procedure to be attached to a Planned appointment as well as a standard appointment.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.PlaceService
member.summary: Enum:PlaceOfService Only used in Public Health. Zero(Office) until procedure set complete. Then it's set to the value of the DefaultProcedurePlaceService preference.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.Prosthesis
member.summary: Single char. Blank=no, I=Initial, R=Replacement.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.DateOriginalProsth
member.summary: For a prosthesis Replacement, this is the original date.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.ClaimNote
member.summary: This note goes out on e-claims. Not visible in Canada.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.DateEntryC
member.summary: This is the date this procedure was entered or set complete. If not status C, then the value is ignored. This date is set automatically when Insert, but older data or converted data might not have this value set. It gets updated when set complete. User never allowed to edit. This will be enhanced later.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.ClinicNum
member.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. 0 if no clinic.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.MedicalCode
member.summary: FK to procedurecode.ProcCode. Optional.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.DiagnosticCode
member.summary: Simple text for ICD-9 code. Gets sent with medical claims.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.IsPrincDiag
member.summary: Set true if this medical diagnostic code is the principal diagnosis for the visit. If no principal diagnosis is marked for any procedures on a medical e-claim, then it won't be allowed to be sent. If more than one is marked, then it will just use one at random.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.ProcNumLab
member.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum. Only used in Canada. If not zero, then this proc is a lab fee and this indicates to which actual procedure the lab fee is attached. For ordinary use, they are treated like two separate procedures. It's only for insurance claims that we need to know which lab fee belongs to which procedure. Two lab fees may be attached to one procedure.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.BillingTypeOne
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Lets some users track charges for certain types of reports. For example, a Medicaid billing type could be assigned to a procedure, flagging it for inclusion in a report mandated by goverment. Would be more useful if it was automated to flow down based on insurance plan type, but that can be added later. Not visible if prefs.EasyHideMedicaid is true.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.BillingTypeTwo
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Same as BillingTypeOne, but used when there is a secondary billing type to account for.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.CodeNum
member.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.CodeMod1
member.summary: Modifier for certain CPT codes.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.CodeMod2
member.summary: Modifier for certain CPT codes.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.CodeMod3
member.summary: Modifier for certain CPT codes.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.CodeMod4
member.summary: Modifier for certain CPT codes.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.RevCode
member.summary: NUBC Revenue Code for medical/inst billing. Used on UB04 and 837I.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.UnitQty
member.summary: Default is 1. Becomes Service Unit Count on institutional UB claimforms SV205. Becomes Service Unit Count on medical 1500 claimforms SV104. Becomes procedure count on dental claims SV306. Gets multiplied by fee in all accounting calculations.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.BaseUnits
member.summary: Base units used for some billing codes. Default is 0. No UI for this field. It is only edited in the ProcedureCode window. The database maint tool changes BaseUnits of all procedures to match that of the procCode. Not sure yet what it's for.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.StartTime

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.StopTime

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.HideGraphics
member.summary: Set to true to hide the chart graphics for this procedure. For example, a crown was done, but then tooth extracted.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.CanadianTypeCodes
member.summary: F16, up to 5 char. One or more of the following: A=Repair of a prior service, B=Temporary placement, C=TMJ, E=Implant, L=Appliance lost, S=Appliance stolen, X=none of the above. Blank is equivalent to X for claim output, but one value will not be automatically converted to the other in this table. That will allow us to track user entry for procedurecode.IsProsth.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.ProcTime

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.ProcTimeEnd
member.summary: Marks the time a procedure was finished.

member.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.Prognosis

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.DrugUnit
member.summary: Enum:EnumProcDrugUnit For 837I and UB04

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.DrugQty
member.summary: Includes fractions. For 837I

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.UnitQtyType
member.summary: Enum:ProcUnitQtyType For dental, the type is always sent electronically as MultiProcs. For institutional SV204, Days will be sent electronically if chosen, otherwise ServiceUnits will be sent. For medical SV103, MinutesAnesth will be sent electronically if chosen, otherwise ServiceUnits will be sent.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.StatementNum
member.summary: FK to statement.StatementNum. Only used when the statement in an invoice.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.IsLocked
member.summary: If this flag is set, then the proc is locked down tight. No changes at all can be made except to append, sign, or invalidate. Invalidate really just sets the proc to status 'deleted'. An invalidated proc retains its IsLocked status. All locked procs will be status of C or D. Locked group notes will be status of EC or D.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.BillingNote
member.summary: A note that will show directly in the Account module. Also used for repeating charges. Helps distinguish between charges for the same proccode in the same month.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.RepeatChargeNum
member.summary: FK to repeatcharge.RepeatChargeNum. Used in repeating charges to determine which procedures belong to each repeating charge. If the repeat charge that this RepeatChargeNum points to is deleted, this column will not be set to 0 so that a record will still exist that this procedure came from a repeat charge.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.DiagnosticCode2
member.summary: Simple text for ICD-9 code. Gets sent with medical claims.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.DiagnosticCode3
member.summary: Simple text for ICD-9 code. Gets sent with medical claims.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.DiagnosticCode4
member.summary: Simple text for ICD-9 code. Gets sent with medical claims.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.Discount
member.summary: Stores the dollar amount of the discount, not full price. E.g. for a 10% discount, Fee = $160 Discount = $16. This column is used by treatment planned procedures to create an adjustment when set complete. It should not be used as an accurate monetary discount value for completed procedures.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.SnomedBodySite
member.summary: Some procedures require a SNOMED code which indicates that site on the body at which this procedure was performed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.ProvOrderOverride
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Ordering provider override. Goes hand-in-hand with OrderingReferralNum. Medical eclaims only. Defaults to zero.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.IsDateProsthEst
member.summary: For prosthesis replacement procedures on 5010 eclaims only. If true, indicates that the DateOriginalProsth is an estimated date. Estimated dates are often used when the original prosthesis was performed by another doctor.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.IcdVersion
member.summary: The ICD code version for all diagnosis codes on this procedure, including DiagnosisCode, DiagnosisCode2, DiagnosisCode3, and DiagnosisCode4. Value of 9 for ICD-9, 10 for ICD-10, etc. Default value is 0. This value is copied from the DxIcdVersion preference when a procedure is created. The user can also manually change the IcdVersion on individual procedures.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.IsCpoe
member.summary: Procedures will be flagged as CPOE (Computerized Provider Order Entry) if this procedure was created by a provider. If a provider views, edits, or has any interaction with this procedure after its creation, it will be flagged as IsCPOE. Also, there will be a helpful window where providers can go to to "approve" non-CPOE procedures and mark them as CPOE to help meet EHR measures. If a staff person is logged in and enters this procedure then this is non-CPOE, so false.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.SecUserNumEntry
member.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.SecDateEntry
member.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change. The actual date of entry.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.DateComplete
member.summary: The date the procedure was originally set complete. If status is set complete and then set to something other than complete, this field will be set to DateTime.MinValue if DateComplete is today. If DateComplete is set to a day in the past and the status is changed from complete to something else, the field will not be cleared or updated. Db only field used by one customer and this is how they requested it. PatNum #19191

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.OrderingReferralNum
member.summary: FK to referral.ReferralNum. Goes hand-in-hand with ProvOrderOverride. Medical eclaims only. Defaults to zero. If set, and the ProvOrderOverride is not set, then this referral will go out at the ordering provider on medical e-claims.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.Note
member.summary: Not a database column. Saved in database in the procnote table. This note is only the most recent note from that table. If user changes it, then the business layer handles it by adding another procnote to that table.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.UserNum
member.summary: Not a database column. Just used for now to set the user so that it can be saved with the ProcNote.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Procedure.Signature
member.summary: Not a database column. If viewing an individual procedure, then this will contain the encrypted signature. If viewing a procedure list, this will typically just contain an "X" if a signature is present. If user signs note, the signature will be encrypted before placing into this field. Then it will be passed down and saved directly as is.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ProcNote.Note
member.summary: The actual note.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ProcNote.SigIsTopaz
member.summary: There are two kinds of signatures. Topaz signatures use hardware manufactured by that company, and the signature is created by their library. OD signatures work exactly the same way, but are only for on-screen signing.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ProcNote.Signature
member.summary: The encrypted signature. A signature starts as a collection of vectors. The Topaz .sig file format is proprietary. The OD signature format looks like this: 45,68;48,70;49,72;0,0;55,88;etc. It's simply a sequence of points, separated by semicolons. 0,0 represents pen up. Then, a hash is created from the Note, concatenated directly with the userNum. For example, "This is a note3" gets turned into a hash of 2849283940385391 (16 bytes). The hash is used to encrypt the signature data string using symmetric encryption. Therefore, the actual signature cannot be retrieved from the database by ordinary means. Also, the signature info cannot even be retrieved by Open Dental at all unless it supplies the same hash as before, proving that the data has not changed since signed. If OD supplies the correct hash, then it will be able to extract the sequence of vectors which it will then use to display the signature. The OD sigs are not compressed, and the Topaz sigs are. But there is very little difference in their sizes. It would be very rare for a signature to be larger than 1000 bytes.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Recall
member.summary:
A patient can only have one recall object per type. The recall table stores a few dates that must be kept synchronized with other information in the database. This is difficult. Anytime one of the following items changes, things need to be synchronized: procedurecode.SetRecall, any procedurelog change for a patient (procs added, deleted, completed, status changed, date changed, etc), patient status changed. There are expected to be a few bugs in the synchronization logic, so anytime a patient's recall is opened, it will also update.
During synchronization, the program will frequently alter DateDueCalc, DateDue, and DatePrevious based on trigger procs. The system will also add and delete recalls as necessary. But it will not delete a recall unless all values are default and there is no useful information. When a user tries to delete a recall, they will only be successful if the trigger conditions do not apply. Otherwise, they will have to disable the recall instead.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Recall.RecallNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Recall.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Recall.DateDueCalc
member.summary: Not editable. The calculated date due. Generated by the program and subject to change anytime the conditions change. It can be blank (0001-01-01) if no appropriate triggers.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Recall.DateDue
member.summary: This is the date that is actually used when doing reports for recall. It will usually be the same as DateDueCalc unless user has changed it. System will only update this field if it is the same as DateDueCalc. Otherwise, it will be left alone. Gets cleared along with DateDueCalc when resetting recall. When setting disabled, this field will also be cleared. This is the field to use if converting from another software.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Recall.DatePrevious
member.summary: Not editable. Previous date that procedures were done to trigger this recall. It is calculated and enforced automatically. If you want to affect this date, add a procedure to the chart with a status of C, EC, or EO.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Recall.RecallInterval
member.summary: The interval between recalls. The Interval struct combines years, months, weeks, and days into a single integer value.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Recall.RecallStatus
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum, or 0 for none.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Recall.Note
member.summary: An administrative note for staff use.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Recall.IsDisabled
member.summary: If true, this recall type will be disabled (there's only one type right now). This is usually used rather than deleting the recall type from the patient because the program must enforce the trigger conditions for all patients.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Recall.DateTStamp
member.summary: Last datetime that this row was inserted or updated.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Recall.RecallTypeNum
member.summary: FK to recalltype.RecallTypeNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Recall.DisableUntilBalance
member.summary: Default is 0. If a positive number is entered, then the family balance must be less in order for this recall to show in the recall list.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Recall.DisableUntilDate
member.summary: If a date is entered, then this recall will be disabled until that date.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Recall.DateScheduled
member.summary: This will only have a value if a recall is scheduled.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.Recall.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this Recall.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.RegistrationKey
member.summary: Keeps track of which product keys have been assigned to which customers. This datatype is only used if the program is being run from a distributor installation. A single customer is allowed to have more than one key, to accommodate for various circumstances, including having multiple physical business locations.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RegistrationKey.RegistrationKeyNum
member.summary: Primary Key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RegistrationKey.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The customer to which this registration key applies.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RegistrationKey.RegKey
member.summary: The registration key as stored in the customer database.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RegistrationKey.Note
member.summary: Db note about the registration key. Specifically, the note must include information about the location to which this key pertains, since once at least one key must be assigned to each location to be legal.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RegistrationKey.DateStarted
member.summary: This will help later with tracking for licensing.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RegistrationKey.DateDisabled
member.summary: This is used to completely disable a key. Might possibly even cripple the user's program. Usually only used if reassigning another key due to abuse or error. If no date specified, then this key is still valid.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RegistrationKey.DateEnded
member.summary: This is used when the customer cancels monthly support. This still allows the customer to get downloads for bug fixes, but only up through a certain version. Our web server program will use this date to deduce which version they are allowed to have. Any version that was released as a beta before this date is allowed to be downloaded.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RegistrationKey.IsForeign
member.summary: This is assigned automatically based on whether the registration key is a US version vs. a foreign version. The foreign version is not able to unlock the procedure codes. There are muliple layers of safeguards in place.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RegistrationKey.UsesServerVersion
member.summary: Deprecated.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RegistrationKey.IsFreeVersion
member.summary: We have given this customer a free version. Typically in India.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RegistrationKey.IsOnlyForTesting
member.summary: This customer is not using the software with live patient data, but only for testing and development purposes.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RegistrationKey.VotesAllotted
member.summary: Typically 100, although it can be more for multilocation offices.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RegistrationKey.IsResellerCustomer
member.summary: This is a customer of a reseller, so this customer will not have full access to all our services.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.RepeatCharge
member.summary: Each row represents one charge that will be added monthly.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RepeatCharge.RepeatChargeNum
member.summary: Primary key

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RepeatCharge.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RepeatCharge.ProcCode
member.summary: FK to procedurecode.ProcCode. The code that will be added to the account as a completed procedure.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RepeatCharge.ChargeAmt
member.summary: The amount that will be charged. The amount from the procedurecode will not be used. This way, a repeating charge cannot be accidentally altered.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RepeatCharge.DateStart
member.summary: The date of the first charge if UseBillingCycleDays is not enabled. Charges will always be added on the same day of the month as the start date. If UseBillingCycleDays is enabled, repeat charges will be applied on billing cycle day instead. If more than one month goes by without applying repeating charges, then multiple procedures will be added.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RepeatCharge.DateStop
member.summary: The last date on which a charge is allowed. So if you want 12 charges, and the start date is 8/1/05, then the stop date should be 7/1/05, not 8/1/05. Can be blank (0001-01-01) to represent a perpetual repeating charge.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RepeatCharge.Note
member.summary: Any note for internal use.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RepeatCharge.CopyNoteToProc
member.summary: Indicates that the note should be copied to the corresponding procedure billing note.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RepeatCharge.CreatesClaim
member.summary: Set to true to have a claim automatically created for the patient with the procedure that is attached to this repeating charge.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RepeatCharge.IsEnabled
member.summary: Set to false to disable the repeating charge. This allows patients to have repeating charges in their history that are not active. Used mainly for repeating charges with notes that should not be deleted.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RepeatCharge.UsePrepay
member.summary: Set to true to use prepayments for repeating charges.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.RxAlert
member.summary: Many-to-many relationship connecting Rx with DiseaseDef, AllergyDef, or Medication. Only one of those links may be specified in a single row; the other two will be 0.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RxAlert.AllergyDefNum
member.summary: FK to allergydef.AllergyDefNum. Only if DrugAllergy interaction. Compared against allergy.AllergyDefNum using PatNum. Drug-Allergy checking is also perfomed in NewCrop.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RxAlert.MedicationNum
member.summary: FK to medication.MedicationNum. Only if DrugDrug interaction. This will be compared against medicationpat.MedicationNum using PatNum. Drug-Drug checking is also performed in NewCrop.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RxAlert.NotificationMsg

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.RxAlert.IsHighSignificance
member.summary: False by default. Set to true to flag the drug-drug or drug-allergy intervention as high significance.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Schedule
member.summary: One block of time. Either for practice, provider, employee, or blockout.

member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Schedule.SchedDate
member.summary: Date for this timeblock.

member.summary: Start time for this timeblock.

member.summary: Stop time for this timeblock.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Schedule.SchedType
member.summary: Enum:ScheduleType 0=Practice,1=Provider,2=Blockout,3=Employee. Practice is used as a way to indicate holidays and as a way to put a note in for the entire practice for one day. But whenever type is Practice, times will be ignored.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Schedule.ProvNum

member.summary: This contains various types of text entered by the user.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Schedule.Status
member.summary: Enum:SchedStatus enumeration 0=Open,1=Closed,2=Holiday. All blocks have a status of Open, but user doesn't see the status. The "closed" status was previously used to override the defaults when the last timeblock was deleted. But it's nearly phased out now. Still used by blockouts. Holidays are a special type of practice schedule item which do not have providers attached. Used to differentiate between Practice SchedType Holidays and Notes.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Schedule.EmployeeNum
member.summary: FK to employee.EmployeeNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Schedule.DateTStamp

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Schedule.ClinicNum
member.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum if SchedType.Practice (holidays and practice notes) and applies to one clinic (operatories for one clinic). If SchedType.Practice and this applies to all clinics, or if any other SchedType, ClinicNum will be 0. There won't be any scheduleop rows linking this schedule to operatories when the type is SchedType.Practice. Instead, the linkage is implied based on the operatory.ClinicNum and applies to all operatories for the clinic.

This table can be used with only the screengroup table, but is more efficient if provider, school, and county tables are also available.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.SecurityLog
member.summary: Stores an ongoing record of database activity for security purposes. User not allowed to edit.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SecurityLog.SecurityLogNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SecurityLog.PermType
member.summary: Enum:Permissions

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SecurityLog.UserNum
member.summary: FK to userod.UserNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SecurityLog.LogDateTime
member.summary: The date and time of the entry. It's value is set when inserting and can never change. Even if a user changes the date on their ocmputer, this remains accurate because it uses server time.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SecurityLog.LogText
member.summary: The description of exactly what was done. Varies by permission type.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SecurityLog.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Can be 0 if not applicable.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SecurityLog.FKey
member.summary: A foreign key to a table associated with the PermType. 0 indicates not in use. This is typically used for objects that have specific audit trails so that users can see all audit entries related to a particular object. Every permission using FKey should be included and implmented in the CrudAuditPerms enum so that securitylog FKeys are note orphaned. Additonaly, the tabletype will to have the [CrudTable(CrudAuditPerms=CrudAuditPerm._____] added with the new CrudAuditPerm you created. For the patient portal, it is used to indicate logs created on behalf of other patients. It's uses include: AptNum with PermType AppointmentCreate, AppointmentEdit, or AppointmentMove tracks all appointment logs for a particular appointment. CodeNum with PermType ProcFeeEdit currently only tracks fee changes. PatNum with PermType PatientPortal represents an entry that a patient made on behalf of another patient. The PatNum column will represent the patient who is taking the action. PlanNum with PermType InsPlanChangeCarrierName tracks carrier name changes.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SecurityLog.LogSource
member.summary: Enum:LogSources None, WebSched, InsPlanImport834, FHIR, PatientPortal.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SecurityLog.PatientName
member.summary: PatNum-NameLF

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SecurityLog.LogHash
member.summary: Existing LogHash from SecurityLogHash table

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SecurityLog.DefNum
member.summary: Used in Claims for custom history edits.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.LogSources
member.summary: Known entities that create security logs.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LogSources.None
member.summary: 0 - Open Dental and unknown entities.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LogSources.WebSched
member.summary: 1 - GWT Web Sched application Recall version.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LogSources.InsPlanImport834
member.summary: 2 - X12 834 Insurance Plan Import from the Manage Module.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LogSources.HL7
member.summary: 3 - HL7 is an automated process which the user may not be aware of.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LogSources.DBM
member.summary: 4 - Database maintenance. This process creates patients which are known to be missing, but the user may not be aware that the fix involves patient recreation.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LogSources.FHIR
member.summary: 5 - FHIR is an automated process which the user may not be aware of.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LogSources.PatientPortal
member.summary: 6 - Patient Portal application.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LogSources.WebSchedNewPatAppt
member.summary: 7 - GWT Web Sched application New Patient Appointment version

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LogSources.AutoConfirmations
member.summary: 8 - Automated eConfirmation and eReminders

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.LogSources.Diagnostic
member.summary: 9 - Open Dental messages created for debugging and diagnostic purposes. For example, to diagnose an unhandled exception or unexpected behavior that is otherwise too hard to diagnose.

member.summary: Blank for the default buttons. Or contains the computer name for the buttons that override the defaults.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SigElementDef.SigElementDefNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SigElementDef.LightRow
member.summary: If this element should cause a button to light up, this would be the row. 0 means none.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.SigElementDef.LightColor
member.summary: If a light row is set, this is the color it will turn when triggered. Ack sets it back to white. Note that color and row can be in two separate elements of the same signal.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Task
member.summary: A task is a single todo item.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.TaskNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.TaskListNum
member.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum. If 0, then it will show in the trunk of a section.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.DateTask
member.summary: Only used if this task is assigned to a dated category. Children are NOT dated. Only dated if they should show in the trunk for a date category. They can also have a parent if they are in the main list as well.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.KeyNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum or appointment.AptNum. Only used when ObjectType is not 0.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.Descript
member.summary: The description of this task. Might be very long.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.TaskStatus
member.summary: Enum:TaskStatusEnum New,Viewed,Done. We may want to put an index on this column someday.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.IsRepeating
member.summary: True if it is to show in the repeating section. There should be no date. All children and parents should also be set to IsRepeating=true.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.DateType
member.summary: Enum:TaskDateType None, Day, Week, Month. If IsRepeating, then setting to None effectively disables the repeating feature.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.FromNum
member.summary: FK to task.TaskNum If this is derived from a repeating task, then this will hold the TaskNum of that task. It helps automate the adding and deleting of tasks. It might be deleted automatically if not are marked complete.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.ObjectType
member.summary: Enum:TaskObjectType 0=none,1=Patient,2=Appointment. More will be added later. If a type is selected, then the KeyNum will contain the primary key of the corresponding Patient or Appointment. Does not really have anything to do with the ObjectType of the parent tasklist, although they tend to match.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.DateTimeEntry
member.summary: The date and time that this task was added. Used to sort the list by the order entered. For reminder tasks, this field is used to indicate the date and time the reminder will take effect.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.UserNum
member.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. The person who created the task.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.DateTimeFinished
member.summary: The date and time that this task was marked "done".

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.IsUnread
member.summary: Only used when tracking unread status by user instead of by task. This gets set to true to indicate it has not yet been read.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.ParentDesc
member.Summary: Not a database column. A string description of the parent of this task. It will only include the immediate parent. Only useful in the New and OpenTicket tabs.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.PatientName
member.Summary: Not a database column. Attached patient's name (NameLF) if there is an attached patient.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.PriorityDefNum
member.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. The priority for this task which is used when filling task lists. The placement of the task in the list is dependent on the item order of the definitions.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Task.ReminderGroupId
member.summary: Optional. Set to null or empty if not a reminder task. For repeating reminders, the ReminderGroupId will be the same for each task spawned from any task in the group.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.TaskDateType
member.summary: For use by the older Repeating Tasks feature.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.TaskObjectType
