member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.TaskList
member.summary: A tasklist is like a folder system, where it can have child tasklists as well as tasks.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TaskList.TaskListNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TaskList.Descript
member.summary: The description of this tasklist. Might be very long, but not usually.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TaskList.Parent
member.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum The parent task list to which this task list is assigned. If zero, then this task list is on the main trunk of one of the sections.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TaskList.DateTL
member.summary: Optional. Set to 0001-01-01 for no date. If a date is assigned, then this list will also be available from the date section.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TaskList.IsRepeating
member.summary: True if it is to show in the repeating section. There should be no date. All children should also be set to IsRepeating=true.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TaskList.DateType
member.summary: Enum:TaskDateType None, Day, Week, Month. If IsRepeating, then setting to None effectively disables the repeating feature.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TaskList.FromNum
member.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum If this is derived from a repeating list, then this will hold the TaskListNum of that list. It helps automate the adding and deleting of lists. It might be deleted automatically if no tasks are marked complete.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TaskList.ObjectType
member.summary: Enum:TaskObjectType 0=none, 1=Patient, 2=Appointment. More will be added later. If a type is selected, then this list will be visible in the appropriate places for attaching the correct type of object. The type is not copied to a task when created. Tasks in this list do not have to be of the same type. You can only attach an object to a task, not a tasklist.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TaskList.DateTimeEntry
member.summary: The date and time that this list was added. Used to sort the list by the order entered.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TaskList.ParentDesc
member.Summary: Not a database column. A string description of the parents of this list. Might look like this: MegaParent/Parent/ This string may then be tacked on before the Descript to indicate the heirarchy. It will extend a max of 3 levels. Only useful in the User tab.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TaskList.NewTaskCount
member.summary: Not a database column. The number of new tasks found within a tasklist. Used in the user tab to turn the tasklist orange, indicating that tasks are present.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.TerminalActive
member.summary: Each row is one computer that currently acting as a terminal for new patient info input.

member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TerminalActive.ComputerName
member.summary: The name of the computer where the terminal is active.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TerminalActive.TerminalStatus
member.summary: Enum:TerminalStatusEnum No longer used. Instead, the PatNum field is used. Used to indicates at what point the patient was in the sequence. 0=standby, 1=PatientInfo, 2=Medical, 3=UpdateOnly. If status is 1, then nobody else on the network could open the patient edit window for that patient.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TerminalActive.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The patient currently showing in the terminal. If 0, then terminal is in standby mode.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothInitial.Movement
member.summary: Shift in mm, or rotation / tipping in degrees.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.ToothInitial.DrawingSegment
member.summary: Point data for a drawing segment. The format would look similar to this: 45,68;48,70;49,72;0,0;55,88;etc. It's simply a sequence of points, separated by semicolons. Only positive numbers are used. 0,0 is the upper left of the tooth chart at original size. Stored in pixels as originally drawn. If we ever change the tooth chart, we will have to also keep an old version as an alternate to display old drawings.

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.ToothInitial.ColorDrawXml
member.summary: Used only for serialization purposes

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Transaction

member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Transaction.DateTimeEntry

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Transaction.DepositNum

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Transaction.PayNum
member.summary: FK to payment.PayNum. Like DepositNum, it will eventually be replaced by a source document table, and payments will just be one of many types.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlan
member.summary: Stores all treatment plans, including Active, Inactive, and Saved treatment plans. Active and Inactive treatment plans use treatplanattaches to reference attached procedures. As procedures are set complete, they get removed from active and inactive treatment plans. Saved treatment plans use proctps, which are copies of the procedure, and will not change after being saved.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlan.TreatPlanNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlan.PatNum
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlan.DateTP
member.summary: The date of the treatment plan

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlan.Heading
member.summary: The heading that shows at the top of the treatment plan. Usually 'Proposed Treatment Plan'

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlan.Note
member.summary: A note specific to this treatment plan that shows at the bottom.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlan.Signature
member.summary: The encrypted and bound signature in base64 format. The signature is bound to the concatenation of the tp Note, DateTP, and to each proctp Descript and PatAmt.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlan.SigIsTopaz
member.summary: True if the signature is in Topaz format rather than OD format.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlan.ResponsParty
member.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Can be 0. The patient responsible for approving the treatment. Public health field not visible to everyone else.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlan.DocNum
member.summary: FK to document.DocNum. Can be 0. If signed, this is the pdf document of the TP at time of signing. See PrefName.TreatPlanSaveSignedToPdf

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlan.TPStatus
member.summary: Determines the type of treatment plan this is. 0 - Saved, 1 - Active, 2 - Inactive.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlan.SecUserNumEntry
member.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlan.SecDateEntry
member.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change. The actual date of entry.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlan.SecDateTEdit
member.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates. Not user editable with the UI.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlan.UserNumPresenter
member.summary: The user that will present the treatment plan. Defaults to the user that entered the treatment plan, but can be changed with the TreatPlanPresenterEdit permission.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlan.ListProcTPs
member.summary: Used to pass the list of ProcTPs in memory with the TreatPlan.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlanStatus
member.summary: 0 - Saved, 1 - Active, 2 - Inactive

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlanStatus.Saved
member.summary: 0 - Saved treatment plans. Prior to version 15.4.1 all treatment plans were considered archived. Archived TPs are linked to ProcTPs.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlanStatus.Active
member.summary: 1 - Current active TP. There should be only one Active TP per patient. This is a TP linked directly to procedures via the TreatPlanAttach table.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.TreatPlanStatus.Inactive
member.summary: 2 - Current inactive TP. This is a TP linked directly to procedures via the TreatPlanAttach table.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Userod
member.summary: (User OD since "user" is a reserved word) Users are a completely separate entity from Providers and Employees even though they can be linked. A usernumber can never be changed, ensuring a permanent way to record database entries and leave an audit trail. A user can be a provider, employee, or neither.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Userod.UserNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Userod.Password
member.summary: The password hash, not the actual password. If no password has been entered, then this will be blank.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Userod.UserGroupNum
member.summary: FK to usergroup.UserGroupNum. Every user belongs to exactly one user group. The usergroup determines the permissions.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Userod.EmployeeNum
member.summary: FK to employee.EmployeeNum. Cannot be used if provnum is used. Used for timecards to block access by other users.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Userod.ClinicNum
member.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Default clinic for this user. It causes new patients to default to this clinic when entered by this user. If 0, then user has no default clinic or default clinic is HQ if clinics are enabled.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Userod.ProvNum
member.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Cannot be used if EmployeeNum is used. It is possible to have multiple userods attached to a single provider.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Userod.IsHidden
member.summary: Set true to hide user from login list.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Userod.TaskListInBox
member.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum. 0 if no inbox setup yet. It is assumed that the TaskList is in the main trunk, but this is not strictly enforced. User can't delete an attached TaskList, but they could move it.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Userod.AnesthProvType
member.summary: Defaults to 3 (regular user) unless specified. Helps populates the Anesthetist, Surgeon, Assistant and Circulator dropdowns properly on FormAnestheticRecord///

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Userod.DefaultHidePopups
member.summary: If set to true, the BlockSubsc button will start out pressed for this user.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Userod.PasswordIsStrong
member.summary: Gets set to true if strong passwords are turned on, and this user changes their password to a strong password. We don't store actual passwords, so this flag is the only way to tell.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Userod.ClinicIsRestricted
member.summary: Only used when userod.ClinicNum is set to not be zero. Prevents user from having access to other clinics.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Userod.InboxHidePopups
member.summary: If set to true, the BlockInbox button will start out pressed for this user.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Userod.UserNumCEMT
member.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. The user num within the Central Manager database. Only editable via CEMT. Can change when CEMT syncs.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Userod._eServiceType
member.summary: Enum representing what eService this user is a "phantom" user for. This variable is to be ignored for serialization and was made private to emphasize the fact that it should not be a db column. Mainly used to not have Security.IsAuthorized() checks throw exceptions due to a null Userod when the eServices are calling S class methods. Currently only used to grant eServices access to certain methods that would otherwise reject it due to permissions.

member.name: P:OpenDentBusiness.Userod.EServiceType
member.summary: All valid users should NOT set this value to anything other than None otherwise permission checking will act unexpectedly. Programmatically set this value from the init method of the corresponding eService. Helps prevent unhandled exceptions. Custom property only meant to be used via eServices. Not a column in db. Not to be used in middle tier environment.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.Userod.EServiceTypes
member.summary: EServiceType specifically for Userods so it is purposefully not added to the namespace.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.Userod.EServiceTypes.None
member.summmary: Not an eService user. All valid users should be this type otherwise permission checking will act differently.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.UserGroup
member.summary: A group of users. Security permissions are determined by the usergroup of a user.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.UserGroup.UserGroupNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.UserGroup.UserGroupNumCEMT
member.summary: FK to usergroup.UserGroupNum. The user group num within the Central Manager database. Only editable via CEMT. Can change when CEMT syncs.

member.summary: Description.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.UserQuery.FileName
member.summary: The name of the file to export to.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.UserQuery.QueryText
member.summary: The text of the query.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.ZipCode

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.X12object
member.summary: Encapsulates one entire X12 Interchange object, including multiple functional groups and transaction sets. It does not care what type of transactions are contained. It just stores them. It does not inherit either. It is up to other classes to use this as needed.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.X12object.FilePath
member.summary: External reference to the file corresponding to this X12 object.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.X12object.DateInterchange
member.summary: The date and time this X12 object was created by the sender. Relative to sender's time zone.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.X12object.Separators
member.summary: usually *,:,and ~

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.X12object.FunctGroups
member.summary: A collection of X12FunctionalGroups.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.X12object.Segments
member.summary: All segments for the entiremessage.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12object.ToX12object(System.String)
member.summary: Returns null if the messageText is not X12 or if messageText could not be parsed.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12object.#ctor
member.summary: This override is never explicitly used.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12object.#ctor(OpenDentBusiness.X12object)
member.summary: The new X12object will point to the same data as the x12other. This is for efficiency and to save memory. Be careful.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12object.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Takes raw text and converts it into an X12Object.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12object.GetFormat
member.summary: Example of values returned: 004010X097A1 (4010 dental), 005010X222A1 (5010 medical), 005010X223A2 (5010 institutional), 005010X224A2 (5010 dental)

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12object.IsFormat4010
member.summary: Returns true if the X12 object is in 4010 format.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12object.IsFormat5010
member.summary: Returns true if the X12 object is in 5010 format.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12object.IsAckInterchange
member.summary: Returns true if there is a TA1 segment. The TA1 segment is neither mandated or prohibited (see 277.pdf pg. 207). The Inmidiata clearinghouse likes to use TA1 segments to replace the usual acknowledgements (format ISA-TA1-IEA).

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12object.GetTranSetIds
member.summary: Returns the list of unique transaction set identifiers within the X12.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12object.GetNextSegmentById(System.Int32,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: The startIndex is zero-based. The segmentId is case sensitive. If arrayElement01Values is specified, then will only return segments where the segment.Get(1) returns one of the specified values. Returns null if no segment is found.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12object.ReconstructRaw(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Removes the specified segments and recreates the raw X12 from the remaining segments. Useful for modifying X12 reports which have been partially processed in order to keep track of which parts have not been processed. Certain X12 documents also require the segment count as part of the message (ex 5010 SE segment). This function does not modify total segment count within the message.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.X12FunctionalGroup
member.summary: GS/GE combination. Contained within an interchange control combination (ISA/IEA). Contains at least one transaction (ST/SE).

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.X12FunctionalGroup.Transactions
member.summary: A collection of X12Transactions

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.X12FunctionalGroup.Header
member.summary: The segment that identifies this functional group

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12FunctionalGroup.#ctor(OpenDentBusiness.X12Segment)
member.summary: Supply the functional group header(GS) when creating this object.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.X12Transaction
member.summary: ST/SE combination. Containted within functional group (GS/GE). In claims, there will be one transaction per carrier.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.X12Transaction.Segments
member.summary: A collection of all the X12Segments for this transaction, in the order they originally appeared.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.X12Transaction.Header
member.summary: The segment that identifies this functional group

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12Transaction.#ctor(OpenDentBusiness.X12Segment)
member.summary: Supply the transaction header(ST) when creating this object.

member.name: T:OpenDentBusiness.X12Segment
member.summary: An X12 segment is a single row of the text file.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.X12Segment.SegmentID
member.summary: Usually 2 or 3 letters. Can also be found at Elements[0].

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.X12Segment.SegmentIndex
member.summary: The zero-based segment index within the X12 document.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12Segment.#ctor
member.summary: The segment will represent an invalid segment or end of file segment. Useful to escape X12 loops which require a segment to be present. The SegmentID will be set to "INVALID", because this string will never match a real segment ID (real segment IDs are 3 characters)

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12Segment.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this segement

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12Segment.Get(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the string representation of the given element within this segment. If the element does not exist, as can happen with optional elements, then "" is returned.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12Segment.Get(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the string representation of the given element,subelement within this segment. If the element or subelement does not exist, as can happen with optional elements, then "" is returned. Subelement is 1-based, just like the x12 specs.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12Segment.IsType(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: True if the segment matches the specified segmentId, and the first element of the segment is one of the specified values.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.X12Segment.AssertType(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Verifies the segment matches the specified segmentId, and the first element of the segment is one of the specified values.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XmlConverter._charTab
member.summary: Chars from (char)0 through (char)0x19 (31) are the first 32 characters and are reserved control chars. The exceptions are (char)0x9, a tab, (char)0xA (10), a line feed, and (char)0xD (13), a carriage return. We will manually escape line feeds and carriage returns so they aren't converted to \r\n's for us, but we will leave tab chars.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XmlConverter._charSpace
member.summary: _charSpace (0x20=32=Space Character), which is the first non-control char that is a valid xml char. The range from _charSpace (0x20=32) through _charSurr (0xD7FF=55295) inclusive are all allowed for xml.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XmlConverter._charLCurly
member.summary: The pipe or vertical line character (0x7C=124=Pipe ('|') Character) is a valid xml char, but we are using it to deliniate table cells in order to make our tables smaller xml packages. We will consider it an invalid char and manually escape it in strings. That way any |'s in the xml are guaranteed to be delimiters for a table that were manually placed after escaping. We split by |'s and then unescape the cell data on the receiving end when processing a table as xml. Characters from _charSpace through _charLCurly inclusive are valid xml chars.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XmlConverter._charRCurly
member.summary: Characters from _charRCurly through _charSurr inclusive are valid xml chars.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XmlConverter._charSurr
member.summary: Chars greater than _charSurr (0xD7FF=55295) and less than _charPrivFirst (0xE000=57344) are invalid for xml and must be either removed or manually escaped/handled before xml serialization. They are 0xD800-0xDB7F - High Surrogates, 0xDB80-0xDBFF - High Private Use Surrogates, and 0xDC00-0xDFFF - Low Surrogates.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XmlConverter._charPrivFirst
member.summary: Chars from _charPrivFirst (0xE000=57344=Private Use, First) through _charRepl (0xFFFD=65533=Replacement Character) inclusive are legal xml characters.

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XmlConverter._charRepl
member.summary: Chars greater than _charRepl (0xFFFD=65533=Replacement Character), explicitly 0xFFFE=65534 and 0xFFFF=65535, are invalid. (Chars max out at 0xFFFF)

member.name: F:OpenDentBusiness.XmlConverter._xmlEscapeStrings
member.summary: This array is filled with 65,536 chars as strings. The int index in the array is the int value of the char (as a string) in the array. Example: _xmlEscapeStrings[97]=((char)97).ToString()="a".

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.XmlConverter.Serialize``1(``0)
member.summary: Should accept any type, including simple types, OD types, Arrays, Lists, and arrays of DtoObject. But not DataTable or DataSet. If we find a type that isn't supported, then we need to add it.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.XmlConverter.Serialize(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: For late binding of class type.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.XmlConverter.XmlEscapeRecursion(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Escapes any chars for xml within the string fields and properties of an object. If the object is a list or an array of objects, recursively searches the items looking for string fields and properties to escape for xml.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.XmlConverter.XmlUnescapeRecursion(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Un-escapes any chars from xml within the string fields and properties of an object. If the object is a list or an array of objects, recursively searches the items looking for string fields and properties to un-escape from xml.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.XmlConverter.Deserialize``1(System.String)
member.summary: Should accept any type. Tested types include System types, OD types, Arrays, Lists, arrays of DtoObject, null DataObjectBase, null arrays, null Lists. But not DataTable or DataSet. If we find a type that isn't supported, then we need to add it. Types that are currently unsupported include Arrays of DataObjectBase that contain a null. Lists that contain nulls are untested and may be an issue for DataObjectBase.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.XmlConverter.TableToXml(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Serializes a DataTable by looping through the rows and columns.

member.name: M:OpenDentBusiness.XmlConverter.XmlEscape(System.String)
member.summary: Escapes common characters used in XML from myString. Also escapes any characters that are invalid for use in XML with an escape sequence of the pattern "&#"+(int)char+";" (ampersand+hash+the unicode int (not hex) value of the char+semicolon)

member.name: M:WindowsTime.SetTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Set the windows system time.

member.name: T:WebServiceSerializer.WebSerializer
member.summary: Used to serialize primitives for WebServiceCustUpdates I/O.

member.name: F:WebServiceSerializer.WebSerializer._cellDelimiterPlaceHolder
member.summary: If the delimiter character is found in a given cell, then the cell's value will be updated to include the place holder value in lieu of the delimiter. This ensures that the delimiter is reserved for only delimiting cells. The place holder will be replaced by the delimiter value on the other end once the cells have been properly delimited.

member.name: F:WebServiceSerializer.WebSerializer._cellDelimiter
member.summary: This value is reserved strictly for delimiting cells in a serialized data row.

member.name: T:WebServiceSerializer.POut
member.summary: Converts various datatypes into strings formatted correctly for MySQL. "P" was originally short for Parameter because this class was written specifically to replace parameters in the mysql queries. Using strings instead of parameters is much easier to debug. This will later be rewritten as a System.IConvertible interface on custom mysql types. I would rather not ever depend on the mysql connector for this so that this program remains very db independent. Marked internal so it doesn't get mistaken or misused in place of OpenDentBusiness.POut.

member.name: M:WebServiceSerializer.POut.PDateT(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Always encapsulates the result, depending on the current database connection.

member.name: M:WebServiceSerializer.POut.PDate(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Converts a date to yyyy-MM-dd format which is the format required by MySQL. myDate is the date you want to convert. encapsulate is true for the first overload, making the result look like this: 'yyyy-MM-dd' for MySQL.

member.name: M:WebServiceSerializer.POut.PSound(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified wav file into a string representation. The timing of this is a little different than with the other "P" functions and is only used by the import button in FormSigElementDefEdit. After that, the wav spends the rest of it's life as a string until "played" or exported.

member.name: M:WebServiceSerializer.POut.Base64(System.String)
member.summary: The supplied string should already be in safe base64 format, and should not need any special escaping. The purpose of this function is to enforce that the supplied string meets these requirements. This is done quickly.

member.name: T:WebServiceSerializer.PIn
member.summary: Converts strings coming in from the database into the appropriate type. "P" was originally short for Parameter because this class was written specifically to replace parameters in the mysql queries. Using strings instead of parameters is much easier to debug. This will later be rewritten as a System.IConvertible interface on custom mysql types. I would rather not ever depend on the mysql connector for this so that this program remains very db independent. Marked internal so it doesn't get mistaken or misused in place of OpenDentBusiness.PIn.

member.name: M:WebServiceSerializer.PIn.PDouble(System.String)
member.summary: If blank or invalid, returns 0. Otherwise, parses.

member.name: M:WebServiceSerializer.PIn.PString(System.String)
member.summary: Currently does nothing.

member.name: M:WebServiceSerializer.PIn.PSound(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Saves the string representation of a sound into a .wav file. The timing of this is different than with the other "P" functions, and is only used by the export button in FormSigElementDefEdit

member.summary: Order Control Code. We only use RE. OID:2.16.840.1.113883.12.119 HL70369 code:HL70119. Source phinvads.cdc.gov

member.name: T:EhrLaboratories.HL70125
member.summary:
Value Type. OID:2.16.840.1.113883.12.125 HL70369 code:HL70125. Source HL7 2.5.1 Labratory Reporting Interface documentation.
This enum is also used in FormPatListElementEditEHR2014.cs and assumes the order of this enum does not change. If it does, the combo box filled with these values must also be updated.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70125.CE
member.summary:
0 - Coded Entry.
Usage: R
Comment: When sending text data in OBX-5, use either the ST, TX or FT data types.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70125.CWE
member.summary:
1 - Coded with Exceptions.
Usage: R
Data Type Flavor: CWE_CRO
Comment: Data type to be used where it is important to communicate the coding system and coding system version with the coded result being reported. Pre-adopted from Version 2.6. This Implementation Guide has specially constrained versions of the CWE data type in Section 2.2 through 2.4. The CWE_CR format shall be used for OBX-5. When sending text data in OBX-5, use either the ST, TX or FT data types.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70125.DT
member.summary:
2 - Date.
Usage: R

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70125.FT
member.summary:
3 - Formatted Text (Display).
Usage: R
Comment: Field using the FT data type to carry a text result value. This is intended for display. The text may contain formatting escape sequences as described in the data types section. Numeric results and numeric results with units of measure should not be reported as text. These should be reported as NM or SN numeric results, with the units of measure in OBX-6.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70125.NM
member.summary:
4 - Numeric.
Usage: R
Comment: Field using the NM data type to carry a numeric result value. The only non-numeric characters allowed in this field are a leading plus (+) or minus (-) sign. The structured numeric (SN) data type should be used for conveying inequalities, ranges, ratios, etc. The units for the numeric value should be reported in OBX-6.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70125.SN
member.summary:
5 - Structured Numeric.
Usage: R
Comment: Field using the SN data type to carry a structured numeric result value. Structured numeric include intervals (^0^-^1), ratios (^1^/^2 or ^1^: ^2), inequalities (<^10), or categorical results (2^+). The units for the structured numeric value should be reported in OBX-6.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70125.ST
member.summary:
6 - String Data.
Usage: R
Comment: Field using the ST data type to carry a short text result value. Numeric results and numeric results with units of measure should not be reported as text. These shall be reported as NM or SN numeric results, with the units of measure in OBX-6.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70125.TM
member.summary:
7 - Time.
Usage: R
Comment: The timezone offset shall adhere to the use of the TimeZone Offset profile.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70125.TS
member.summary:
8 - Time Stamp (Date and Time).
Usage: R
Data Type Flavor: TS_0
Comment: The timezone offset shall adhere to the use of the TimeZone Offset profile and associated discussion if the granularity involves hh or more.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70125.TX
member.summary:
9 - Text Data (Display).
Usage: R
Comment: Field using the TX data type to carry a text result value this is intended for display. Numeric results and numeric results with units of measure should not be reported as text. These should be reported as NM or SN numeric results, with the units of measure in OBX-6.

member.name: T:EhrLaboratories.HL70078
member.summary: Abnormal Flags. OID:2.16.840.1.113883.12.78 HL70369 code:HL70078. Source phinvads.cdc.gov

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70078.A
member.summary:
0 - Abnormal
Applies to non-numeric results.

member.summary: 1 - Above absolute high-off instrument scale. Actual value is ">" but symbol cannot be used as an enum value.

member.summary: 2 - Above high normal

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70078.HH
member.summary: 3 - Above upper panic limits

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70078._lt
member.summary: 4 - Below absolute low-off instrument scale. Actual value is "<" but symbol cannot be used as an enum value.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70078.L
member.summary: 5 - Below low normal

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70078.LL
member.summary: 6 - Below lower panic limits

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70078.B
member.summary:
7 - Better
Use when direction not relevant.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70078.I
member.summary:
8 - Intermediate
Indicates for microbiology susceptibilities only.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70078.MS
member.summary:
9 - Moderately susceptible
Indicates for microbiology susceptibilities only

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70078._null
member.summary: 10 - No range defined, or normal ranges don't apply. Actual value is "null" but is a reserved word in c#

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70078.N
member.summary:
11 - Normal
Applies to non-numeric results.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70078.R
member.summary:
12 - Resistant
Indicates for microbiology susceptibilities only.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70078.D
member.summary: 13 - Significant change down

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70078.U
member.summary: 14 - Significant change up

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70078.S
member.summary:
15 - Susceptible
Indicates for microbiology susceptibilities only.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70078.AA
member.summary:
16 - Very abnormal
Applies to non-numeric units, analogous to panic limits for numeric units.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70078.VS
member.summary:
17 - Very susceptible
Indicates for microbiology susceptibilities only.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70078.W
member.summary:
18 - Worse
Use when direction not relevant.

member.name: T:EhrLaboratories.HL70085
member.summary: Observation Result Status. OID:2.16.840.1.113883.12.85 HL70369 code:HL70085. Source phinvads.cdc.gov

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70085.D
member.summary: 0 - Deletes the OBX record

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70085.F
member.summary: 1 - Final results; Can only be changed with a corrected result.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70085.N
member.summary: 2 - Not asked; used to affirmatively document that the observation identified in the OBX was not sought when the universal service ID in OBR-4 implies that it would be sought.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70085.O
member.summary: 3 - Order detail description only (no result)

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70085.S
member.summary: 4 - Partial results

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70085.W
member.summary: 5 - Post original as wrong, e.g., transmitted for wrong patient

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70085.P
member.summary: 6 - Preliminary results

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70085.C
member.summary: 7 - Record coming over is a correction and thus replaces a final result

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70085.X
member.summary: 8 - Results cannot be obtained for this observation

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70085.R
member.summary: 9 - Results entered -- not verified

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70085.U
member.summary: 10 - Results status change to final without retransmitting results already sent as _preliminary._ E.g., radiology changes status from preliminary to final

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70085.I
member.summary: 11 - Specimen in lab; results pending

member.name: T:EhrLaboratories.HL70123
member.summary: Result Status. OID:2.16.840.1.113883.12.123 HL70369 code:HL70123. Source HL7 2.5.1 Labratory Reporting Interface documentation.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70123.A
member.summary: 0 - Some but not all results available.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70123.C
member.summary: 1 - Correction to results.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70123.F
member.summary: 2 - Final Results; results stored and verified. Can only be changed with a corrected result.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70123.I
member.summary: 3 - No results available; specimen received, procedure incomplete.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70123.O
member.summary: 4 - Order received; specimen not yet received.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70123.P
member.summary: 5 - Preliminary: A verified early result is available, final results not yet obtained.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70123.R
member.summary: 6 - Results stored; not yet verified.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70123.S
member.summary: 7 - No results available; procedure scheduled but not done.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70123.X
member.summary: 8 - No results available; Order canceled.

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70369.CAPECC
member.summary:
17 - College of American Pathologists Electronic Cancer Checklist
Source:Each code in this system represents a single line in a database template for the College of American Pathologists Electronic Cancer Checklist (CAP eCC). Each line and its code corresponds to either a question or an answer selection. The code is in a decimal format of #########.#########, where each "#" is an optional number. The nine digits to the right of the Ckey decimal point make up a namespace identifier, which is specific to the center that created the database entries for the checklist line items with their unique Ckey values. The namespace identifier for SNOMED Terminology Solutions at the College of American Pathologists is 1000043. All Ckey values in the 2008 release use namespace 1000043. The digits to the left of the decimal point are a locally assigned sequential key for the ChecklistTemplateItems table in the local CAP eCC database. These codes are used to specify questions and answers selected in a CAP eCC template for transmission in an HL7 message, as defined by the NAACCR Pathology Workgroup and the CDC/NPCR Reporting Pathology Protocols II (RPP II) project. SNOMED Terminology Solutions, College of American Pathologists, 325 Waukegan Road, Northfield, Illinois, 60093, snomedsolutions@cap.org
Category:Specific, Non-drug code
Status:New

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70369.CAS
member.summary:
18 - Chemical abstract codes
Source:These include unique codes for each unique chemical, including all generic drugs. The codes do not distinguish among different dosing forms. When multiple equivalent CAS numbers exist, use the first one listed in USAN. USAN 1990 and the USP dictionary of drug names, William M. Heller, Ph.D., Executive Editor, United States Pharmacopeial Convention, Inc., 12601 Twinbrook Parkway, Rockville, MD 20852.
Category:Drug code
Status:Active

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70369.CCC
member.summary:
19 - Clinical Care Classification system
Source:Clinical Care Classification System (formerly Home Health Care Classification system) codes. The Clinical Care Classification (CCC) consists of two terminologies: CCC of Nursing Diagnoses and CCC of Nursing Interventions both of which are classified by 21 Care Components. Virginia Saba, EdD, RN; Georgetown University School of Nursing; Washington, DC.
Category:Specific Non-Drug Code
Status:Active

Source:International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 2nd Edition. World Health Organization: Geneva, Switzerland, 1990. Order from: College of American Pathologists, 325 Waukegan Road, Northfield, IL, 60093-2750. (847) 446-8800.
Category:Specific Non-Drug Code

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70369.ICDO2
member.summary:
89 - International Classification of Disease for Oncology Second Edition
Source:Percy C, VanHolten V, and Muir C, editors. International Classification of Diseases for Oncology. Second Edition. Geneva: World Health Organization; 1990. The ICD-9 neoplasm structure did not include morphology and there was a growing interest by physicians to establish a coding system for morphology. ICD-O is used in cancer registries (and other related areas) for coding the topography (site) and morphology of a neoplasm. The topography code uses similar categories as ICD-10 for malignant neoplasms allowing greater specificity for the site of non-malignant neoplasms than in ICD-10. The topography code consists of an alphabetic character (the letter C) followed by two numeric digits, a decimal point, and a numeric digit. The morphology code consists of a 6-digit numeric code which consists of three parts: histologic type (4-digit), behavior code (1-digit), and grading or differentiation (1-digit). ICD-O-2 is used for tumors diagnosed prior to 2001.
Category:Specific Non-Drug Code
Status:New

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70369.ICDO3
member.summary:
90 - International Classification of Disease for Oncology Third Edition
Source:Fritz A, Percy C, Jack A, Shanmugaratnam K, Sobin L, Parkin D, et al, editors. International Classification of Diseases for Oncology. Third Edition. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2000. The ICD-9 neoplasm structure did not include morphology and there was a growing interest by physicians to establish a coding system for morphology. ICD-O is used in cancer registries (and other related areas) for coding the topography (site) and morphology of a neoplasm. The topography code uses similar categories as ICD-10 for malignant neoplasms allowing greater specificity for the site of non-malignant neoplasms than in ICD-10. The topography code consists of an alphabetic character (the letter C) followed by two numeric digits, a decimal point, and a numeric digit. The morphology code consists of a 6-digit numeric code which consists of three parts: histologic type, behavior code, and grading or differentiation. In the third edition the morphology codes were revised, especially for leukemias and lymphomas. ICD-O-3 is used for tumors diagnosed in 2001 and later.
Category:Specific Non-Drug Code
Status:New

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70369.ICF
member.summary:
91 - International Classification of Functioning, Disability and Health (ICF)
Source:ICF is a classification of those characteristics of health involving functional impairments, activity limitations, or participation restrictions that are often associated with disability. The ICF classification complements the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases-10th Revision (ICD), which contains information on diagnosis and health condition, but not on functional status. The ICD and ICF constitute the core classifications in the WHO Family of International Classifications (WHO-FIC). Additional information is available at: http://www.cdc.gov/nchs/icd/icf.htm.
Category:Specific Non-Drug Code
Status:Active

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70369.ISO4217
member.summary:
97 - ISO4217 Currency Codes
Source:ISO's currency codes, which are based on the ISO country codes are published in the standard ISO 4217:2008 Codes for the representation of currencies and funds. This International Standard specifies the structure for a three-letter alphabetic code and an equivalent three-digit numeric code for the representation of currencies and funds. For those currencies having minor units, it also shows the decimal relationship between such units and the currency itself.
Category:Financial
Status:New

member.summary:

ISO 639-3, Codes for the representation of names of languages - Part 3: Alpha-3 code for comprehensive coverage of languages, is a code list that aims to define three-letter identifiers for all known human languages.

Status:New

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70369.LN
member.summary:
108 - Logical Observation Identifier Names and Codes (LOINC)
Source:Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) provides a set of universal codes and names for identifying laboratory and other clinical observations. One of the main goals of LOINC is to facilitate the exchange and pooling of results for clinical care, outcomes management, and research. LOINC was initiated by Regenstrief Institute research scientists who continue to develop it with the collaboration of the LOINC Committee. The LOINC table, LOINC codes, and LOINC panels and forms file are copyright 1995-2011, Regenstrief Institute, Inc. and the LOINC Committee and available at no cost (http://loinc.org) under the license at http://loinc.org/terms-of-use. The laboratory portion of the LOINC database contains the usual clinical laboratory categories of chemistry, hematology, serology, microbiology (including parasitology and virology), toxicology; as well as categories for drugs and the cell counts, antibiotic susceptibilities, and more. The clinical portion of the LOINC database includes entries for vital signs, hemodynamics, intake/output, EKG, obstetric ultrasound, cardiac echo, radiology report titles, pulmonary ventilator management, document and section titles, patient assessment instruments (e.g. Glascow Coma Score, PHQ-9 depression scale, CMS-required patient assessment instruments), and other clinical observations.
Category:Specific Non-Drug Code
Status:Active

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70369.NAICS
member.summary:
119 - Industry (NAICS)
Source:The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) consists of a set of six digit codes that classify and categorize industries. It also organizes the categories on a production/process-oriented basis. This new, uniform, industry-wide classification system has been designed as the index for statistical reporting of all economic activities of the U.S., Canada, and Mexico. Mapping is available between SIC 1987 and NAICS 2002 codes at U.S. Census Bureau website. Mapping is also available between NAICS 2002 and NAICS 2007 at U.S. Census Bureau website
Category:Demographic Code
Status:New

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70369.NCPDPnnnnsss
member.summary:
120 - NCPDP code list for data element nnnn [as used in segment sss]
Source:NCPDP maintain code list associated with the specified Data Element (nnnn) and Segment (sss). The Segment portion is optional if there is no specialization of the Data Element codes between segments. Examples: NCPDP1131RES = code set defined for NCPDP data element 1131 as used in the RES segment (Code List Qualifier Response Code) NCPDP1131STS = code set defined for NCPDP data element 1131 as used in the STS segment (Code List Qualifier Reject Code) NCPDP9701 = code set defined for NCPDP data element 9701 (Individual Relationship, Coded). No specialization to a segment exists for this data element. National Council for Prescription Drug Programs, 924 East Raintree Drive, Scottsdale, AZ 8526. Phone: (48) 477-1 Fax: (48) 767-142 e-mail: ncpdp@ncpdp.org www.ncpdp.org

Status:Active

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70369.RXNORM
member.summary:
154 - RxNorm
Source:RxNorm provides standard names for clinical drugs (active ingredient + strength + dose form) and for dose forms as administered to a patient. It provides links from clinical drugs, both branded and generic, to their active ingredients, drug components (active ingredient + strength), and related brand names. NDCs (National Drug Codes) for specific drug products (where there are often many NDC codes for a single product) are linked to that product in RxNorm. RxNorm links its names to many of the drug vocabularies commonly used in pharmacy management and drug interaction software, including those of First Databank, Micromedex, MediSpan, and Multum. By providing links between these vocabularies, RxNorm can mediate messages between systems not using the same software and vocabulary.RxNorm is one of a suite of designated standards for use in U.S. Federal Government systems for the electronic exchange of clinical health information.
Category:Drug Code
Status:New

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70369.W1
member.summary:
178 - WHO record # drug codes (6 digit)
Source:World Health organization record number code. A unique sequential number is assigned to each unique single component drug and to each multi-component drug. Eight digits are allotted to each such code, six to identify the active agent, and 2 to identify the salt, of single content drugs. Six digits are assigned to each unique combination of drugs in a dispensing unit. The six digit code is identified by W1, the 8 digit code by W2.
Category:Drug code
Status:Active

member.name: F:EhrLaboratories.HL70369.W2

Six digits are assigned to each unique combination of drugs in a dispensing unit. The six digit code is identified by W1, the 8 digit code by W2.
Category:Drug code
Status:Active

member.name: T:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid
member.summary: A new and improved grid control to replace the inherited ContrTable that is used so extensively in the program.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.components
member.summary: Required designer variable.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.GridH
member.summary: The total height of the grid.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.GridW
member.summary: The total width of the grid.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid._rowHeights
member.summary: This array has one element for each row. For each row, it keeps track of the vertical height of the row in pixels, not counting the note portion of the row.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.NoteHeights
member.summary: This array has one element for each row. For each row, it keeps track of the vertical height of only the note portion of the row in pixels. Usually 0, unless you want notes showing.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.RowLocs
member.summary: (NOT used for sheet grids, use PrintRows.) This array has one element for each row. For each row, it keeps track of the vertical location at which to start drawing this row in pixels. This makes it much easier to paint rows.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.ColPos
member.summary: Set at the very beginning of OnPaint. Uses the ColWidth of each column to set up this array with one element for each column. Contains the columns Pos for that column.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.sortedByColumnIdx
member.summary: Typically -1 to show no triangle. Or, specify a column to show a triangle. The actual sorting happens at mouse down.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.sortedIsAscending
member.summary: True to show a triangle pointing up. False to show a triangle pointing down. Only works if sortedByColumnIdx is not -1.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.NoteRemaining
member.summary: If we are part way through drawing a note when we reach the end of a page, this will contain the remainder of the note still to be printed. If it is empty string, then we are not in the middle of a note.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.widthHidden
member.summary: Holds the amount of the grid that is hidden due to the user making the window too small. We need to keep track of this so that when they resize the window the scroll bar will become visible again.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.HasEditableColumn
member.summary: Is set when ComputeRows is called, then used . If any columns are editable HasEditableColumn is true.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.PrintRows
member.summary: Currently only used for printing on sheets.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.TopMargin
member.summary: Used when calculating printed row positions. Set to 0 when using in FormSheetFillEdit.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.BottomMargin
member.summary: Used when calculating printed row positions. Set to 0 when using in FormSheetFillEdit.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.YPosField
member.summary: (Printing Only) The position on the page that this grid will print. If this is halfway down the second page, 1100px tall, this value should be 1650, not 550.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid._printHeight
member.summary: Height of field when printing. Set using CalculateHeights() from EndUpdate()

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid._noteLengthLimit
member.summary: Truncates the note to this many characters.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid._threadDistinctClickEvents
member.summary: Thread to read inputs on grid. Currently only used for mouse click logic.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid._mouseClickIdx
member.summary: Set to -1 if no mouse down event has happened recently. Otherwise set to the row the single click event occurred at. Only used for click logic. See MouseDownRow also.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid._mouseClickCount
member.summary: Only used for mouse click logic.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid._dateTimeMouseClick
member.summary: Only used for mouse click logic. The time which the first mouse click occurred so we can determine if double clicking.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.PrintHeight
member.summary: Height of field when printing. Set using CalculateHeights() from EndUpdate()

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.HasMultilineHeaders
member.summary: Allow Headers to be multiple lines tall.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.Columns
member.summary: Gets the collection of ODGridColumns assigned to the ODGrid control.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.Rows
member.summary: Gets the collection of ODGridRows assigned to the ODGrid control.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.Title
member.summary: The title of the grid which shows across the top.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.HScrollVisible
member.summary: Set true to show a horizontal scrollbar. Vertical scrollbar always shows, but is disabled if not needed. If hScroll is not visible, then grid will auto reset width to match width of columns.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.ScrollToIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: The index of the row that is the first row displayed on the ODGrid. Also sets ScrollValue.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.ScrollToIndexBottom(System.Int32)
member.summary: The index of the row that is the last row to be displayed on the ODGrid. Also sets ScrollValue.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.ScrollValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the vertical scrollbar. Does all error checking and invalidates.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.SelectedIndices
member.summary: Holds the int values of the indices of the selected rows. To set selected indices, use SetSelected().

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.SelectedCell
member.summary: Holds the x,y values of the selected cell if in OneCell mode. -1,-1 represents no cell selected.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.TranslationName
member.summary: Uniquely identifies the grid for translation to another language.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.SelectedRowColor
member.summary: The background color that is used for selected rows.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.HeaderColor
member.summary: The background color that is used for selected rows.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.WrapText
member.summary: Text within each cell will wrap, making some rows taller.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.NoteSpanStart
member.summary: The starting column for notes on each row. Notes are not part of the main row, but are displayed on subsequent lines.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.NoteSpanStop
member.summary: The starting column for notes on each row. Notes are not part of the main row, but are displayed on subsequent lines. If this remains 0, then notes will be entirey skipped for this grid.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.WidthAllColumns
member.summary: Used when drawing to PDF. We need the width of all columns summed.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.AllowSortingByColumn
member.summary: Set true to allow user to click on column headers to sort rows, alternating between ascending and descending.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.EditableAcceptsCR
member.summary: Only affects grids with editable columns. True allows carriage returns within cells. Falses causes carriage returns to go to the next editable cell.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.UseBlueTheme
member.summary: Container sets this for all grids simultaneously.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.SortedIsAscending
member.summary: Returns current sort order. Used to maintain current grid sorting when refreshing the grid.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.SortedByColumnIdx
member.summary: Returns current sort column index. Used to maintain current grid sorting when refreshing the grid.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.ComputeColumns
member.summary: Computes the position of each column and the overall width. Called from endUpdate and also from OnPaint.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.ComputeRows(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called from PrintPage() and EndUpdate(). After adding rows to the grid, this calculates the height of each row because some rows may have text wrap and will take up more than one row. Also, rows with notes, must be made much larger, because notes start on the second line. If column images are used, rows will be enlarged to make space for the images.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.ComputePrintRows
member.summary: Fills PrintRows with row information.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.PointToRow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns row. -1 if no valid row. Supply the y position in pixels.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.PointToCol(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns col. Supply the x position in pixels. -1 if no valid column.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.OnPaint(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Runs any time the control is invalidated.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.DrawBackG(System.Drawing.Graphics)
member.summary: Draws a solid gray background.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.DrawRows(System.Drawing.Graphics)
member.summary: Draws the background, lines, and text for all rows that are visible.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.DrawRow(System.Int32,System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Font)
member.summary: Draws background, lines, image, and text for a single row.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.DrawOutline(System.Drawing.Graphics)
member.summary: Draws outline around entire control.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Call this before adding any rows. You would typically call Rows.Clear after this.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.EndUpdate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Must be called after adding rows. This computes the columns, computes the rows, lays out the scrollbars, clears SelectedIndices, and invalidates. Does not zero out scrollVal. Sometimes, it seems like scrollVal needs to be reset somehow because it's an inappropriate number, and when you first grab the scrollbar, it jumps. No time to investigate.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.PrintPage(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: (Not used for sheet printing) If there are more pages to print, it returns -1. If this is the last page, it returns the yPos of where the printing stopped. Graphics will be paper, pageNumber resets some class level variables at page 0, bounds are used to contain the grid drawing, and marginTopFirstPage leaves room so as to not overwrite the title and subtitle.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.SetSelected(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Throws exceptions. Use to set a row selected or not. Can handle values outside the acceptable range.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.SetSelectedStrict(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Throws exceptions. Similar to SetSelected, except will also deselect any items not specified in iArray.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.SetSelected(System.Int32[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Throws exceptions. Allows setting multiple values all at once

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.SetSelected(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Throws exceptions. Sets all rows to specified value.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.SetSelected(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Throws exceptions.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.GetSelectedIndex
member.summary: If one row is selected, it returns the index to that row. If more than one row are selected, it returns the first selected row. Really only useful for SelectionMode.One. If no rows selected, returns -1.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.ScrollToEnd
member.summary: Usually called after entering a new list to automatically scroll to the end.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.SortForced(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set sortedByColIdx to -1 to clear sorting. Copied from SortByColumn. No need to call fill grid after calling this. Also used in PatientPortalManager.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.SortByColumn(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets run on mouse down on a column header.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.OnContextMenuChanged(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Several location throughout the program the context menu changes. This subscribes each menu to use the popup helper below.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.PopupHelper(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Just prior to displaying the context menu, add wiki links if neccesary.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.removeWikiMenu
member.summary: Removes wikiLinks from context menu.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.CreateComboBox
member.summary: Creates combo boxes in the appropriate location of the grid so users can select and change them.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.CreateEditBox
member.summary: When selection mode is OneCell, and user clicks in a column that isEditable, then this edit box will appear.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.OnMouseMove(System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: The purpose of this is to allow dragging to select multiple rows. Only makes sense if selectionMode==MultiExtended. Doesn't matter whether ctrl is down, because that only affects the mouse down event.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.Parent_KeyDown(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary: If the Ctrl key down is not being captured by the grid because it doesn't have focus, then this automatically handles it. The only thing you have to do to make it work is to turn on KeyPreview for the parent form.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.Parent_KeyUp(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary: If the Ctrl key down is not being captured by the grid because it doesn't have focus, then this automatically handles it. The only thing you have to do to make it work is to turn on KeyPreview for the parent form.

member.summary: The pdfSharp version of drawstring. g is used for measurement. scaleToPix scales xObjects to pixels.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.LineSpacingForFont(System.String)
member.summary: This line spacing is specifically picked to match the RichTextBox.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.p(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts pixels used by us to points used by PdfSharp.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ODGrid.p(System.Single)
member.summary: Converts pixels used by us to points used by PdfSharp.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODPrintRow.YPos
member.summary: YPos relative to top of entire grid. When printing this includes adjustments for page breaks. If row has title/header the title/header should be drawn at this position.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODPrintRow.IsTitleRow
member.summary: Usually only true for some grids, and only for the first row.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODPrintRow.IsHeaderRow
member.summary: Usually true if row is at the top of a new page, or when changing patients in a statement grid.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODPrintRow.IsBottomRow
member.summary: True for rows that require a bold bottom line, at end of entire grid, at page breaks, or at a separation in the grid.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.ODPrintRow.IsFooterRow
member.summary: Rarely true, usually only for last row in particular grids.

member.summary: Used to store any kind of object that is associated with the row.

member.name: P:OpenDental.UI.ODGridRow.Note
member.summary: This is a very special field. Since most of the tables in OD require the ability to attach long notes to each row, this field makes it possible. Any note set here will be drawn as a sort of subrow. The note can span multiple columns, as defined in grid.NoteSpanStart and grid.NoteSpanStop.
